Reviews.Title: “Magic Kingdom View”
Reviews.Author: justin_foster
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a proper villa (2BR with magic kingdom view), prior to this we had only stayed in studios on Disney property. The extra space was very welcome, as was the kitchen, laundry and Jacuzzi! We stayed on points and booked it the full 11 months out to make sure we would get the view and unit we wanted. We were at the far end of Magic Kingdom View and really pointed at the Contemporary but it proved to be still great for watching the fireworks. The kids loved seeing the monorails running back and forth, especially at night when it looked almost like a model train. We were hoping for an early check in but it ended up being only minutes till 4. Bell services had, without asking, put one of our grocery bags int he fridge saving us from spoiled food. That was a very welcome surprise. Bay lake tower itself is quite upscale. I personally like the decor, but I can see how others think it is not very family-friendly or very disney. Since the tower does not have much itself we spent a lot of time at the Contemporary. The pool and waterslide is good but lack much shade and is light on theming. The DVC only lounge at the top of the building came off very cold and uninviting. The best part by far is the proximity to the Magic Kingdom. It is no nice to avoid the crowds after the Main Street Electrical parade and make it back to our room to see Wishes. It is also very handy to grab a monorail ride to Epcot or one of the other resorts on the loop. I do wish there was a kids club somewhere in the Contemporary rather than going to the Poly or Grand Flo. Overall BLT is quite good, but could be better. You don't really feel 'transported' the way you do at other resorts, and it could have more for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: IIMFD
Reviews.Content: A short walk to and from the Magic Kingdom makes this place. The 2br suite with gorgeous lake views, full kitchen, three baths and fresh decor aren't bad either. The pool was always well guarded, clean and warm. We enjoyed the community room for arts and crafts for our older kids when the little ones napped. The room was a comfortable place to relax after a big day in the parks. The bay lake tower is very quiet and I didn't miss the hustle and bustle of a big lobby. The full service hotel was a quick walk away for food, shops and the monorail. Bus service to the other parks was surprising regular and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great location”
Reviews.Author: ash5213
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at Bay Lake on March 23-25th. We had a studio lake view on the fifth floor. We faced the Comtemporary and we were on the same floor as the skyway bridge. It was a fantastic location. My 2 year old could see so much from the balcony: the boats coming and going from the docks at the Contemporary, the flags on top of the Wilderness Lodge, the monorail going into and coming out of the Comtemporary, fireworks from Epcot, the nightly boat parade, the evening movie on the big screen down on the lawn, and the fire pit where people were roasting marshmallows provided by cast members. The room was great for our small family, but if we were staying longer than a long weekend we might want to upgrade to a one bedroom. Just because we have so much baby stuff and we had to use every inch of space. I really appreciated the extra vanity area in the kitchen hallway with the full length mirror. Both of my girls loved the fountain area by the pool for playing, but be warned the pool can get packed in the afternoon and there were a lot of seat savers and towels spread out on chairs that seemed to never have a person occupying them. Luckily it drizzled for about five minutes and about half the people cleared out and we finally had a place to sit. During this trip we went to Magic Kimdgdom and Epcot and never used our car. We walked to Magic Kimgdom twice, it took all of 10 minutes and that's with a 2 year old and a stroller. We also took the monorail to the Polynesian twice to eat. Just have to say the guys directing traffic/bell services/valet that work in front of the Contemporary all seem to be so good at their job, they have a lot of cars and buses to deal with but they do such a great job of managing everyone and still being polite. Overall, we can't wait to try many more Disney resorts, but we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay at Disney with small children”
Reviews.Author: palitigate
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days at Disney in March of 2012. We chose the bay lake tower because it is so close to the magic kingdom and we have young kids. This was a perfect place to stay. It has a great pool, and is located right by the magic kingdom. In fact, we didn't event take the monorail since it was only about a 5-8 min walk. Presently, the monorail is out of service from 11-5 daily so be mindful if your trip is coming up soon. Was not an issue for us really since we were so close. They are using buses for travel to and from the parks during the day. The bay lake tower is connected to the Contemporary hotel via a bridge. It's a very quick walk and the bridge leaves you right onto the 4th floor where the restaurants and stores are. So it's very convenient. The villas have a full kitchen, washer and dryer, two nice full bathrooms, balcony, pull out queen sofa bed and a chair and a half pull out bed. We had 3 adults and 3 kids and had plenty of room. We stayed in a 1 BR villa which has all of these things and i'd recommend this. My kids eat a bagel or pop tart or pancake for breakfast so I was glad there was a small market in the contemporary which sold all the staples you need for making quick meals in the room. So we avoided the crowds and overpriced breakfasts and ate in the room in the morning. Great pool with two slides, one very small, and one large. They provide very high quality life guards and also have kid's life vests available. There is a small place to grab snacks and drinks by the pool. Great pool! Overall, great place to stay and I'd choose this again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: INL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bay Lake Tower recently after cruise on the Disney Dream. We had a 2 bedroom villa with a view of the lake - it was fantastic. The two children probably would have been content to stay at the pool area rather than go to the parks. Safe pool with fun slide, very attentive staff especially lifeguards, the spray park and beach just added to fun to the area. The staff from check in to check out were friendly, helpful and made you feel welcome. Probably the nicest timeshare accomadations I have seen. Perfect location to walk to Magic Kingdom or to access the contemporary facilities and restaurants and monorail. We used room service several times and it was good and efficient. An added bonus to DVC members staying there on points is the access to the roof top deck and lounge - a really nice place to have a drink and/or to watch the fireworks. It was truly a very enjoyable stay and am looking forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great unless you go to bed early”
Reviews.Author: cwhite12_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bay Lake Tower recently with a friend and her 2 young children. The location was perfect for walking to Magic Kingdom and taking the monorail to Epcot. The rooms were well-appointed (except for a lack of additional pillows and blankets in the room for those of us sleeping on the sofa bed and sofa chair), and the service was good. My only complaint is that, after returning to our room around 9-ish after a long day at the parks, all we wanted to do was fall into bed; however, our room faced Bay Lake, where there is a nightly light show at about 10:15 pm that is accompanied by ridiculously loud electronic music. On our first night, we jumped out of bed when the music started playing, thinking that someone in a nearby room was blasting his TV, until I looked outside and saw the parade of brightly lit 2-dimensional animals passing by on the lake. So for our remaining 4 nights, we knew there was no point in trying to go to bed until after the light show was over. If you're routinely up until 10:30, this is obviously no problem, but for a group that included young children, this was a bit annoying. It would be great if they could at least turn down the volume of the music. Some friends of ours had a room in which their view of the light parade was obstructed, so they had the even more unfortunate situation of being subjected to the music without being able to see the show. So in summary, it's a great place to stay unless you like to go to bed early.

Reviews.Title: “Happiest place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: realreviewFlorida
Reviews.Content: Bay lake tower is very clean and has outstanding service. The location is ideal for visiting Magic Kingdom & Epcot (you can ride the monorail via ticket and transportation center). There are some nice stores & restaurants in the contemporary and on the monorail loop. I love this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, but short stay!”
Reviews.Author: Manon24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Lake Towers, one of Disney Vacations Club Resort for one night pre-cruise on the Disney Dream. We had studio room, queen bed with a double sofa sleeper. Nice kitchenette. Closet space, really really nice bathroom. Nice view of the pool. Easy access to the main resort Contempory for any meal.

Reviews.Title: “Yes”
Reviews.Author: dr_281
Reviews.Content: We became Disney Vacation Club members during the trip so we decided to use some points and stay here at the end of our vacation. We were able to secure a 16th floor lake view room which also has access to watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the observation deck. The staff is amazing and can't even really think of a negative. Didn't see what beers they have on tap but I brought my own so I can't factor that into my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: designdane
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised, never stayed at Disney timeshare before. Great location, close to everything, Magic Kingdom, EPCOT and TTC. Clean, condition of rooms showed some minor wear and tear, but overall very good accomodations. We stayed in a 1 bedroom, 2 parents and 2 teens 19 and 16. Plenty of room, sleeper chair is like a twin bed. Also had 2 full baths which was a plus. Would recommend this, much better than a typical hotel room. Only downside is that there is no maid service, only a toiletry and towel refresh mid week.

Reviews.Title: “Within sniffin' distance, but a long walk away”
Reviews.Author: BadermanTowson_MD
Reviews.Content: I HAD to book this 3 night segment of our vacation at the Disney Vacation Club. it has the allure of the private club on the 16th floor and the marina or park view...what is not to love??? When I booked I was told no "deluxe views were available" I inquired as to what that was and was told I could face a parking lot or less than favorable view. I was standing on that property at the time I booked and didn't see anything horrid...so I grabbed the standard Studio for 3 nights in March, 2012. Arriving at the hotel we had to check in at the main property. I refused the 1st floor room and offered to spend more points for a room on a higher floor. They would not be forthcoming on what the criteria was for a standard vs deluxe studio room. They refused to book a room on another floor using my DVC points and begrudgingly offered to move me to a room the next day. We regretted the room the minute we moved in. Once the room was assigned we found it was ground floor with no barricade from the rest of the world. NO sheers on the glass doors left you in a fishbowl as we were next to the marina. Steady traffic paced by our door and our only alternative was closing the blackout drapes and it was cave-like. No workout facility here (walk to main building 3rd floor) No beverages or food (walk to 4th floor main building) If the s.f. is the same as other DVC Studios the layout does it no justice. DARKNESS was everywhere and it seemed like we were in a submarine. Except in the Tower common areas - no blinds left you to stand in the blinding GLARE of unobstructed sunlight when we waited at the elevators. Poor layout at the bathroom sink left little visible storage for daily toiletries. I'm 5'7" and weigh 180 and the tub was tight for me....The kitchen was a one person area, although not as badly planned as the bathroom (NO EXHAUST FAN!). After our day at the park I walked to the main building (LOTS OF WALKING HERE) and explained my aversion to 1st floor hotel rooms - she/Mgr. explained what the previous desk man didn't, that floors 1-5 were standard and 6-16 were deluxe. They were giving a room on the higher floor because it had not been explained at booking....although the desk man never told the mgr. I had offered to "pay" for the deluxe room with my points. They acted like they were accommodating me greatly by not accepting my points...just a weird vibe. The bell staff picked up our bags the next morning and held them until we returned the next day at 4....the bookkeeping got jabberwokeyed and we had to comb thru our account because of charges that appeared mis-posted. This was not a pleasant time. I figured the 6th floor room might be "nicer" than the first floor it was exactly the same less some toiletries that we had been given the first day. (Body lotion and aftersun lotion). The private club was an outpost of a sort.... a DVC member walks to the center of the Tower and needs to show their room key and DVC member card - then the Clerk walks you 100 feet to the elevator and keys it to be able to get to the 16th floor. No draft beer.....just mixed drinks and wine and bottled beer, very few appetizers for food available. The bartender was bored and easily chatted about how SLOW the place was. It is a perc for DVC members to have this "exclusivity" but there is no break on prices or servings, we aren't being given anything you can't get elsewhere else on property. The most people I saw was one night at fireworks perhaps 9 people were there in about 3 groups. The laundry facilities are for guests of the DVC property - 3 large washers and 6 dryers. Nice because the studio has no washer/dryer as the 1, 2 and 3 BR. I will NEVER book another room here..... the room was smaller than any DVC studio I had ever stayed in and the staff was non-existent The Resort Monorail was down from 11:30am-6pm .so we were faced with bus rides that stopped at 3 other resorts before our destination (Going out and coming home we were always the last property - how did that work????) I have done it once...and will never stay there again. I hope the Grand Floridian is not built this way.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: M N
Reviews.Content: We travel 2-3 times a year to disney resorts in Orlando. Bay Lake Towers was very disappointing. We could hear loud tv's and talking from rooms on both sides of us. It kept us up and they did nothing, in spite of our calling the front desk several times. The only appealing thing about this resort is the proximity to the Magic Kingdom, the availability of transportation (the monorail, buses and boats), and the lake is pretty. Other than that it is just a big, impersonal hotel. The staff is not particularly helpful or warm, it is overcrowded, the studio rooms are very small, the pool is crammed and the food is just okay. We will be going back to the Animal Kingdom Lodge or any of the other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Except for Race Car Noise”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreTuition
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the room layout, transportation options of monorail, boats, buses and walking to Magic Kingdom. All the positive reviews we second in our agreement. There is one hesitatation in our approval, and that is when the wind is blowing from the southwest be prepared to listen to constant roaring of race cars from early morning until dusk. The sound from the Richard Petty Driving Experience interferes from the tranquility of this location. In fact, the sound intrudes to all of the hotels that are served by the monorail, and the Palm and Magnolia golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Accomodations at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: wnyc
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake Towers has everything a family needs for a great vacation in Disney World... The kitchen is spacious and clean. The laundry room is more than adequate. And the bedrooms and bathrooms are extremely comfortable. Plus, the property is close to everything!!!!! Talk about convenience!!!!!!! It is a truly magical place!

Reviews.Title: “Best in park resort for families with very young children”
Reviews.Author: deenaat
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in October 2010 and again October 2011. First off, October would be a great time to visit due to fewer crowds, slightler cooler weather (at least not steamy) and if you're interested the Food and Wine Festival is at Epcot during this time. However be warned that if you're bringing very small children the food and wine festival may not be the best option as it is very crowded and there are swarms of people drinking and in some cases being obnoxious. We went and left after a couple of hours. Also, Mickey's Not so Scary Halloween party is happening so even if you don't attend you get the benefit of an awesome fireworks show from your balcony, though if at the MK that day you'll have to leave early for the party (if I recall correctly around 7pm). Our children were 22months and 3 at the time and we still felt they were too young for the halloween party so I could't offer much advice/information about that, but I will say the fireworks are quite amazing. As for the hotel, you cannot beat its location. Just a short 10min walk to the Magic Kingdom, another short walk to the monorail to Epcot, The Grand Floridian, etc. For extended stays its wonderful to have washer and dryer as well as a fully stocked kitchen. Regarding this, many folks recommend Green Grocer. I don't have experience with this as we live 1 1/2 away from Disney and brought our own food, but I will say that there is a Goodings (I think) grocery store a short 10-15 min drive away in the Crossroads shopping center where we went to pick up a few items to replenish near the end of our stay. It's also worth adding that there are a myriad of dining options outside of the resort, including at this shopping center. We had dinner at Fudruckers that night and they had a balloon artist twisiting some of the best balloons I had ever seen, and it was a week night. A real kid pleasing place to eat. The room was clean, bed comfortable. I loved the modern decor. We had a one bedroom, which seems to only be in the form of baylake view as opposed to the option of park view. Nonetheless we had a perfect view of the freworks from our balcony and windows. AMAZING. As non disney vacation club members we did not have access to the rooftop for fire works viewing, but not knowing this was a requirement during our first stay we did go up and were not asked to leave. It was nice because you have the benefit of hearing the commentary and music that goes along with the show, but watching form the room was every bit as nice. We used the play-yard for your 22month old to sleep in; just made some adjustments to make it more comfy for him. For our daughter we used and inflatable toddler bed, though the room comes with a pullout sofa and chair. We just had the thing from the previous year and brought it again. When we went in 2010 she was just 2 and we thought a pull out would have been too high for her and got the inflatable. It worked out great. We had PLENTY of room in the living room for both kids. If we go again next year, she'll get a pull out and my son will get the inflatable bed. The pool area was sufficient. No major bells and whistles but there was a kiddie slide for the toddlers and a larger slide for older kids. there is also a non pool/splash area for toddlers as well. There was entertainment in the form of music or a cast member heading poolside activities/games. There are poolside refreshments. House keeping was perfect; serviced the room daily with no issues or problems. During this trip we attending character dining at: Crystal palace for lunch 1900 Park Fare for breakfast Cinderella's Royal Table for lunch. We also had a local Macaroni Grill deliver food for 11 people (we were celebrating a 60th birthday for Grandma, who did not stay in the room with us but came to visit for a day) and I would highly recommend them. They did an awesome job; brought crayons and a paper table cloth like at the resaurant as well as absolutely everything you would need from serving utensils to parmesean, olive oil and herbs for bread dipping, butter, mints...I could go on. I could review the character dining but I think I'll do that in the restaurant section. In summary: Stay here! you can't go wrong! About the only "con" I would offer is that to get any service, ie front desk, etc you have to walk over to the contemporary, but this was either never an issue or if it were, I really wouldn't mind. Also when we checked in (early) we had a cooler full of food, and I was worried about leaving it at the front desk/food spoiling etc, but the time we were able to get into the room, but we were really lucky and our room was ready at checkin both times! WIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Especially For Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: homer227
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Bay Lake. Yes, it's a bit light on theming, but it has a great location and the accommodations are spacious and nice. We highly recommend it if the Magic Kingdom is a priority for you. We were able to squeeze in a few extra trips and to stay longer/later because of the location. If you are going to Disney for the first time with young ones, we recommend scheduling a dinner on your day of arrival at Chef Mickey's. Your kids will meet many of the core characters, which is a great welcome to Disney. Any lack of Disney theming at the hotel is most certainly forgotten. Pictures and autographs with Mickey gets everyone in the Disney mood. A few hints - use bell services to make your stay a breeze. Send your stuff down via UPS, especially if you would be checking it on an airline for a fee. if you need a stroller, rent one from one of the 3rd party rental companies and have it waiting for you at check in. Also have groceries waiting for you through Garden Grocer. We did all of these things and traveled super light. When we checked in, they brought up all of our clothing we had sent, some basic groceries we had ordered, and a great City MIni stroller we had rented.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Bay Lake Tower.”
Reviews.Author: meagannm
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Bay Lake Tower. The best park was being just a short walk away from the Magic Kingdom. We also enjoyed the convenience of the monorail. We stayed in a standard studio room and it was on the small side compared to the villas that we have stayed in the past. Also the noise level was high at times because the rooms are adjoined with other rooms and we could frequently hear the people staying in the room next to ours. Also the noise from the pool can be a little loud in the afternoon when we were attempting rest period for our 3 year old. We also enjoyed the dining options on site and the convenience of 24 hour room service. The cast members were extremely nice and helpful. The pool area was very nice and we enjoyed all of the amenities on site It was wonderful to see a view of the Magic Kingdom and Cinderella's Castle every time we walked over the walkway to the Contemporary.. We will definitely consider another stay here on our next trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Kingdom at your door!”
Reviews.Author: CastrovilleTX
Reviews.Content: What an awesome location! A ten minute walk to Magic Kingdom and the first stop off the monorail when you come home. Stayed in a deluxe studio with our toddler. It had a bed and a sofa/pullout bed (they make them a lot better than they used to thank goodness), a small kitchenette w/ microwave and mini-fridge. There was also a mirror "vanity" area in the kitchenette which made it easy for me to do my hair/makeup while the bathroom was occupied. It was so much easy to catch the elevator here than in the contemporary and was quiet at night. The pool area is awesome and has a great slide and can only be used by Bay Lake occupants. Only con was they should provide a step stool for kids to reach the sink which seemed higher than normal. The breezeway to the Contemporary was very short and you came in on the floor w/ a quick service restaurant which provided a reasonably priced breakfast and sandwiches. There was also a shop, market and arcade room. The buses to the other parks came frequently and were convenient. From here you stopped at the Polynesian then went on to the park. On the way home from the parks you are the first spot they drop off. Take advantage of the late park hours offered to those staying at Disney resorts. We had Magic Kingdom to ourselves one evening there wasn't a wait at any ride. And they didn't enforce the 40 inches. Our toddler (38 inches) rode Splash Mtn that night but they wouldn't let him on during the day. And yes, he loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey T
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake is a beautiful resort but the customer service from the Contemporary is the worst. They allow someone who is drunk and disruptive at midnight continue their stay because they say he was accommodating but when you tell them the next morning they were moving patio furniture around til 2 am and the next morning your the one who is put out even though you were there all week. Doesn't matter if your a vacation club owner in this resort. We've had issues with attitude from the guy at the front desk at Bay Lake and getting our dining plan with this resort was a nightmare with changing your dining plan and your room keys. Will never stay here again. My maid saw how upset I was and told me that they have given VIP service to people who just complained about a hair on the floor of the bathroom. She called her manager to make sure they know what is happening and for them to speak to the night manager because no guest should have their vacation ruined because someone wants to get drunk with the guys and bring them back to his room. This isn't Las Vegas, this is supposed to be a place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Best magic kingdom hotel”
Reviews.Author: ljmiii
Reviews.Content: The Bay Lake Tower is truly magical. The rooms are spacious and full of amenities - e.g. DVD player, full kitchen, W/D. The bathroom w/large whirlpool tub and separate shower is delightful. The decor is clean and simple yet the furnishings are quite comfortable. The pool is great fun - second only to the Beach Club/Yacht Club's Stormalong Bay. There is a large waterslide for the big kids and also a small waterslide and sandy beach for younger ones. And of course there is a hot spa to warm you up afterward. There is a lounge on the top of the hotel that serves drinks and serves as a fireworks viewing platform for those staying at the Bay Lake without a view of the Magic Kingdom from their room (though if you and your family are feeling lazy, the elevator lobbies provide an excellent view of the fireworks as well). The dining at the Contemporary is varied and uniformly delicious (though it must be said, rather expensive). We love the California Grill and have visited it repeatedly over the years, but this trip we visited the Wave as well and were pleasantly surprised. Chef Mickey delivers quality a cut above it's buffet nature. And when you need a quick bite the Contempo Cafe does a fine job. But best of all is the location - you can walk to the Magic Kingdom and monorail to EPCOT...so most of your trip will be 'bus-free'. And because the Contemporary is uniquely part of both the MK's monorail and water taxi service you can easily and quickly get to all of the other MK resorts as well. Over the past few years Disney has decided to make their resorts destinations in their own right. So the easy trip by monorail or water taxi to all these resort restaurants (and perhaps more importantly with children, the quick ride home) helps make staying at the Bay Lake Tower a joy. I have only three 'warnings' and they are more quibbles than truly warnings. First, there really is no 'fast casual' dining option at the Contemporary because the restaurant targeted to that niche - 'Chef Mickey' - is LOVED by all. So book ahead or prepare to wait. Second, food in the lounge atop the Bay Lake tower seems to have been an afterthought - I think it comes from a kitchen they added in the basement. So avoid anything that needs to be cooked and enjoy the drinks and snacks. And third, if you face the lake (and this includes some of the rooms inside the horseshoe of the hotel) keep in mind that there will be a water show late in the evening. Very cool, very pretty, but very capable of keeping little ones awake.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Expecting Such a Magical Adventure”
Reviews.Author: cometdogamundo
Reviews.Content: For lots of reasons I never really thought I'd enjoy Disney. But my oldest keeps getting older and she is such a dreamy kid, still (at 10) loves fairies and princesses and all things sparkly and magical, so it seemed time to take the plunge. As a Disney newbie my learning curve was steep -- I had no idea all the details it paid to consider! I spent hours planning and researching the trip and it was truly amazing. I chose Bay Lake Tower and it couldn't have been better. The location is perfect, especially with younger kids because it is so close to Magic Kingdom (I hadn't even really realized that Disney encompasses a whole bunch of parks) and is right on the monorail. The room was smallish but clean, up to date in terms of design and amenities, and it had a kitchen! (a frig, microwave and coffee maker) Somehow I didn't realize this when I booked it but the tower I guess is part of the vacation club so they have some really special perks. I definitely would have brought along fruit and other healthy snacks and food options if I'd realized. Also, upstairs is a special room for vacation club folks and the people at the Tower -- we never made it up but heard the view for fireworks was awesome! There are a bunch of really wonderful dining options at the Contemporary -- we loved The Wave and my husband enjoyed sitting at the bar at the California Grill... the kids and I were too tuckered out from walking a thousand miles a day (again -- had no idea how much walking you do, even when you stick to just Epcot and Magic Kingdom) to eat anywhere too schmancy, but he LOVED it. If you plan far enough ahead, I would make dinner reservations there early enough to see the fireworks over the castle... we only had a 6 or 8 week lead time and I discovered many reservations were impossible to get at kid-friendly times. At The Wave we liked sitting in the cool round blue rooms by the bar -- the kids loved the ambiance (kind of like being inside Jeannie's bottle!) and the food was really good with fairly diverse options -- LOVED the edamame with sweet chili sauce -- genius! Could also get great coffee in the Contemporary lobby each morning. I was a little overwhelmed by the faster service option, but by the end (a little late!) I was starting to get the hang of the meal plan and learning the ropes in the Contempo Cafe -- you really can find healthy options, and we really had a hard time using our meal plan points. For us that was a waste, though I imagine if we went back I'd have a much better handle on it. I would advise talking with the concierge or someone in the cafe right at the beginning if you're new to it the way I was. For example, I didn't realize I could stock up on water bottles and fresh fruit under the plan, and so on. Another lovely thing was the two pools to choose from -- both with snack bars, hot tubs and water features for the kids. They often had special things in the evenings for the kids as well -- movies under the stars, roasting marshmallows on the beach, trivia games and dance parties. One evening we took the boat, right from the Contemporary dock, over to the Wilderness Lodge for dinner -- again, for the children, another magical adventure. Even with the proximity to the Magic Kingdom, believe it or not my best advice would be to bring a stroller -- I ended up renting one every day for my two kids (6 & 10)... we used it a lot of the time just for holding stuff, but both kids rode in it a lot as well, and it gave me a good place to sit every now and again! Finally, all the staff we came into contact with was wonderful, helpful and friendly: maintenance folks, the smiley life guards at the pools, boat drivers, monorail workers, hotel staff, everyone was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern fit-out”
Reviews.Author: jeremythorpe
Reviews.Content: You have to start with the great location; 5 minutes walk from the Magic Kingdom. This makes the BLT a convenient base that enables you to miss at least some of the crowds. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with views towards the Magic Kingdom. The suite was spacious, clean and even verged on being too big. Overall, more than we had hoped for as far as the suite itself. We had booked this room because it provided a view of the nightly fireworks, but we were a bit disappointed by the actual capacity to view the fireworks. Because of the angle of the hotel we had to all stand in the far corner of the two balconies, making the experience somewhat cramped. Not sure if this was better in some of the other rooms. FInally, we found it a bit awkward that we were able to check in at the BLT, but that they had no bag storage and we had to lug our bags over the to Contemporary Resort for storage. A minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, best location at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Jww1962
Reviews.Content: Very modern building and decor. Clean first class rooms. All the comforts of home and the best location at Disney. You can walk 5 minutes to The Magic Kingdom or ride the monorail to Epcot and other Disney hotels. Great views from all sides of the building. This is one of Disney Vacation Clubs best facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveDisneyAlways
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bay Lake Towers 1 night for a precruise stay. We loved the resort from the minute we arrived. We booked through Disney and used a 35% off special offer. We arrived at 130 in the afternoon the line up to check in was very long, however we did online check in and were greeted right away and off to our room in minutes. We had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms, washer/dryer and kitchen. We had a theme park view room, we loved watching the fireworks from our balcony. We hopped on the monorail for a quick dinner with Cinderella over at the grand Floridian and then back to the resort for an evening swim and hot tub. Over all we had an excellent experience we only regret we didn't stay longer. We used Disney transfers for our cruise luggage was picked up at 8am we were picked up at 11am. Everything was hassle free as expected by Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Very contemporary and huge,comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MNGreen_Pea
Reviews.Content: I loved the fact that the room was contemporary and it didn't look like Mickey Mouse threw up all over our rooms. After being at WDW all day it was so nice to have the break from all of that! Somebody on the monorail called it sterile - I call it clean, contemporary and visually quiet :-) The kitchen worked out very nicely for breakfasts in the morning and snacks late at night. Having a second bathroom was great since we had some friends over one night to play cards and catch up. There was a washer and dryer so we only packed a couple changes of clothes so we could do carry on. The bed was SUPER comfortable and we had a balcony over looking the lake so we could see all the activities outside. There is a boat parade on the lake each night at 10 but if you miss it you didn't miss out on much. There are also fireworks each night at the castle on the other side of the hotel if you can get a room facing the castle and they are amazing and they start at 8. We had a wonderful stay and would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “9 days at Bay Lake Towers”
Reviews.Author: mgrg2599
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, easy walk to Magic Kingdom. No need to take Monorail or bus. Used our DVC points for a 1 bedroom. Nice having full kitchen, washer dryer. Spacious, clean rooms. All rooms have agreat view, I would imagine. You are overlooking the pool, pool/lake, park, or lake/park. great view of fireworks, easy access to monorail line and buses if you need to get there. Only down side to be DVC member is the rooms are not cleaned everyday. They clean every 3-4 days because you are really staying in an apartment. No big dela, call the front desk and you have towles pretty quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Heart of the World”
Reviews.Author: kathiewe
Reviews.Content: We staid here using DVC points for a spring get-a-way last year and loved it! Room -- We had a studio standard view room, which over looked the kingdom, bay lake, and woods. We don't see the need to spend the points for MK view, but that is personal preference. The room set-up was a bit small, but perfect for the amount of time we spent there. Bonus for DVC members staying only at Bay Lake -- the lounge. We loved it and may have to return to BLT just to get a drink in this wonderful get-a-way with a perfect view of MK. Location -- This is a great location with a variety of transportation options -- walk to the kingdom, take the monorail to Epcot or other MK resorts, take boat ride to other areas around the lake, or bus trip to just about anywhere. Theme -- Its very clean, modern, and well contemporary. It wasn't our favorite Disney theme, but that could be that we have a family with a 4 yr old. Restaurants -- Great options, decent prices, and yummy food. Like all deluxe resorts (they share with Contemporary) at Disney you can get everything from full service to quick service. Our favorites at BLT/Contemporary are the Wave and California Grill but the quick service is solid and Chef Mickey's is perfect for kids. Other Offerings -- Love the beach chairs -- perfect place to get a-way, pool slide, and walking grounds. We were surprised how easy it was to get a-way from all things Mickey when you were at the heart of his kingdom. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great location for families with toddlers”
Reviews.Author: jean z
Reviews.Content: The Bay Lake Tower at Disney is a great place to stay for families with toddlers. The reason for this is the ease of walking to Magic Kingdom and the availability of the monorail to Epcot. Also having a full kitchen makes it possible to prepare breakfast or any other meal that you would like. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and it was very spacious for the 6 adults and 3 toddlers. It was especially convenient having 3 bathrooms. There is a negative and that is the fact that the walls are very thin. You can here everything in other rooms. I also have to admit that next time I would stay in the Epcot area. I feel that the atmosphere at those resorts is nicer and more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome 1st visit as DVC members”
Reviews.Author: Has-BibNY
Reviews.Content: We visited with family the last week of September 2011. We booked a lake view unit and ended up with a view of the lake as well as a view of the Magic Kingdom. We checked in at 11 a.m. ( I always do online check in) On line check in line was empty. We walked up completed check in in less than 10 minutes. Collected our rented stroller from bell services, moved rental car to Bay Lake Tower parking area and were off to Magic Kingdom (it's a 5-10 minutes walk to the Magic Kingdom). We headed up to our room at 4 p.m.. Please understand I am a bit of a clean freak.The room was exceptionally clean. Our family consisted of 6 adults and one child. We stayed in a dedicated 2 bedroom unit. The kitchen was equipped with everything we would need. The washer and dryer right in the unit what a bonus. It has it's own dedicated pool which was very nice although it is a little small compared to the pool at the poly and beach club. Still it was nice, clean, there was always and abundance of towels and life jackets for the little one. We will be vacationing again at Bay Lake Tower the September 20125 with our family again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sirtoasty
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first DVC stay at our new home away from home, BLT, and all things considered, we loved it. The rooms (we had a 1BR villa) are nicely appointed and spacious. As previous posters have mentioned, the location is just ridiculous. The Magic Kingdom is closer than it looks -- only a 5-10 minute walk -- and the monorail is right there as well. On this basis alone, I'm not sure we're going to be excited to stay anywhere else when we go to Disney, at least as long as my daughter is of an age where we're spending a good amount of time at MK. The Top of the World Lounge is also a nice perk for DVC members staying on points -- offers a cool vantage point for the nightly fireworks. As compared to resort hotels anywhere, it's a 4 star place, which is why I've rated it as I have. As compared to Disney hotels, however, it's definitely a 5 star property. On my last trip a few months ago, I stayed at the Poly, which is also a "Deluxe," and the rooms at the Poly can't hold a candle to the rooms at BLT. For example, the master bath has an oversized whirlpool tub and a rain shower, and the kitchen had granite counter tops -- the rooms at the Poly, by contrast, were basically standard hotel rooms with south Pacific decor. Full disclosure, the rooms and the property as a whole are not as heavily themed as other Disney resorts. The design is clean and "contemporary," if you'll pardon the pun, but it doesn't scream Disney like some properties. With that in mind, your mileage may vary depending upon how important that is to you.

Reviews.Title: “Two trips, once in a 2-bedroom, once in a studio”
Reviews.Author: stimpsjd
Reviews.Content: I think I can provide an unique perspective on this hotel since I have stayed at it twice in the last 9 months. The first trip was with an "extended" family in a 2-bedroom suite. There were five adults and one 3 year-old. We found the suite to be perfect for this group, with plenty of room. The rooms were very clean, and though we did observe some of the wear that others have commented on, overall we found it to be nicely furnished. And, the convenience to the Magic Kingdom could not be beat. This was offset though by the fact that aside from MK and Epcot, the other parks were a 15-25 minute bus ride away. Not a deal killer, but if you intend to spend time at Hollywood Studios or Animal Kingdom, do consider balancing the convenience. We also found the Contemporary to be nicely accessible, and the service to be particularly good. The contempo cafe is one of the best quick service restaurants available, and Chef Mickey's was good for breakfast the two times we visited. The second visit in the studio was with just my wife and son, The room was furnished in a similar way, we had missed the fact that there was no washer and dryer in the studios though so were somewhat disappointed by that. Again, it was comfortable, but I would caution that there is a kitchenette in the studio, the actual "living" area of the overall room is very tight for three people, particularly when the pullout is in use. We had a nice view overlooking the tennis courts/lake/MK. The room was not nearly as clean as on our first visit, with cobwebs in several places in the room, and dust on some surfaces. The sofa pillows were also badly stained and the bed furnishings were somewhat worn. The best part of the stay there is the convenience to the Magic Kingdom and the monorail line. If you have limited time at the resort, this comes in particularly handy since you aren't eating into your time on transport. I would say the drawbacks come from the contemporary furnishings, the distance from some of the services of the Contemporary and the lack of a Disney flair. Would I recommend a stay? Yes. But, after two visits, I don't think this would be my first choice. Fort Wilderness offers similar convenience and has a personality.

Reviews.Title: “Two bedroom suite is awesome for large family”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bay Lake Tower from January 9-16, 2012. It was myself, my husband, two daughters and my husband's parents. There are two large bedrooms, three bathrooms, full kitchen and washer/dryer. Everything you could want while staying for a week. Room was clean, well-stocked and very quiet. The proximity to Magic Kingdom was perfect for us as our children are young and we spent the majority of our time at this park. You can walk there in 5 minutes or ride the Monorail fairly quickly. The pool is heated to a balmy 82 degrees so even though it was in the upper 60's and low 70's outside, the pool was still warm enough to swim in. The waterslide is smaller and slower so again, for our young children, it was perfect. I guess my only complaint would be the price - it is very expensive and I am not sure we would stay here again because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: KrystenMejia
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with some of the other reviews of this hotel. The location is ideal for the Magic Kingdom but it does lack some of that Disney Magic that other resorts offer. The view from our room was fantastic and you could watch the fireworks from our balcony. I was worried about sharing a studio with two kids, but this rooms has tons of storage and they didn't mind the pull out bed. The kitchenette was designed well with a huge pantry and several cabinets. The bedroom had plenty of dresser storage, shelves and a good size closet. The best part was having the kitchenette to make meals for the kids. We ate breakfast in the room and the kids ate several dinners. Having visited Disney several times, we knew the food in the onsite grocery stores was super expensive. We packed food and just bought perishables in the store saving us a ton of money. We enjoyed our stay but for the price, we'd go back to Animal Kingdom, Beach Club or Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jbstock72
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from jan 1st to the 7th in a one bedroom suite. The room was very big and spectacular, two bathrooms, the master's had a jacuzzi and a big shower. The location is of course excellent ! We had to wait until 4:20 until we could get our room , the check in is supposed to be at 4:00 and the check out is at 11:00 so you would think they could have anough house cleening employees to do it faster especially considering how much disney charges for those rooms... Also we were half an hour late for our check out and the cleaning lady seemed mad, and we had a visit from two other employees to pressure us out of there... Anyway the rest was great we can't wait to get back there but i do not think we'll go back to florida in december or january since the weather always too cold for at least part of our stays , we come from way up north and we would like it hot when we are on vacation and forget about the tuque at the very least !

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Maleficent1974
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at Bay Lake was in December. We are in the vaction club and this is our home resort. You cannot beat the location. It is about a 5 minute walk to Magic Kingdom. The view is phenomenal. Even if you do not have a Magic Kingdom view room, you can view the fireworks from the walkway to the Contemporary, or the Top of the World Lounge (you must be there on vacation points to do the latter of the two). The kids activity room is great. The youth workers are so nice. The rooms are beautiful and you have anything you need. We try to stay on the 5th floor close to the walkway, that way it is just a hop skip and jump to all the gift shops and restaurants at the Contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Perfect location and views!”
Reviews.Author: Torsie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 4 nights of our wedding trip and honeymoon having spent a previous 3 weeks at a combination of Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge, Grand Floridian and Boardwalk. So being our final stay hotel it had a lot to live up to! We paid the extra for Magic Kingdom view so that we could spend our last few nights at more of a relaxed pace, watch Wishes from the balcony and eat at the California Grill being just a short walk away. We checked in early (around 11am) so I wasn't expecting a room to be ready, but lo and behold one was! I had requested a high floor, and asked if it was up high, to whoch I was told yes Maam. When we got over to BLT (you go across a bridge from the Contemporary Lobby - very fun!) it turned out we were only on the 4th floor. We had a good view of the castle, but the monorail line cut through it, and having just spent 11 nights at the Boardwalk wishing I'd changed rooms on check in (or at least asked) I thought I might as well give it a go here. I called down to reception and was told no problem, come back down and we'll get you changed over. Down in the Lobby we talked to a wonderful Cast Member called Mario who secured us a room on the 14th floor - as high as you can be! It wasn't going to be ready until 3 so what better way to spend some time than to head into the Magic Kingdom? Upon return to BLT at around 3.30pm (we stayed and caught the parade) our room still wasn't ready, but upon seeing us in the Lobby, Mario instantly remembered us and got everything sorted in a jiffy. Disney's policy isn't to guarantee room requests, and this hotel really went above and beyond to help us, so I was really pleased, even if it did take a little longer. And boy was our new view worth it! We had a perfect view of the Magic Kingdom and across the lake to the Grand Floridian. An additional bonus was we could also see the EPCOT ball, Tower of Terror and Earful Tower, and even Expedition Everest - all 4 parks!! The room was great, albeit a little smaller than AKL and BW, but we really liked how the kitchen is like it's own little room there. We had a great stay, and spent many breakfast and lunch times out on the balcony. We also loved watching Wishes. I imagine with small kids it'd be the perfect place. Although we did find the pool very busy and a little small. In short a great hotel, what you expect from a Disney Deluxe. My husband loves AKL and I the Floridian, so although we'll always choose those two first for future trips we heartily recommend BLT to anyone who is considering a stay there, and would happily return. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Location is the selling point”
Reviews.Author: TRUST311
Reviews.Content: We are new DVC members and stayed at BLT (our home resort) for the first time over the week leading up to New Years. We have stayed many times before at the contemporary so we were already familiar with the hotel and the layout. As for the room itself, we were in a studio. It was much smaller than a regular hotel room but fine for our family of 3. It was adequately cleaned and when I needed an item from housekeeping it was promptly delivered. I think in the 5 days we were there we only saw 2 staff members at the desks which was fine for us since we didn't really need anything but I could see how for others it would be bothersome. The location is what will keep us there. The brisk 5 minute walk to the front gate of the magic kingdom is worth it's weight in gold when it's late at night with a sleepy child. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful castle view”
Reviews.Author: DMKUR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to get to using the disney bus service from airport. We carried our bags so we could have our luggage to use immediately. The lobby is very modern and clean. The elevators were fast- we never had to wait more that a minute for elevator. The beds were comfortable and disney had extra pillows in room that we requested. The linen was soft and pillows comfortable. We had the studio unit that had a queen bed and sofa bed, the only problem was if it was two couples the two were side by side not even two inches apart. For a family with 2 children this would be fine. The unit had a table and chairs and large mirror. The balcony was the best- with beautiful view of castle even though we did not have a resort view room. The mini kitchen was enough for us to make breakfast with microwave, refrig., coffee maker and toaster. It also had a vanity area across from the mini kitchen and a full length mirror in this section. It had a full bathtub/shower and sliding door for the bathroom. A full closet with door,safe,luggage stand, iron/board. There was room to store our luggage. The Tv and cabinet were modern, flat screen. We did not hear anyone in hallway,but could slightly hear the toilet flush in next room. The pool/ hot tub were nice- hot tub was perfect temperature, pool was cold in Dec. but contemporary pool next door was warm. There is a walkway between this hotel and Contemporary which brings you to the level in the Contemporary hotel with the most services. The monorail was easy to use but it goes to the other hotels first in the morning before the magic kingdom. But it is nice and close when you leave magic kingdom at night or for lunch. It is also close enough to walk to magic kingdom. Check in is located in the Contemporary hotel which is quite a walk. We did not eat at the hotel. We were also not able to book any dinner reservations for our favorite places- this was probably because disney was offering a free meal plan at the time of our trip-(we booked a few weeks before our trip). I would recommend this hotel- great for families with children. We used Alamo rental car that was close by on disney property ,they picked us up at hotel and took us to car rental office.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, few services”
Reviews.Author: Wbrigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom villa. Room was spacious and clean. Location on monorail could not be better. The problem is that it does not have that Disney feel. You feel like you are at a hotel off property. There are virtually no services, not even coffee at the towers. You have to walk across to the Contemporary. Unless you really want to be on the monorail or within walking distance to MK, stay at Beach Club or Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Resort and Villas”
Reviews.Author: Marines49
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to WDW as DVC members in December 2011, our home resort is Bay Lake. Our 3 previous trips at WDW we stayed at the Beach Club; two very different resorts. We have 3 children ages 13, 10, and 7. Certainly nothing to regret at Bay Lake - the 1-bedroom villa very nice and spacious for a family of 5 - fantastic view of the Lake and Cinderella's Castle as we had a corner room on the 8th floor. We watched the MK fireworks from our balcony 4 nights; fun times. Bay Lake is very convenient and clost to MK, so a plus. Pool was very nice and a great view of the Lake. The downside to the resort is that you really do not get the DIsney look and feel, the lobby is small and kind of reminds you of a secluded condominium for adults only. This is a very nice location and resort for adults only; would not highly-recommend if you have young children as the environment is what I call "Disney Sterile". So if you are big on being surrounded by the DIsney Magic, this is not the place. Nothing negative in regards to the resort cleanliness, location, rooms, it is just not a Disney Themed resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Janice41762
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel/villa! We were a party of 4 adults and 2 children 6 yrs. of age (twins). The number one asset was its proximity to the Magic Kingdom and the fact that it was on the monorail. We were able to walk from the Magic Kingdom to the hotel on those nights when the monorail was exceptionally busy (such as the night of the Not So Scary Halloween Party). We had 2 bedrooms, one with a king and a very large bathroom. The other had 2 queens with a large bathroom, and there was a kitchen/family room with floor to ceiling windows where we could watch the fireworks every night! There was an additional bathroom with a washer/drier in the hall. Could not have been more perfect and would definitely return! Also we had rented a car because we were going to a condo on the beach after our Disney trip and not only was the parking free at all of the parks but very convenient too.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterBNJ
Reviews.Content: Loved the whole thing! Good pool, great access, super clean, terrific room & furnishings. Super attentive staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for a group!”
Reviews.Author: JanineL1
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom/3 bathroom suite for a group of 6 adults and 3 children, including 2 infants. It was a great accommodation especially with its proximity to the Magic Kingdom. Being able to walk to the park with 3 strollers was a great benefit. We could watch the fireworks from our 2 balconies. Our adult kids joked that they are spoiled now and will always want to go back here when visiting Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay at our home resort.”
Reviews.Author: Kimber_jewel
Reviews.Content: We own at BLT but up until now have never stayed there. We were not sure what to expect after staying at most of the other DVC resorts and the reading some poor reviews. Pros : Locations! You can't beat it if your trip propose is the Magic Kingdom. You are also so close to the MK bus depot that you can get to other resorts easily. Vila: Our 2 bedroom was enormous. 7 adults for 6 nights and we never felt cramped. Master was similar to others at DVC with the jetted tub but the shower was a nice touch. Kitchen was nicely equipped. Top of the World: Amazing. Views, great service, and prices were reasonable. Cons: Theme was dull. We had family staying with us for the first time at Disney and I found myself often explaining to them that the other resorts were much better themed. It just feels modern, like a Hilton. I wish they would have made it more "jetsony". Wear and Tear : Very noticeable on the chairs and table in the kitchen. Our kitchen sink leaked and our toaster had to be replaced. Pool: eh.not great compared to other resorts. The hot tub was closed some of the time and when open was full of kids. Lobby: Love the lobby in WL, BC, and BWV where you can just sit and watch the world go by. BLT is lacking this. We also found the cast member here to appear less genuine than cast members at other resorts. We were given wrong information several times and in general they were just unhelpful. I am happy we own here because the location is great but I am really looking forward to the Grand Floridian DVC.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: Denver1967
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel. We have stayed at most of the Magic Kingdom hotels. This was our favorite room by far. We rented the 1 bedroom villa. This room was perfect for us and my daughters friend. It has a kitchen and two bathrooms. We really liked having the kitchen. You are also so close to the Magic Kingdom that it's easy to walk home after the park. You share most of the amenities with the Contrmporary but there is a nice covered walkway connecting you to that hotel. You have your own pool plus you can also use the pool at the Contemporary. Having the kitchen probably save us the extra cost of our bigger room. You can have groceries delivered to your room from Garden Grocer right to your room. We mostly ate breakfast in the room and some lunches. We will probably stay in this resort again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Allison P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bay Lake towers in December 2011 for a vacation and had a great time. My favorite part of Bay Lake was the location. So easy to access the magic kingdom. We really enjoyed watching the fireworks from the roof of the hotel, amazing. I also really enjoyed our balcony, even though our view wa snot of the magic Kingdom. On the downside, the showerhead is very small, you could not adjust the stream of water so it took longer to shower in order to really rinse my hair out, which is minor... but annoying. We did also have some paint chips in the bathroom and a broken toiletpaper holder, I'm not sure why that would not have been fixed. We also had a lot of little ants in the kitchen, but I guess thats normal in Florida. The only other downfall was the loud music at the pool in the afternoon. I understand they are trying to entertain the kids, but what about the little kids (and adults) that would like to take a nap in the afternoon? It's very tough to nap if youre room is in range of the pool as the bass is very loud even with door and curtain closed. Overall it was nice, not amazing, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “magical stay”
Reviews.Author: Natalie H
Reviews.Content: we stayed at BLT the week of Thanks giving. when we got there, we were greeted with a welcome home and a smile. The lobby clerk gave my kids stickers and joked with them. The room is spacious and has all the amenities that you can think off. This is a perfect resort for family with young kids who want to spend most of the time at Magic Kingdom. The walk to Mk only takes 8 minutes. I love the fact that you can watch the fireworks and have some drinks at the top of the lounge. This is defenitely a bonus to this resort. Chef Mickey is wonderful. We took Monorail and bus to other park and resorts also. It did not take long at all. Dinner at Arkershus (Norway) was delicious. My Kids enjoyed all the princesses there. If you plan to make a trip to Disney world, disney's dinning plan is a plus. You can make reservation ahead of time. Most of the restaurants in Epcot are delicious. You can save a lot of money too. Crystal palace is a wonderful place for kids with all the disney's characters. Over all we had a magical stay at BLT. We defenitely come back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: cramebar
Reviews.Content: The room itself Was decent. Spacious enough for our family of 5. Kitchen was well equipped with kitchen utensils. They put on a boat/lake show at night which was really neat. You can also see the fireworks from the bay lake. That is definitely a plus if you have younger children and don't want to be at the magic kingdom late. They also have chef mickeys in the contemporary, which is nice. Btw...you don't need to worry if there are no availabilities when booking your dining reservation at chef mickeys. They will get you in but it could take up to an hour and there are other things to do while waiting. They do have a game room and a couple shops to browse. The major drawback was that everything was at the contemporary hotel. Granted there is a walking bridge, but inconvenient, especially if it's cold. The restaurants, game room, shops and monorail were at the contemporary. We didn't use the monorail much, except while going to other parks. We just walked to the magic kingdom as we found it was a lo faster! The pools were great and the kids enjoyed the water slides!! They do daily activities for them also, which I thought was nice. Our cleaning service did not come and we had to call numerous times. They finally showed up late afternoon. I would recommend ordering food from the grocery store as there is a fridge in the room. Overall, it was decent enough. However, if we decide to go back I think we will definitely stay at the grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing resort!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer r
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at BLT as I write this review. We're in a standard 2 BR unit. When we arrived, the first room they put us in had bugs crawling all over one of the bedrooms and bathroom. And I mean MULTIPLE bugs. We called the front desk and they sent pest control up who told us they would advise us moving out of the room so they could treat the room. They were at full capacity that night so we were unable to move until the next day. We were offered NOTHING for what happened--they were basically like "sorry about that" and that was it. The new room we got ended up having a better view and was bigger, but the first night when we turned on the jacuzzi jets, they spewed out all sorts of dirt and grime. It was disgusting. We also found dirty dishes in the cabinets. Overall, this resort disappoints and other than the location, which is convenient, I don't know that we'll stay here again. It's a high DVC point resort and I'm just not sure it's worth it--there are so many other resorts with more character that are cleaner! Oh, and after I complained to the manager the 2nd night we were there, he did comp our in room dining meal, so at least we got something for the trouble we had to go to of moving rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not as enthralled the second time but still good”
Reviews.Author: smallfry0517
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Thanksgiving week in a 2 bedroom Magic Kingdom view with our two young children. Everything I wrote in my previous review of this property is still true--I did not notice any significant wear since last year. When we arrived the floors were slick since they had just shampooed the carpet. The bed was still comfortable, the linens were very soft, and the place was clean. I had the opportunity on this trip to go by a few other resorts, such as the Boardwalk over by Epcot. There is a lot more character over there (the "Disney magic" others have referred to) and the location between Epcot and Hollywood Studios is great. There is only so much Magic Kingdom one can take and the crowds there on the weekends are out of control. Epcot is more reasonable so it would be nice to hang out there in the afternoons before walking back to the hotel. On our first visit it was good to be close to the Magic Kingdom, but since this was our second, we should have switched it up. The free dining promotion was great--I would always do a meal plan when visiting Disney in the future. My least favorite thing about this hotel is the pool area. It is pretty small, and shaded by the hotel by early afternoon. Nothing special at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, beautiful suites!”
Reviews.Author: z2u
Reviews.Content: For those who love the Contemporary (which I do), this place is an excellent choice if you need more space. It's connected to the Contemp by a covered walkway, and an easy walk. Great view of magic kingdom from floor to ceiling windows in our two bedroom suite. We had three full baths that were new and luxurious. The beds were comfy, and the kitchen was first class and stocked with dishes/glasses... Big flat screen tvs, black out curtains and lots of room to relax. Everything is new and the place is immaculate. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay at Bay Lake Tower!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzim
Reviews.Content: After staying at a couple of Disney hotels I decided that I needed to buy DVC so that I could stay in Disney hotels without paying excessive prices. Bay Lake Tower has the perfect location if you want to visit the Magic Kingdom regularly - I loved the fact that we could walk to the MK whenever we wanted. We had a MK view - which was brilliant as I could watch the fireworks from the balcony and not have to fight the crowds every night! We had a studio which was fine for the two of us and the room was clean and in good condition (I know this is something that people tend to complain about). We will definately be back as this is our DVC home resort :)

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Tower-get a higher floor if you want a good view”
Reviews.Author: ilovepooh
Reviews.Content: Our room was ready but when we got there the bed wasn't made and there was an open shampoo bottle by the tub. They took care of it right away and offered to move us to a different room. I recommend requesting a higher level floor if you want good views. We were on the 4th floor and had not so great views from our 'lake view' room. The staff was very professional and friendly. We liked the closeness to Magic Kingdom and the Monorail/shops/restaurants! We stayed in a one bedroom and loved that it had two full bathrooms. We weren't tripping over each other to get ready. It was very nice as I don't think any of the other resorts have that! All in all a very pretty place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bonaireguy
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom suite is ideal! The location could not be better. Incredible views of Bay Lake or Magic Kingdom!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average Bay Lake Tower”
Reviews.Author: Grayza
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Disney, no other word could best describe our visit other than 'MAGICAL'. We had done plenty of research prior to our visit but it still impressed. The Hotel is modern, clean with excellent facilities, its poximity to Magic Kingdom is brilliant and the Lake provided a nice vista. There was a few things that we wish we had known about before we arrived, this information may help you make pre-visit decisions. This is a Self Catering apartment (not a suite) the only cooking facilities was a small microwave, toaster, and coffee perculator (No kettle), there was also a fridge, Plastic Cutlery and Cardboard Crockery! 4 porcelain Mugs and 4 Glass Tumblers. The only place to buy foodstuffs was in Contemporary Resort (next door) in a Very Small Shop with a limited supply of expensive essentials. I would certainly have taken a generous supply of Groceries, a Kettle and my own Cutlery and Plates etc. We had a look at a couple of other Resorts while we were there, and although Bay Lake Tower was 'Better Than Average' the other resorts seemed to be a 'Cut Above' that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoWildflower
Reviews.Content: This review is very very late, but I wanted to put in my .02. We are DVC members - and we became members because of Bay Lake Tower. Over the years we have frequented WDW numerous times as our boys were growing up. Now that we have grandchildren, we thought it would be a good investment. We could not be happier! In the past, we have stayed at the Grand Floridian and it is a magnificant hotel. However, this time we took our sons, our granddaughters, our and our daughter-in-law's parents. We had a 2 bedroom unit and a 1 bedroom unit. The units were large and spacious with every amenity you could want! We loved having a washer and dryer in the unit as well as a full kitchen. We chose to invest in BLT because of its proximity to the monorail and ease of access. We were not disappointed. I only wish we could make this an annual trip. The staff was very helpful and friendly and very accomodating. This is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed once...would probably not stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: thecajungent
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a Disney Vacation Club owner. This was my first time staying at Bay Lake Tower. First, the positives: Proximity to Magic Kingdom is wonderful, both for the ease of access to the park-just a quick walk across the street-and more significantly, the view of the fireworks from the roof top. Access to the variety of restaurants and services in the Contemporary Hotel, along with monorail service to Epcot. You can even see Spaceship Earth in the distance if you are staying on the left side of the resort with a lake view. Now, some of the negatives... When we arrived, our room was not ready. So we checked our bags and went into the park. When we returned to the resort, we stopped at bell services to have our bags sent to the room. Once we arrived in our room, SOMEONE else's bags were there. I called down to the front desk. I was informed the bags had been delivered by mistake and someone would be up to collect them. Well, they promptly sent someone to retrieve them, however, OUR bags got "lost"... After a few calls to bell services, I finally called the hotel manager, explained the situation and told him I wanted my bags found. The bags were delivered within 20 minutes of my conversation with him. The situation is even more interesting, coincidently because when checking into the Saratoga Springs Resort (where we stayed before transferring to Bay Lake Tower) the person next to me was complaining that when SHE got to her room, someone else's bags were there too!! I hope this isn't a trend with the "Magical Express"....Anyway, the rooms are a bit smaller than some of the other vacation club properties. The modern furniture is uncomfortable and not really conducive to lounging, in my opinion. The construction quality was somewhat disappointing, and unusual for a Disney resort. The top drawer in the kitchen was already broken. The cabinet door of the cabinet over the coffee maker scraped against the door molding each time it was opened. Sheet rock finish was sub-par as well. We happened to be there when there were bugs EVERYWHERE. They smelled like dead fish. While Disney did their best to vacuum them up as quickly as they could, the bugs prevented us from enjoying the balcony at night. They breed on/by the lake and are supposedly only around for a couple of weeks a few times a year. It was kind of cool to watch a few bats flying around eating them! Again, as the title said, I'm glad we stayed here once. However, we will stay at a different (more than likely Saratoga Springs) vacation club property on our annual trip next year. If you do stay there, DEFINITELY visit the lounge at the roof top. BRUCIE is an EXCELLENT server, and a shining example of the excellence we expect when we visit Walt Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.....but not if you are afraids of heights”
Reviews.Author: elwoodSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: I visit Orlando very regularly and stayed Bay Lake Tower over Halloween. I found our studio to be spacious and lovely. We had booked a Bay Lake view and did have a view of the Magic Kingdom as well. We were on the 14th floor which is a bit high for me.... I am not a fan of heights. Everything else was great. We did have a bolod stain on the duvet, which they quickly replaced. I would stay again...as a matter of fact I am going back in December. The pool looked lovely, but the weather and timing didn't cooperate with taking advantage of the amenities. Give it a shot....it's quite nice and right on the monorail system for easy access to Epcot and walking distance to The Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Best for us!”
Reviews.Author: frenchladyalberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilderness Lodge and the South wing at the Contemporary Resort and Bay Lake is our Favorite! Bay Lake is simply newer, closer and better than the other resorts we tried. We liked the clean rooms, kitchen, confortable beds and easy access to monorail. This resort is very quiet but yet close to the action. Easy walk to MK. We had a view of MK and watched the fireworks every night! What could beat that! We would definately recommend the Bay Lake Resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best DVC resort yet....”
Reviews.Author: scootNewJersey
Reviews.Content: As a Disney vacation club member, I found this resort to the the best of the bunch that I have stayed out which include: Beach club, Boardwalk, Animal Kingdom, WildernessLodge. All of the resorts have their own special touches but this was my favorite so far. My wife, myself and 2 children stayed in a bay view studio which was slightly cramped but doable. I liked that the studio carved out a seperate entrance to the kitchen. As with all Disney properties it was very clean and well maintained Positves for Bay Lake- close proximinity to Magic Kingdom. Monorail access to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. It was really nice not having to take busses every day. The connection and walk to the Contemp resort was easy and convenient and the Contemorary resort has great dining(California Grill) and Chef Mickey's. Pool for Bay Lake was very nice, better than private DVC pools at all other resorts although we still spent the last day at the Contemporary pool instead which has been redone and is very nice. We got the opportunty to experience the nightly electrical boat parade as well which is unique to this DVC resort. As a DVC member you also get access to the top floor of the resort which has a full lounge with liquor and food as well the ability to see the fireworks at the Magic kingdom on the private deck. Negatives: Although it is listed as its own resort, everything is really done thru the main lobby of Contemporary resort so it more or less just an extension of the Contemporary. Can't really comment on cost or value since I am vacation club member (if you go to Disney World or vacation at least 1 time per year, you really should look into vacation club as it does pay for itself many times over) Overall, we really liked the resort but if I were not a DVC member I would probably compare to rates at Contemporary before booking and if similar go with Contemporary instead since most amenities are at that resort anyway..

Reviews.Title: “Magical Location”
Reviews.Author: kshark1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an 8th floor lake view two bedroom villa with seven adults and one 7 year old child. We all felt very comfortable with two adults in the master bedroom( king size bed), three adults in the second bedroom (two queens) and two adults and the child using the sleeper sofa and fold out chair( single bed size) in the living room. Three bathrooms and plenty of drawer and closet space. It came with all the Disney resort home away from home amenities which are listed in the description of the unit and I don't need to get into here. We originally asked for a magic kingdom view they were booked so we got a bay lake view which I am glad for because except for watching the fireworks at night the bay lake I think is a better view, I attached a photo of our view. Also being a vacation club member It cost me less points. We did have some problems which is why I can't give a five rating but with each problem we had the staff worked their buts off to take care of the issue with good results. This building is next to the Contemporary and the Contemporary is where you have to checkin it is also where the stores are, the restaurants to eat, and the transportation to the parks. In Bay Lake you will find a small lobby with a matrai'd but nothing else. This was a small inconvenience but the Contemporary is a small walk away either from the first floor lobby or a walkway on the fifth floor.The feeling you get when walking through the hallways to get to your room is kind of weird because of that contemporary kind of decor but once you get to your room you will be very pleased. I guess the hallways don't have that warm and fuzzy feeling you get with other Disney resorts.The problems we had are as follows. Upon checkin we had issues with putting our park admissions on our room key but this was not the fault of the checkin clerk, when I ordered my park passes over the phone the girl on the other end of line did not attach them to our room.
