We wanted everything on our room key( park passes and meal plan) so we only had to carry around one card for each person so it took awhile to checkin. Our room was not ready ( 11:00am) so we went to eat lunch but our cards did not work so we had to have cards issued again. They did not deduct any meals from our meal plan because of this so they gave us a free lunch for the inconvenience. We then proceeded to spend the rest f the day in Magic Kingdom.You can walk to the Kingdom from here but when someone tels you its a five minute walk don't believe them it is more like fifteen minutes.We got a call at 4:00 which is checkin time that our room was ready but we stayed in the park till 8:00 then went right to our room. All of bags were there, we called down to the front desk for our grocery order from Garden Grocer ( different review) and they delivered that right away. The room had a great view of the lake and pool area and was very clean EXCEPT for when we pulled out the couch sleeper sofa their was a lot of crumbs and somewhat dirty sheets. We called the front desk and they sent someone up right away to correct the problem.The rest of the unit was spotless. Like I said before it wasn't perfect but the staff was very helpful when we had an issue. The only other problems we had with the unit was the living room TV had fuzzy lower channels and the washer stopped working, but the front desk made sure these were taken care of. The things we loved about this place. LOCATION, close to the Magic Kingdom walking or monorail.Nothing better then being able to walk back from Magic Kingdom when the park closes and the busstops and monorail platform is packed. Monorail to Epcot and buses ( every 20 minutes) to the other parks. The pool area was fabulous it also has a poolside bar. The staff were real friendly and helpful. The unit we stayed in was very spacious and had everything we needed it was also very quiet didn't hear anything through the walls. Their is also a viewing platform for fireworks and a bar ( kids allowed) on the top floor. Access to the top floor is suppose to be only accessible to vacation club members( Sorry but membership has its privileges) but the maitre d did not always check this. You need to go to the first floor so the maitre d can give you access to the top floor.Another side note about being a vacation club member, whenever I stayed at a time share resort I never had maid service everyday it was only once a week but since we were members we had maid service everyday, if you are renting you will not have this. Also even though you have to take a short walk next door to the Contemporary it has everything you need for gift shopping plus extras for your room,restaurants table service or counter service, arcade, coffee shop and pastries along with a very friendly and helpful staff. Would I stay here again? Absolutely, their were some issues but the staff took care of those and the pluses far outweighed the minuses. I gave trip advisor permission to allow people to contact me so if you have questions just email me.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Natasha267
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this resort on October 29th-November 2nd...Awesome staff and resort! First off Disneys Magical Express is great..my husband was a little skeptical of disneys transportation because he thought that it would be slow and inconvenient..NOT! So glad we did not spend the few extra hundreds for a car rental. Bus was right at the airport when we arrived ..bus driver was super nice and ride was cool also. We were amazed when we arrived at the Resort. A lady greeted us as we arrived and escorted us to check-in and gave the kids mickey stickers! We were all given 1st Visit and Birthday buttons. Then came the "Key to the World" key card...up to our suite ...WOW! Big , spacious and very clean...whatever airhead complained about their suite is sick! We had a 1 bdrm 2 full bath villa with a full very modern kitchen, eat at bar and balcony with a view of Bay Lake. We have stayed in nothing but the best..Venetian in Las Vegas, The Hotel at Mandalay Bay, Marriotts all over and had a butler suite when we went to Jamaica..Everyone at the resort is super friendly..its so unreal how they will go out of their way to make you happy..i never saw an unhappy face or i never heard them say "i'm sorry or i dont know". Disneys bus, boats and monorail (which ran straight thru our resort..yay) was great to..we never waited more the 4-6 minutes for them. To top it all off Magic Kingdom is only about a 10-15 minute walk on the pathway. They made our vacation so memorable and magical..it left my 11 year daughter in tears when we had to leave :( I would definately recommend ...thanks Bay Lake Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Property!”
Reviews.Author: OfChorus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 'standard' view studio in early August. There are 3 adults - husband, 21 yo (6'4") son and me. Hubby & I shared a comfy queen size bed and son survived the sofa bed ('not as bad as most' he said). Our room faced a quiet lakeside shore on the opposite side from the main Contemporary tower. From the balcony we could look to the left and had a great view of the fireworks at Magic Kingdom (for which we could also hear the music from our in-room t.v.). For our Disney Vacation Club points - the standard view is better than "lake view" as you usually have a good chance of side view of fireworks. The first time we stayed in a studio (when they first opened) I don't remember a separate sink area in the toilet and shower area - you had to use the wetbar area. However, that has been remedied and there is a nice sink in the same room with the toilet and shower/tub. The wetbar/kitchenette area is spacious and has great storage space. If it was just my husband and me, this room would be just fine for extended stay. However, with 3 adults (or probably anything more than 2 adults) it would probably not be very comfortable for more than a night or two. It was quite a hike over to the Contemporary resort which housed the restaurants, shopping, and monorail - but still better than driving to the other resorts on the monorail route. We only live an hour from the Mouse, but find our little one/two night 'getaways' for that hour drive are worth the expense of DVC membership. We can drive an hour and feel like we are a thousand miles from stresses of work and 'everyday.' We rarely ever go into the parks, but enjoy watching the faces of children and meeting families who are here for the first time. My main complaint about this resort is that there is no separate check-in for the Bay Lake Towers - all check in is done over at the Contemporary. It would be nice to be able to check-in in the same building in which our studio or villa is housed. We've also stayed in a one bedroom villa (about a year earlier) and loved the layout and wise use of space. We had 4 adults on that trip (husband, son, his friend, and me) and the separate bathroom for the guys was wonderful for this 'lone' woman on the trip. This is a great resort for families and couples!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, so close to the Magic”
Reviews.Author: Travelozzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time this year after taking our DVC membership last year. The rooms are a fairly good size (we stayed in a Studio which was fine for the three of us) and are very clean and comfortable with all the ameneties you could need. All of the units have a small balcony. We had a lake / pool view which is without a doubt the best view - even though you can't see the Magic Kingdom, you can just head up to the Top of the World lounge if you want to watch the fireworks and they pipe the music in there too - and the Habanero Magarita is just to die for!. The rooms with a view of the Magic Kingdom also have a view of the car park. The lake view also lets you see the electrical water parade from your balcony, so for me it's the best option. All of the cast (staff) were lovely as you expect from Disney especially the girls that did the pool activities for kids each afternoon... really sweet and great memories! The pool area is lovely and well laid out. There isn't a huge selection of places to buy food but as we like to get out and about, this didn't really concern us too much. It was definatley worth doing Chef Mickey's across the bridge at the Contemporary thou - excellent fun!! There really is no reason not to stay here, espcially if you want to be right up close to Magic Kingdom.... it was just great!

Reviews.Title: “"Simply Magical"”
Reviews.Author: Iluvaruba123
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake Tower was wonderful! The room was modern and spacious, the views magnificent. The restaurants in the Contemporary were great, and the convenient transportation was perfect. Pool area was quiet and a nice way to spend some time when not in the parks. I have been a Disney Vacation Club member for 10 years and have visited most of their properties. I will tell you that Bay Lake Tower did not disappoint! Another great property from Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Magic!”
Reviews.Author: cody432
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all but one of the Disney Vacation Club properties and Bay Lake Towers is another winner! Love the modern design, the proximity to the Magic Kingdom and other resorts on Bay Lake and the convenience of the monorail! The pool is great and you can also use the pool at the Contemporary resort too for a bit of variety! The only down side(if you can call it that) is that it does lack a certain vacation club community feel that you get at old key west, beach club etc, but still a lovely property! Try it at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Magic”
Reviews.Author: Meggysmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroomed villa. Fantastic amount of space and the two bathrooms were very handy. Great, fully fitted kitchen and handy washer/dryer. The place was very clean but I thought some of the furniture was a bit tatty considering it hasn't been open very long. Small balcony had a lovely view over bay lake and the Marina but unfortunately it wasn't screened and we were plagued by mosquitoes, they didn't seem to bite but they were pretty revolting! No reception so had to check-in at Contemporary next door which seemed a bit ridiculous but must say the staff we encountered there were lovely and very efficient. Fantastic location, less than 10 minutes walk and we were in Magic Kingdom. Also a walkway on level 5 takes you to Contemporary where you catch the monorail to get to the transportation centre and one quick monorail then to Epcot. As a DVC member we could use the Top of the world Lounge on the 16th floor which was a fantastic setting from which to watch the fireworks at Magic Kingdom too. Decor was very retro and fun and the bed was really comfy. Would definitely stay here again but would take more insect repellent!

Reviews.Title: “Best DVC stay yet; studio for two.”
Reviews.Author: Mom3girls
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing bad to say about any Disney property. We bought a set of points at BLT with reservations, not really loving the modern theme/decor. But staying here is a whole other ball of wax, that is, a whole different perspective. BLT is by far the best in my book. We usually take a studio to save more points for more stays on-site, and the BLT studio has the most storage, the most functionality of such storage. The t.v. unit consists of 6 drawers, and alongside the t.v. is another large cabinet with shelves, there is a large closet with ample hangers (the kind that you have at home, they are not "attached" to the clothes rod), and the kitchenette ... I should have so much storage at home! Next to the dorm-size fridge is 3 or 4 drawers (inside the top drawer is a silverware rack with said items, plus a corkscrew and can opener), and next to that is the under-sink cabinet. On the other side of the fridge is a ceiling-height pull-out pantry (similar to the ones you see at Ikea)! Above the sink is another cabinet, this one a horizontal unit with a "garage-door" type door, in which are the plates, glasses and mugs. This is all along one side-wall. The other side wall confused me - half of it is just some decorative panels, but beside that is another counter with a large well-lit mirror, and below that is several open shelves for more storage. The back wall of this food-prep space is covered with a large (full-length) mirror. The bathrooms are the smallest I've seen so far (we've stayed at AKL-JH & KV, as well as OKWR) and unfortunately do not offer the "split" in these other hotels (that is, where the commode has it's own "room") but is quite nice despite that. There is a shelf in the under-sink cabinet, and there is a set of shelves next to the sink that was sufficient for the two of us. The only time I'd think it would fall short is if you have teenage girls with you! Of course, if that were the situation, you might want to rethink staying only in a studio. I asked for a studio in an even-numbered room on the highest floor possible, and was rewarded with a great view of the Magic Kingdom. If you tune your in-room t.v. to channel 20, you can hear Wishes as it is played out over the castle, and watch it from your balcony! Almost nothing can top that in my opinion. The service, well it's Disney Customer Service, on a par with no other company. The value, excellent if you are Disney lovers. The beds are excellent, the cleanliness as well. The restaurants are all in the adjacent Contemporary, accessible either on the ground or by the skywalk, which connects the 5th floor of BLT with the 4th floor at the Contemporary (which is the floor where two of the restaurants and the 3 shops are located). Being able to just walk next door for food or for the monorail beats everything (save for watching and listening to Wishes! from my balcony!)! The restaurants are also on the Disney level of service. The California Grill on the rooftop affords a spectacular view of the Magic Kingdom and evening fireworks. If you're not dining during the fireworks but still wish to view them from there, you can save the receipt from your meal and be able to access their viewing deck to watch. The Wave, another fine-dining venue, is on the ground floor at the end of the registration and concierge desks. Chef Mickey's offers buffet and character meals, and the Contempo Cafe counter-service food (these are both on the 4th floor). The only negative thing about the Contemporary and BLT is the size of their elevators, they are a bit small; it was difficult when there was a stroller or scooter and 2 families as well.

Reviews.Title: “Modern look, minutes to Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Shan3034
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. It was so quiet, and the decor was modern, clean and Disney, without being over the top. Yes, the walk to the Contemporary for food/beverage can be an annoyance, but I didn't mind the exercise. However the walk to the MK was great, especially after a late-night special event when transportation is limited. It takes a looooong time to get the Downtown Disney by bus, but that's pretty standard for most resorts. I would return here in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Always The Best”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Bay Lake twice and each time it has been a great stay. We are DVC members and with children still having the Magic Kingdom as their number one target, Bay Lake is the most convenient and quality choice. It's an 8 1/2 minute walk to and from the Magic Kingdom and after a long day and the late fireworks, its a great feeling to be able to walk home knowing the bus lines are quite longer a wait. Room quality is great and the views are awesome, especially if you get a MK view. The monorail at the Contemporary is a short walk through the bridge-way where you have the game room, shops (we buy a Disney pin each night for the kids here as a tradition) and of course Chef Mickey's. Our stay was in a one bedroom (three kids, mom and dad). Mom and the two girls got to sleep in the private bedroom with their own bathroom while my son and I took the pull out sofa bed (we had the kitchen all to ourselves each night for a snack)! Convenience of the washer/dryer is great and we used it on our 7-night trip. I highly encourage anyone looking at the Deluxe level for your next WDW trip to look into Bay Lake, especially if you plan on visiting the Magic Kingdom a few times on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room with comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: BigshotOtown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days in october. The room was a lake view studio. It had plenty of room for my wife and I and our 3 and 5 yr old girls. Nice place. very clean. did lack some of the disney magic that other hotels have, but the location is great. Only took us 8 min. to walk home from MK instead of waiting in that crowded line at the monorails when it closed at night. The staff was very accomodating and welcome you home as soon as you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: nifferearly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times, as Disney Vacation Club members. My most recent stay was July 15, 2011. I stayed in both a studio and one bedroom. The studio layout is the best of any DVC properties. Spacious room with a nice kitchen area off to the side, instead of in the entrance hallway. I love the one bedrooms at this resort because they include 2 full baths. My mother travels with us, so it's great to have separate bathrooms. Pros of the resort: 10 minute walk to Magic Kingdom. View of Fireworks from the top-floor lounge or possibly your room (tune to channel 20 on the TV for the music). Rooms have a beautiful modern decor. Nice community hall with lots of craft activities and video games for the kids. Fun water slide and daily pool activities for kids. Very comfortable mattresses! Cons: The walk over to the Contemporary for the monorail is almost as long as walking directly to Magic Kingdom. Very poor bus service for a deluxe hotel. You have to go over to the Contemporary and then it stops at a couple other hotels. I would definitely rent a car at this resort. If you're planning to spend a lot of time off Disney property, this resort is not convenient to I-4. You'll spend a lot of time driving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but others are better”
Reviews.Author: DLCote
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake Tower (BLT) was one of the only WDW resorts we had yet to stay in, including all the Home Away from Home villas as DVC members. We stayed at BLT for 3 nights/4 days before moving over to Beach Club Villas (BCV) for a week. While we were glad we stayed there, we were happy to transfer at the end of our BLT stay. The resort is new, which is always a plus. Check-in is at the Contemporary, not at the tower, which is consistent with other DVC resorts. The lobby decor is nice - a modern theme. The hallways are clean and curved, since the building is circular. In the hallways and elevators, you feel like you're in a high-rise apartment building in a city, so if you're looking for a vacation-like or homey feel, you won't get it here. The room was nice. We stayed in a studio, and one of the best things about it was the different layout than other DVC studios. Other studios have a microwave, refridgerator, etc. in the entrance hallway, whereas BLT has a separate galley kitchen with quite a bit of food storage space. We didn't have any food to store, but we liked that we could! Also, after member complaints of no sink in the bath, they moved it from the galley area (still has a kitchen sink) to the bath where it belongs. An extra counter with a mirror in the kitchen gives another place for hair/makeup in the AM, although if we were using the kitchen, I'm not sure that's a sanitary option. The bathroom had the two most negative complaints of the unit. It was clean and appointed as any other bath, except a) it lacked hooks to hang towels and other items; it only had shelves, which you don't want to put wet handtowels and facecloths there, and b) the tile floor was the most slippery surface I have ever encountered in my life, including ice skates on a freshly Zamboni-ed rink! We had to remember to hold onto things as we walked in there. If you fall it's small, so the risk of coming down on the tub, toilet, or sink is high. We found it really dangerous. My husband thought the bed and pillows were comfortable, and he's really picky about them. Despite our early request and confirmation of that request a couple weeks before of being on a high floor, we were only on the second. Disappointing, but we realize requests aren't guaranteed. So although the view off of our balcony wasn't high, we overlooked other parts of the resort, beach area, and marina - not bad. We went to the Top of the World lounge our first evening there, and although it was nice, we were disappointed with the VERY limited food options and the sizes of what we did order vs. what we paid. I would go again for drinks but would make sure I ate first. Going out on the balcony to view the fireworks is nice, and although it was a Friday night and one that a Halloween party was going on at the Magic Kingdom (MK) - meaning less people were at the park since it was a special ticketed event, thus more people could've been at the resort - it wasn't crowded on the roof deck. It's a bit of a pain to get up to the lounge since you have to go to the first floor lobby to be let up by the concierge. OK, I guess that's one bonus to only being on the second floor. The pool area was fine; nothing all that special - a small waterslide and the pool is a decent size. The bar has some limited food that is convenient, and the food court isn't far at the Contemporary (or for a fee they will bring an order to you). As a runner, outdoor options are limited if you want variety. The path around the resort is short, so it's easy to get bored if you want to run more than a couple miles. For one stretch, I tried running out to MK and past it as far as you can go. It was getting congested with park guests, so I'd only recommend that if you run early before the park opens. The theming of all other WDW resorts (except for Pop Century) is based on places - e.g., New Orleans (POFQ, POR), Africa (AKL, AKV), New Jersey Shore (BW, BWV), Cape Cod (BC, BCV), the Northwest (WL, VWL), etc., wherewas BLT and the Contemporary are based on a time period - and one that only exists for awhile (the future) until you reach it, then it's outdated. Because of that, I think the little theming touches of other resorts are missing here, which is something most WDW guests enjoy. Being walking distance to MK was definitely nice - no bus, boat, or monorail needed. Since we don't have children, we'll would probably only stay here for a couple nights for the MK advantage, then move over to the Epcot area where we spend more time and like those resorts (Boadwalk, Beach Club, and Yacht Club) much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: the-z-family
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and this was my first stay at Bay Lake Tower. I was prepared to not like it very much after I had read many reviews on another site from unhappy DVC members who did not care for it. I was totally blown away. We had a studio - I loved the decor and the set up of the studio. Loved that the kitchenette has it own seperate area - we treated this as a bar area since we were there for a girls weekend for Food & Wine festival and made good use of it! As others have mentioned, the tile on the floors of the bathroom are super slick. They're pretty but dangerous, especially when wet. I can't imagine that people haven't taken a fall on them, a lot. The same tile was used in the bathroom by the pool. I also agree about the showerhead I saw on a few reviews, although I was ok with it because I didn't have to work hard to get shampoo out of my thick hair. I am guessing our room has been one of the ones that was changed because we did have a sink in the bathroom and ony one sink in the kithenette. Also, we had a huge full length mirror in the kitchenette area as well that took up the entire wall area at the end of the kitchenette. The bed was really comfy and I didn't mind the fact these studios were a tad smaller than the other DVC properties. The only thing I didn't care for was the bathroom door, as others have mentioned. There is basically no privacy. We did use the pool for an hour or two one afternoon and found it to be a bit small for the size of the resort. we had to walk aropund the pool a few times to find 2 chairs next to one another and we did find that the sun went behind the building at about 3pm. Didn't bother me but if I were looking to get a tan it would be an issue! The feel of the pool is a bit sterile compared to the other DVC properties. Kind of boring but again a non issue. One of the best features of this property is the top of the world lounge, This exceeded my expectations. We went up to check it out and were treated to Hallowishes, the fireworks show at Magic Kingdom for the Halloween party. The pipe the music in so its really cool. The lounge itself is very hip, although we did not have a drink there I plan to go back for snacks and drinks in the future. Loved it. Of course the 10 minute or less walk to Magic Kingdom is a plus as well. We took the monorial to Epcot for the festival and that was convenient as well. Had a great time, we will definitely be back again soon - if I can get a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect disney stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicky A
Reviews.Content: Full equipped apartments at walking distance from Magic Kingdom. Specially ideal for family with small children. We were 3 adults and 2 children in one beautiful and spacious apartment. The hotel has activities for children during the day and night! you have easy access to all parks and three restaurants (1 fastfood) and a small supermarket inside the hotel!! the price is high, but the rooms and views are worth it! I just hope we stayed more and used the installatiions further!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1967foodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bay Lake in a studio unit for two nights. Check in is at the Contemporary Resort. We were checked in very quickly and in our rooms with in 15 minutes of arriving at the resort. Room was clean with a view of Bay Lake and the Contemporary Resort. Decor was very modern with lots of stainless steel and dark brown tones. Bed was a queen size that was very comfortable. Bay Lakeâ€™s greatest asset is its location. All, and I mean ALL, services are at the Contemporary Resort. The 5th floor walkway between the hotels makes getting between them easy. It is a ten minute walk to the MK, and the monorail or busses can get you anywhere in WDW you want to go. Bay Lake has a few issues: 1. Bathroom floors â€“ are very shiny and slick. Nearly killed myself stepping onto bath mat while getting out of shower. Wife had same issue. 2. Shower heads and water pressure â€“ the shower head is not adjustable and the water pressure is so strong that it feels like needles hammering at your skin. If a child turned on the shower and got a water jet in the eye it could cause serious injury. You turn on the shower with a sliding lever that we discovered can control the pressure as well. There are no instructions about this in the bathroom. 3. Bathroom doors - I understand this is being addressed and will be changed, BUT, until then beware â€“ there is a large gap left open when the door is closed. This allows others to see into the bathroom, specifically the shower area. May be a problem with kids. 4. No full length mirror anywhere in the room â€“ real problem for my wife. 5. Sink in the kitchen â€“ There is no sink in the bathroom; itâ€™s in the kitchen area. There are two sinks in the kitchen area, one for dishes and one for the bath. Makes it a tight fit if someone is getting coffee and someone else is fixing their hair. I understand this is also being addressed by DVC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramona O
Reviews.Content: The clerks were very nice when we checked in. It was a quick Check-in. Our room was on the tower facing the pool. 6th floor, you can hear cheering from Chef Mickey's. It was a wonderful motivational wakeup to start us on a magical day. The early sunrise is breathtaking!. Very comfortable beds and plenty of soft comforting pillows. We had a cooler in our room but no microwave which we didn't expect. The pool was really nice in late evening. They have towels available in the pool area.. The buses took a long time to arrive when the Monorail was closed after park closing and when we wanted to catch it from other parks to our Resort. Above all that is said and done. Contemporary is the best place to stay!!! I will be returning

Reviews.Title: “Adult Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl18528
Reviews.Content: We have Disney time share and this is the first time we stayed at Bay Lake. It is right next to the Magic Kingdom and attached to the Contemporary Resort. They have a Top of the Lounge bar that is unbelievable. The views are great and only time share guests are allowed. You can see the Magic Kingdom fireworks up close and it is spectacular. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable. However, no wireless - go figure!! Disney needs to step up and put wireless in all their hotels. DEFINITELY GIVE IT A TRY!! The pool is beautiful. They have a fire pit at night, hot tub and a beautiful electric light parade on the adjacent lake.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: I think there's only one reason to stay at this resort - if you want to be close to the Magic Kingdom, it doesn't get any closer! You can walk over to the Magic Kingdom in less than 10 minutes, which we found to be the ultimate convenience. No need to wait in line for the monorail and visit the other 4 monorail stops to reach Magic Kingdom. And the castle view from our room was pretty neat, especially for our 5 year old who loves fireworks. The resort itself really isn't anything to write home about. The corridors are very sterile-looking. And beware - The shiny floor tiles at the entry door thresholds become VERY SLIPPERY when they are freshly cleaned. Several members of our family almost fell. The rooms are contemporary and over-designed, to the point of being impractical (for both guests and the maintenance team). While the sliding partitions that make up one wall of the master bathroom (in a one-bedroom villa) look cool, they don't block any sound coming out of the bathroom and actually allow some light to leak out in the middle of the night. If that light isn't enough to wake you up, the sliding doors with frosted glass inserts on the bathroom and toilet room are loud and flood the master bedroom with light. And these doors fall off! The door on our toilet room fell off its track on the second day of our trip (almost trapping my husband inside the toilet room! Just think if it would've been my 5 year old in there!) and wasn't fixed until the fourth day, despite calling maintenance immediately. The lighting at the bathroom sink is the WORST I've ever experienced in any hotel room. It was nearly impossible for my husband to shave at the sink, and putting on makeup became my daily challenge. I was worried about being mistaken for a cast member from The Haunted Mansion, since that's what I looked like in the bathroom mirror! And then there was the shower! We stayed in two different rooms on the 7th floor. In the first room, there was a wall mounted shower head and a ceiling mounted shower head, but not enough water pressure to power either one. After lathering up, I wasn't sure I could get the shampoo out of my hair! In the second room, the ceiling mounted shower head had been removed, and the water pressure was adequate, but barely. When we checked into our first room, the sink in the master bathroom was clogged, so I made my first call to maintenance within 10 minutes of checking in. And the room was dirty! There were visible dust bunnies on the shades of the wall-mounted lights and some long, black hairs that obviously weren't mine on the bathroom floor, trapped under my favorite sliding doors. YUCK! The pool was great for our 5 year old, but older kids would've gotten bored. And the pool is positioned so that it's completely shaded by the building in the afternoon! Who designed this place?!!!! They should've gone back to the drawing board!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and new rooms”
Reviews.Author: floss44
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to disney world and I was very pleased indeed with my choice of accomadation . I can understand that some people would think that it has no disney atmosphere but I think its location and the new rooms more than make up for this . The monorail runs straight through the main building and it is in walking distance to The magic Kingdom . It was so close to all of the parks that we came back to the room in the heat of the day for a rest and headed back out in the late afternoon . Food options are also good with options for all tastes and budgets , I would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “2 bedroom”
Reviews.Author: vicky59Kansas
Reviews.Content: We have a large family and had reserved a 2 bedroom on the 16th floor which is the Disney Vacation Club members floor. Our unit was nicely organized and we took all of our evening meals in our unit because it had a kitchen and dining area and this gave us more time to enjoy the resorts' pool, hot tub, etc. (You can have the resort pick up your food for you or go off-site and buy your own) The laundry room was a bonus with our large group and and each unit has a child's "Pack and Play' crib. The resort is a contemporary styled resort that is both beautiful and comfortable. Our unit had 3 bathrooms, all with showers and 1 with a bathtub. Each bedroom had a deck and we viewed the lake, it was gorgeous! The Lake view will also give you a view of the Electric Light Parade on the lake which occurs each night about 10 pm-approximately 20 minutes after the fireworks display at Magic Kingdom. (If you face MK or the parking lot, go to the pool after the fireworks to watch this display on the lake) Viewing the lake will also give you viewing of para-sailing, boats on the lake and lots of huge birds. There was easy access to the viewing of the evening fireworks at Magic Kingdom, and it is my belief that this viewing is for the DVC members, but the viewing at the adjoining contemporary is just as good as BLT. (There is a connecting hall to the Contemporary Resort on the 5th floor.) We had heard that non-DVC members could go to the front desk and be escorted up to the 16th floor, but didn't confirm this.).The fireworks during our stay was both the "Wishes" display and the "Micky's Not So Scary Halloween" display and these displays are different and equally enjoyable. The pools at BLT was great, the hot tub nice, and the activities for the kids and family (movies, games, video rentals, boats to rent) are plentiful, there is always something to do after the parks close at this resort. Access to Magic Kingdom is a short walk away, the location is fantastic! It is a great location for those with young children who need a break from the parks to take naps, have a nice lunch, or just hang out in the pool for a few hours. We had a rental van and we were given a parking pass upon check in which admits you into the BLT parking. You will receive 'key cards' for the members of your party and will occasionally be asked to show this as your car enter the property at the gate. Our stay was a good one with the only hiccup being the floor near a closet became very wet. A service man promptly came up to vacuum up the water and fix an issue with the air conditioning that was the problem. We had a great stay here and look forward to coming back "Home!"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but lacks some of that "Disney" magic”
Reviews.Author: wildcatkb
Reviews.Content: So, I have been to Walt Disney World probably about 20 times now (quite honestly, I stopped keeping track), and decided itâ€™s time to review a couple of the on-property resorts Iâ€™ve stayed at recently. Iâ€™ve stayed in just about every kind of room they have to offer: value, moderate, and deluxe resorts, as well as studios, 2-bedroom, and 3-bedroom Vacation Club Villas, and I hope that this review offers a fair (by my opinion) assessment of Bay Lake Tower in comparison to what Iâ€™ve grown to know and love about Disney over the years. The room: We stayed in a studio at Bay Lake Tower for this trip. It had one queen sized bed, a bathroom with shower and toilet, and a kitchenette area (included plasticware and some dishes) that also contained the bathroom sink area (more on that in a minute). I LOVED the artwork, it was some of the best Iâ€™ve seen in a resort room, very eye-catching. I thought the bed was pretty comfortable. Being a studio, there was plenty of open-air storage space, which was nice since the closet space was a little lacking (although drawer space for clothes and food was pretty decent). The balcony was a good size and though we were on the side facing the pool, the view was nice (got to watch the sunrise!). I would say though, that if you can afford it, getting a view of Bay Lake Tower and the Magic Kingdom is the way to go at this resort. While the pool view was pretty nice, the way the building curves inward on the pool side made me feel very close to my neighbors when I sat on the balcony. One thing I hated in the room was the shower - it was so incredibly strong, it felt like 1000 needles cutting me, and there was no way to adjust it that we could find. I can imagine if you had even a small sunburn, it would be unbearable. Iâ€™ve heard that this is not the case with other showers in the same resort, although Iâ€™m not sure why they would have different showers in different rooms. Also, the room did not have a full length mirror. There was a decent sized one in the living area, but to see full length, I had to stand on the ottoman, which is sort of annoying. Lastly, the layout of the studios at Bay Lake Tower is terrible (itâ€™s different from the 1, 2, and 3-bedroom villas, and even different from some other studio villas at other resorts). A Bay Lake Tower studio has a bathroom with just a shower and toilet, which is not unheard of â€“ Disney generally separates the sink area from the shower and toilet. This bathroom did not have a lock on it, which I thought was weird. However, the bathroom sink area is located in the kitchenette area â€“ what the heck?? It was so cramped, and also kind of gross â€“ hairbrushes near my food? No thanks. There was plenty of counter space at the bathroom sink, but I would have preferred a larger mirror and two sinks - it was difficult for two people to get ready at once with only one sink, although it would probably be even more way too cramped with two. You should also keep in mind with any Vacation Club Villa you may stay in, that maid service only comes I think once every 4 days, they donâ€™t come every day. The pool: We went to the pool a few times. I think itâ€™s a little too small for the size of the resort, as we occasionally had trouble finding two chairs together, depending on the time of day. Otherwise, it was fine and we did enjoy our time there. Itâ€™s not overrun with children, although they do have activities with a DJ to keep the kids occupied, and they all seemed to be having a blast. We didnâ€™t try the water slide or the bar (both looked pretty standard). The Top of the World Lounge: This was really great. Itâ€™s a lounge that can only be enjoyed by Disney Vacation Club members, or if a member books your room for you. In chatting with the (wonderfully friendly!) bartender, I learned that it is in fact available to ALL Vacation Club members, but that many donâ€™t realize they can come over to use it even if they donâ€™t own or stay there (Iâ€™ve heard otherwise from some members, but I assume the bartender knows what she is talking about). Itâ€™s a shame more people donâ€™t use this area, because the bartenders are some of the best Iâ€™ve run into on the Disney property, both in personality and ability to mix a great drink. The lounge was always very quiet and relaxed whenever we went up there, and there is a huge balcony area outside where you can enjoy the Magic Kingdom fireworks with music piped in to the speakers from the Magic Kingdom. The view is a little off-center, but itâ€™s really cool, plus you donâ€™t have to battle people inside the park to get a good spot! We ordered some appetizers, which were ok but not great. Food is definitely not the main draw for Bay Lake Tower. The resort itself: You canâ€™t really beat the location, itâ€™sa very easy walk to the Magic Kingdom from Bay Lake Tower, plus the Contemporary is connected via a footbridge, and with a 2 minute walk to the Contemporary, you have access to the monorail plus all the dining and shopping. There is no real dining or shopping at Bay Lake Tower, other than the bar at the pool. It actually doesnâ€™t even have its own check-in desk, you have to go to the Contemporary to check-in. Bay Lake Tower has a very small lobby with a greeter, but itâ€™s not bustling with the normal Disney hotel activity. Itâ€™s not a huge deal, but it might be nice to have a snack bar or quick service restaurant in Bay Lake Tower, so that you donâ€™t have to walk over to the Contemporary for just a cup of coffee in the morning. We waited a long time for buses (Bay Lake Tower and the Contemporary share a bus stop), although this is not the normal experience that Iâ€™ve had the past 25 years or so visiting â€“ normally the buses are very good. I think itâ€™s obvious that Disney has cut back in the tough economy, and surely there are fewer drivers and they are doing fewer routes that are much longer and less frequent. Overall, I think Bay Lake Tower is worthy of a 4 star rating because it really is a beautiful hotel with fabulous furniture, artwork, and lighting, plus you canâ€™t find a better location to stay in. However, for me, it lacked a lot of the Disney theming that I enjoy about staying on property there. It had more of just a generic nice hotel feel, than a â€œDisneyâ€� feel that places like the Animal Kingdom Lodge or the Boardwalk Resort have. I probably wouldnâ€™t spend that much money to stay again, as I would probably prefer to stay at a moderate resort like Port Orleans that is heavier on the theming, since thatâ€™s something that I love about Disney. It is, however, a really nice hotel that I wouldnâ€™t caution against staying in â€“ itâ€™s all about what you like to make you feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic For Young Families!”
Reviews.Author: MickeyMommy
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a 1 bedroom bay lake view villa for four nights. The location cannot be beat. So convenient to return to the resort during the mid-day heat and jump in the pool, or put our two preschoolers down for a nap. Speaking of pools, our kids loved the it! Fantastic waterslide, kid activities, and life vests were plenty available. The grounds of the hotel are gorgeous. Due to the close proximity, we often returned to the Magic Kingdom in the evening. We were able to watch the water parade outside every evening at 10, and could watch the fireworks from the resort as well. Movies were shown on the lawn between the Bay Lake and Contemporary. The buses were always punctual, and taking the monorail to other resorts and Epcot is so convenient, we would pop our boys into their double stroller inside the room, and they wouldn't have to get out until getting on the first ride. The one bedroom villa was great for families. We could put our kids down for the night and not have to tiptoe around them. We ate breakfast a few mornings there, and it was nice to have an extra full bathroom for getting ready mornings. I spent a lot of time researching for our Disney vacation.I read every review I could get my hands on for fear I would be disappointed once I arrived. Disney's Bay Lake is expensive, but well worth it. I cannot imagine ever staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Magic Kingdom lovers with family”
Reviews.Author: PMKphilly
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from Bay Lake Tower. My husband and myself brought our three kids (ages 16 - 27 yrs) and our 5 year old granddaughter. We stayed in a two bedroom which was great. Much more room than I thought. The master bedroom had a very comfortable king bed, balcony and a full bath and whirlpool tub. Very nice! The second bedroom had a full bathroom with two double beds and a balcony. The open concept living room, dining room, kitchen also had a full bathroom. Pull out sofa and fold out bed/chair was great! Three bathrooms for 6 people made for ease in getting ready to head to the parks each day. Pool area was a nice size. We used room service twice and found them to quick and delicious! Would recommend to extended family as very comfortable. My only complaint was that I paid to upgrade to Magic Kingdom view as I love to watch the fireworks each night from my room BUT room 7330 is NOT full view! Couldn't see the show! That said, I would return because it is soo convenient to my fave park and holds my entire family (even a few more as we add on in the future) but will not pay to upgrade my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: WeDVC2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a standard view studio in September 2011. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We loved being so close to Magic Kingdom and a monorail ride away from Epcot. Our view was amazing! Even though it was a standard view we could see part of the Lake and Space Mountain from our balcony. We even had an unobstructed view of the fireworks from Magic Kingdom. The only complaint we had was on the ceiling of our room, someone had smashed a few mosquitoes. We figured housekeeping probably doesn't look up alot when cleaning rooms so we mentioned it to the desk and they thanked us for the tip and assured us it would be addressed. All in all we cant wait to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “A nice visit”
Reviews.Author: ayerranger
Reviews.Content: We have been Vacation club members for years, that's why its hard to write anything negative. Our home base is the wilderness lodge,we have stayed there, saratoga springs, the yacht club and the board walk. All of these have the Disney feel. Bay lake does not. If you are into contemporary living then its for you. Staying there we didn't feel like we were inside the park until we left the resort. The grounds on the pool side are not Disney at all and most of it is taken up with 2 shuffleboard and 2 bocci courts that no one used. Nice pool but very small, the slide is a nice touch. We did like the private lounge upstairs to watch the fireworks each night. We had a 1 bedroom very well equipped condo. Comfortable and spacious. Its new so we decided to give it a try but it didn't feel like Disney at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: momoftwinsAlabama
Reviews.Content: BLT is great for many reasons. You can walk to the magic kingdom or cause across the skywalk to the contemporary and catch the monorail. You have to have a room key to get in BLT. The pool is great with a big slide for the kids and hot tub for the adults. We stayed in a studio that was very room with a small kitchen, balcony, table and chairs, couch and bed. Nice big bathroom. My kids slept on the pull out couch. They were 3 yrs old at the time so I slept with them a little while one night. It was the most comfortable pull out I have ever slept on. The bed was great. The only real downside to the place for me is the decor. It is very adult and abstract. We are in DISNEY WORLD, where is mickey mouse and all the bright beautiful colors? Other than that, fantastic place to stay in, very helpful staff, very nice room, great view, nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing....”
Reviews.Author: tmacy
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, especially considering there were 2 rooms with 14 people. There was one snag because we added someone to our reservation but it was handled quickly. About 20 minutes after we arrived we were in our room with our luggage and groceries delivered. Our rooms were beautiful, we had everything we needed. The views were spectacular and it was simply magical. Nothing beats the walk to Magic Kingdom or the view from the Top Of The World lounge. I'd read a couple of poor reviews before booking and was a little nervous, but the feeling left quickly upon arrival. Everyone in my family couldn't get enough of the room and the pool. I can't say enough about Bay Lake Tower. I've been to Disney World about 9 times and and nothing compares to my stay at Bay Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: peteytee05
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing suite in the Towers. We had five adults and two kids (5 and 3) and had plenty of room to spare in the two bedroom suite. The rooms were very clean and the pool was very fun for the kids and adults alike. We could walk right to the entrance of the Magic Kingdom and it was a very nice perk. I wouldn't have changed anything about the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: NIRW
Reviews.Content: All the comforts of home and more - stayed in a three bedroom unit which with a fully fitted kitchen, laundry room etc. Nice to come back to luxurious comfortable accomodation after time spent in the parks. Connected to the Contemporary Resort for access to the monorail - a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Can I Blame the Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Dibs73
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at my Home Base (Bay Lake Tower) since becoming a DVC member 2 years ago. The hotel itself did not disappoint. I had a magic kingdom view 1 BR appartment for me, my wife and 3 yr old son. the location is great. When going to the MK we used the walkway and when heading out to Epcot we used the Monrail via the MK. The room itself is well appointed and nicely decorated. The property relies on the Contemporary for checkin, restuarants, etc with the exception of the wonderful members only bar on the 16th floor. Check it out for the fireworks and a nice cocktail. The pool at the Bay Lake tower seemed less crowded than the main pool at the Contemporaty but both could be used. My son thoroughly loved the slides at both, not to mention Saratoga pool and Boardwalk Pool (pool hopping). Now the complaints. the monorail broke down 4 of the 5 nights we used it. In one case we were literally stranded at the Floridian for 2 hours awaiting a bus to get us back. On principle I didn't want to pay for a cab but should have in hindsight. I can't blame this on the Bay Lake Tower but patrons should be aware that apparently this has been happening for weeks based on the age of the trains (last upgraded in 92). I spoke with two conductors and they mentioned Disney is aware of the problems and working to fix it. When the monorail works its soooo much nicer for parents with a stroller than a bus as you don't have to close the stroller down. Secondly, and again I can't blame this on Bay Lake Tower but it's something to consider when booking. The MK was closed for a private religious celebration Friday night and saturday. There were sound checks all night long that were so loud my wife was up all night both nights. I too could hear them but slept through them. We live in Boston(in the city) so we are used to noise but this was ridiculous. I can confirm that the Contemporary managers received many, many complaints. The MK side for the extra points may not be worth it. The noise is pretty bad in addition to the sound checks there were trash trucks, car alarms, etc. Overall our experience was wonderful and the lines were non existent but some of the star lost its luster due to these issues that disney shouldb't be allowing to happen. I might suggest the Bay lake side to avoig the noise but gain the same experience at this lovely location and property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay again!”
Reviews.Author: asty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this August. We stayed in a Bay Lake Studio. We requested a high floor lake room. When we arrived they wanted us to stay in a second floor room, but we just had to waitna bit longer and were up on the 14th. Everything was fantastic. The only gripe I do have is people putting towels on the sun beds. There is very little shade, yet people put towels under the umbrellas and did not show all day. We spent a day by the Grand Floridian Pool and they clear towels off if no one is there, which perhaps they should do at Bay Lake. However, the walk to Magic Kingdom, the service and everything else is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Disney World hotel walking distance to the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: JamesMMunoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney World's Bay Lake Tower at Disney's Contemporary Resort again this August. The hotel is a Disney Vacation Club resort hotel and it is perfect if you have little ones. You can walk to the Magic Kingdom or ride the famed Monorrail from the connected Contemporary Resort. The 2BR villa we stayed in had three full bathrooms, full kitchen, washer/dryer and plenty of space. Our view was the "Marina/Lake" view - gorgeous. The room(s) were clean and the a/c worked perfectly. We will be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: DaveBFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed with vacation club friends over a weekend at the bay lake. It is a nice hotel right next to magic kingdom. Room was wonderful, 2 bedroom with sleeping up to 9 guests. We had 4 adults and 4 children. Beautiful view of magic Kingston from the 2 balconies. Master bath had a whirpool tub. Pool area was nice and contemporary resort is a minutes walk with their amenities such as pool and waterside area. Great stay and overall good Disney experience as usual.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Haven!!”
Reviews.Author: AngiePang
Reviews.Content: My Daughter & i stayed at Bay Lake Towers for 7 nights as part of my daughter's 21st Birthday Celebrations and what a celebration it was!! The villa was so wonderful to come back to every night..so comfortable and clean - our home away from home. The location was absolutely perfect! And the convenience of the monorail was, without a doubt, a huge bonus. Our one bedroom villa was so comfortable - having the two bathrooms was great, and the convenience of the laundry within the villa was fantastic! Here's hoping that we come back to see Mickey and when we do we will definitely be returning to Bay Lake Tower - It was an amazing stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “great disney resort!”
Reviews.Author: secretagentgirl
Reviews.Content: stayed with friends w/ disney timeshare (otherwise too pricey). great facility! the newest disney resort. modern furniture, nice size living room area, full kitchen and 2 baths! great kids activity area with friendly staff! my kids love going there!

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Resort”
Reviews.Author: JessD510
Reviews.Content: As DVC members this was our first trip to our "home" resort. We had a studio villa, room 7609 with a lake view. The resort is very new and has a very modern feel. We were on the 6th floor and it was a great location. We just had to go down to the 5th floor to get to the walkway tot he Contemporary and monorail. You can walk to the Magic Kingdom too! I'm a fast walker and it took between 8-10 minutes. This is great at night when the park is closing. The best feature of this hotel is the Top of the World Lounge. Only Disney Vacation Club members are allowed. But, they lower the lights and pipe in the music from the Magic Kingdom each night to view the fireworks. Simply magical. My 5 year old son loved the pool and the slide which he must have went down a hundred times. The community center is also great and they have crafts for the kids througout the day. Going to the Contemporary for food and drinks isn't really a hassle but it would be great if there was a place besides the pool bar (which closes early) that you can get a quick snack or fill your refillable mugs up at Bay Lake Tower.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!!”
Reviews.Author: birthdayboy42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bay Lake Tower last week (August 20-26 2011). My husband and I and our three college age children. We loved it. There was plenty of room in the one bedroom unit. The convenience of the Monorail was so great. The pools were terrific and we really enjoyed having all of the restaurant so close by if we wanted a quick lunch or snack. Rooms were really clean and everyone was very helpful. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: buller_6
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at our home resort since becoming DVC members and we had a great time, though it was busy during the Christmas season. Check in at the adjoining Contemporary hotel was very easy and they held our luggage for us since we arrived early from a Disney cruise. We went to Magic Kingdom park and enjoyed some rides until we received our text as to what room we were in. We were issued keys at check in and once we received our room number, we could head straight there. We had a 2 bedroom villa for our family of 6 and it was plenty of room. We walked to the Magic Kingdom and took the monorail to Epcot. We bussed it everywhere else with no problems - it just takes a bit longer by bus. Hoop de do Revue was a fabulous dinner show on the dining plan and the fireworks from the Top of the World lounge were great to watch in our pajamas. Can't wait to return next March with family. No issues with room or staff at all. Pool was great too!

Reviews.Title: “We wish you a Merry Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Nanayoung
Reviews.Content: We had an extremely fun stay. We had a big comfortable room with 2bedrooms & 3baths even a washer/dryer and a full kitchen. We were close to all the action. We can't wait to go again. We used the meal plan and had great food every day and could bring the leftovers because we had the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neouk
Reviews.Content: As Disney Vacation Club members we chose to stay at our 'home resort' this year. Having checked in online prior to arriving it was a speedy thing to get our room keys and get to our room. We had a Magic Kingdom view and were not disappointed, it was brilliant. The room itself was clean, spacious and functional with a good size kitchen, fridge freezer and cooker. At 10pm the room really came into its own when the Magic Kingdom fireworks started, the music from this being played through the TV in your room as you watched from the balcony.....magical. The pool is great with a slide for adults and children alike plus a very small one for tiny kids. The pool is well provided for in terms of vigilant lifeguards, has a good bar and the staff, as you would expect, are excellent. The restaurants and shops in the Contemporary Resort were very good.....my only criticism is the price of extra activities like jet ski's on Bay Lake and Spa treatments.....way too pricey. A good tip if you are going to a Disney resort is use the Magic hours....these extra hours ensure you can ride everything but the best one is at night.....midnight till 3am. No uncomfortable heat...no long queues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Exclusive top of the world lounge”
Reviews.Author: soldiermedic02
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect for those with young children wanted to go to Magic kingdom frequently during your stay. The close proximity allows you to return quickly for a dip in the pool, nap time, or getting dressed up for a night on the town. The monorail is also connected to this hotel by a sky bridge, just ensure you know the direction the monorail travels, its stops, and that anywhere the monorail goes the buses do not from this resort. Some have commented that walking to the contemporary was inconvenient for things but we did not have a problem but I could see if you have mobility issues the distance could be a concern. We had a dedicated two bedroom with awesome views of the pool and lake with the water parade right outside every night. I f you are a DVC Member or staying with one the top of the world lounge is the place to be to wind down after a day at the parks, the service and atmosphere really make you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent--Beautifully designed rooms, fabulous location, top-notch service.”
Reviews.Author: Sarahste
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a two-bedroom villa just after Thanksgiving, almost as an afterthought. We had already spent much of the week before at Animal Kingdom Lodge, and then in a condo at St. Pete Beach. But I found I had some extra Vacation Club points to spare, and lo and behold, there was a night free at this new resort, so we figured we'd give it a try on our last night before returning to Maryland. We've stayed at a lot of DVC properties (I've been a member for more than ten years), but this one made our collective jaws drop! Check-in at the Contemporary was fast and pleasant as usual. When we got to our room we were amazed. The other reviewer here had it right: sleek and modern. My stepdaughter actually snickered about how overindulgent we were when she saw the rooms. "Isn't this a bit much" was her comment, or something like that. We had a lovely view of the pool, and of course our kids headed down there right away. After the swim, we checked out the kid activity room, and my son made friends with another little boy as they bonded over the Wii. Then, we got cleaned up and all four of us headed to the California Grill for a magical dinner. After dinner, we spent time in the special Bay Lake Tower lounge and viewing area and watched the fireworks and the electrical boat parade. No, we didn't go to the theme park. It wasn't necessary. This hotel kept us entertained for the duration. And our room, well, again, it was something special. Really marvelous. We loved it! I am sure I'll be back again, and put my DVC points to good use at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bubb
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here in late July/early August 2011. We had a one-bedroom villa on the first floor, facing the bocce courts. The first floor location was very convenient to everything and also very quiet, which I did not expect. The room had both a pull-out couch and a pull-out chair, which was useful with two teenagers. The full kitchen allowed us to cook some meals in the room, which saved money and also got us away from the heat and the crowds at times. Being able to walk to the monorail and/or to the Magic Kingdom was great. Overall, we loved the location and the comfortable accommodations. We are vacation club members and so used points rather than cash for the stay. The point values were higher than at many of the other vacation club properties, but the extra bed, extra bathroom (there are two full baths) and location made it worthwhile in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites at WDW”
Reviews.Author: ginadean
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Bay Lake Tower. It is sleek, chic, modern and exclusive to Disney Vacation Club Members. The veiw is great and so too is the lcoation.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location”
Reviews.Author: jimd1768
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to BLT. We are Disney Vacation Club Members and this is our home resort. We stayed in a one bedroom apt. I loved this hotel. There were so many good things about the hotel, I don't quite know where to start. The best thing is the location. It is situated adjacent to the Magic Kingdom. There is a walkway leading you there from the hotel. This is even better when you walk past the busy bus lines when leaving the park to know you will be home in minutes. The room was great. 2 bathrooms, kitchen area, washer, drier, 2 tv's. We had a lake view and no complaints on the view we had. The main bed was massive too. We stayed on the 9th floor. The Contemporary was easily accessible via the walkway on the 5th floor. We also enjoyed the view from the "Top of the World" lounge. The only small complaint was that the pool area got filled very quickly. Unfortunately, people put towels down and don't return. This is frustrating for people trying to get beds. They also have entertainment from 1pm. I have to say, I didn't like this. I know it's aimed at kids and I know they like it. When at the pool I wanted to listen to my music or read. Sometimes the music was so loud, I could do neither. For me that is a minor issue and my overall view was that I loved this hotel and hope to be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Bay Lake Towers”
Reviews.Author: 2011dvc
Reviews.Content: This property is my home base for Disney's Timeshare I paid top dollar for it. I stayed Aug. 2011 in a studio. The room is very small and the condition of the room is below average. The furniture had nicks all over it. The sleep sofa had beverage stains. The carpet was dirty. The TV was small. The toaster did not work properly. There was not enough toilet paper or towels and you only get service every 4 days. The decor is very plain and dull - not a good choice for kids. You are better off staying at a resort hotel room. I miss the value resorts - Movie Resort and can't wait for Art of Anination to open. I've been coming to Disney since the 70's andn almost every year. Don't waste your money on a timeshare. They don't even come close to the resort hotel stays!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to skip the hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: dukehuh
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky on our stay here at Bay Lake Towers. We were booked for a 1 bedroom, but got a 2 bedroom instead. We were located at the end of the tower on the 4th floor. The room conditions were very nice. As we weren't too high on the healthiness of food at the parks, it was really great to be able to make breakfasts and dinners at our place at the start and end of the day. Also, we saved money by doing this since we weren't on a meal plan. We used a grocery delivery service. It wasn't cheap compared to prices at home, but was cheaper than buying meals at the park. Additionally, they delivered the groceries to the Contemporary resort and the Disney staff there stored the bags even before we checked in to Bay Lake. Checking In: we switched from a different hotel to Bay Lake in the park and got dropped off at the front door of Bay Lake. What I didn't know is that the check-in happens at the Contemporary Resort and the front doors to Bay Lake require key card access. Luckily a nice older couple let my family into the lobby to wait (with our luggage) while I checked in at the Contemporary. As I noted, our room was at the end, with a Bay Lake view. It turns out that we actually had a better view of the nightly fireworks, than the Bay Lake boat parade. Both were easily heard from our rooms at around 9:45 to 10p every night. The fireworks are awesome and they are loud - they would shake our windows at night. Our kids were luckily too tired at night to even wake up, though, so we enjoyed the show each night from our balcony. Admittedly it would have been nice to see it at the Magic Kingdom, but our kids were too tired to make the trip for the Electrical Parade/Fireworks. One big reason for us staying here was the proximity to the Magic Kingdom. There is both a walking path and a monorail to the park. Since the monorail to the Magic Kingdom is the last stop from the Contemporary resort, it is actually faster to walk. We did so each morning because it wasn't too hot even in July and I'm not big on waiting. Coming back from the MK we always took the monorail since the kids were pretty tired of walking. My older son and I took advantage of monorail service to Epcot as well, which turned out to be quite easy. For those that don't like to cook, there are restaurants available in the Contemporary resort. We tried the Comtempo Cafe, and the food was adequate. My brother tried Chef Mickey, and his kids had a blast, though probably more from the character greetings than from the food itself - note the character greeting only happens at breakfast buffet. There is also a market to buy some sundries and snacks, which came in handy. We only tried the pool at Bay Lake. It is carded entry and has towel service. The pool isn't that big, but has a pretty good slide for the kids. There is a lounge at the pool that serves mixed drinks and snacks only. Since we were not Disney Club members, one benefit is that our room was cleaned daily. We also took advantage of the fact that each room had a washer/dryer and detergent for a single load. One last tip - Disney has bed rails available for little sleepers that can fall out of the big beds.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gandrew1012
Reviews.Content: In disney this is a good hotel , but it was intended to be a timeshare

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: PZwerver
Reviews.Content: It was so nice to be on the monorail system to go between the disney parks that we love the most. The bus is available for the Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios, but we love Epcot and Magic Kingdom the most and spend the most time there. Beautiful resort hotel and the Vacation Club owners have their own private viewing area of the fireworks over the magic kingdom with sound included!

Reviews.Title: “Loved having a kitchen with a baby on the trip.”
Reviews.Author: courtney106
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting the Magic Kingdom. Just a 5 min walk on a pathway. We went for Grand daughters first birthday. Restaurant choices without going into a park or in the car were limited. Pool area was great and as always the Disney staff were great. Long waits for restaurants was not easy with a one year old. It was great having a seperate kitchen for heating baby food and cleaning bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mrsmouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week and loved Bay Lake Towers. Although there was a long queue at check in we found it moved very quickly and we were soon in our room. We had a room on the top floor and the view over the lake was very pretty. The 1 bedroom suite was very large and had everything we needed for a comfortable and relaxing stay. All the staff were very friendly. The choice of restaurants and food at the contemporary resort hotel nextdoor was excellent as was the service. We loved the location and choice of boats, monorail or busses to get around the other properties and parks. We particularly liked using the monorail to go to the other hotels and try out the restaurants at these hotels as well. The only thing we were not so keen on was the pool area as we found on the ocassions when we tried to get a sunbed there were none available as they were all taken. This however was our only minus point and it did not affect our stay at all as pool hopping is allowed so we hopped on the monorail and boat to the other hotels & preferred to use the pools at these resorts anyway. We enjoyed our stay and definately will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: labsntwins
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club Memebers and have stayed at seven different on-site Disney properties and all have been wonderful, however Bay Lake is by far one of my most favorites! We have two children age seven and to be able to walk to Magic Kingdom or take the monorail to either Magic Kingdom or to Epoct was fabulous! There is bus service to Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom, but our family normally goes between all parks and found transportation a piece of cake. It is super to be hooked to the Contemporary is super too. The quick service restraunt and Chef Mickey's is quick and easy to get to as well. We really liked the room too. The bedding was down and super comfy. The layout of the room was great. We liked how the mini kitchen was in an alley way of it's own with a nice mirrored area to curl hair, etc across from the appliances. The balcony was a nice size and our view was of the lake. We were able to see people on boats and the cool light show at night. Bay Lake offers an outdoor movie at night for families just to kick back and relax.The pool was a blast for all ages. We will definitely be booking our next stay at Bay Lake again. We also used the Disney Express from the airport, Very nice, but be sure to bring an extra set of clothes or swim suits in your carry on as it takes a while to get your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with babies and children!”
Reviews.Author: eks1222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought our Disney Vacation Club membership last June. This trip was the first time using our points. The Bay Lake Tower was the reason we made the DVC purchase...we fell in love with the resort and signed on the dotted line immediately. We stayed in a two bedroom-Magic Kingdom view villa along with my parents, who are also DVC members and my brother. The two bedroom villa and views exceeded our expectations! Very modern, clean, spacious and comfortable for 5 adults and our newborn baby boy. We were on the fifth floor, which I requested because it is the floor connected to the skywalk to the Contemporary. The theme park view of Magic Kingdom was WONDERFUL! We watched the fireworks every evening during our 7 night stay. You can also see the water pageant at the Grand Floridian. The pool and bar, Top of the World Lounge, and clubhouse were great. All the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. The convenience and location of this resort was perfect, especially with a four month old. It is going to be hard to stay in a resort off the monorail again. With strollers, it is so nice and convenient to load the baby up in the stroller and just glide on and off the monorail versus packing and unpacking a stroller each time you need to use the bus for transportation. When the monorails are overloaded, the walk to and from Magic Kingdom is five minutes, so the many options are great. You also have many shopping and restaurant selections off at the monorail resorts. On evenings that it rained, we hopped on the monorail, went to dinner and shopped and returned to our villa without the worry of the rainstorms. I highly recommend this resort to families of all ages. It has something for everyone and the convenience and location makes it even more appealing. For our 4 month old's first Disney Vacation, it couldn't have been anymore enjoyable. We love Bay Lake Tower and can't wait to plan our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “First time with DVC”
Reviews.Author: Mduale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BLT for a week in a one bed villa. We all found it fantastic, the ease of the monorail the walk to MK is just immensely convenient especially with kids! The room was more than spacious with a great size kitchen and lounge, the jacuzzi bath was great though a little noisy, while the othe bath was great for the two boys. We used garen grocer for our park essentials which was really easy and also bought the dining plan which saved us a fortune! That is another plus point with BLT as you can eat at a number of places just off the monorail, Epcot, MK, grand Floridian, Polynesian and of course Contemporary! Looking forward to going back next year it can't come sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sobodad
Reviews.Content: The location of Bay Lake towers is great. The monorail is next door in the Contempory and it's a quick trip to the Magic Kingdom. Epcots a little further, but still much faster on the monrail than the buses. We were in a one bedroom suite and it was very nice, but not as nice as expected, given that this is a brand new resort (i.e.., chipped and damaged furniture, plastic bathroom seat... the furnishings seemed cheap). The pool was OK, but not great. The pool bar/ restaurant was a big disappointment. The menu was for sandwiches only, with no cooked food. We were able to see the fireworks from our room, and that was truly amazing. All in all, the trip was great and the room comfortable and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: lhunter4
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic for exploring all of WDW. The seven minute walk to the Magic Kingdom and view of Wishes! was such a treat. Transportation to/from other parks and the golf course was a breeze. Our lake facing room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel amenities, shops and restaurants were up to the WDW standard. Even if you don't stay here, you must visit California Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: nstar612
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a 2 bedroom unit for four nights in June. I had picked this place primarily for its close location to Magic Kingdom. I had done my research prior to the booking, so I am aware of its pros and cons. The rooms are clean and well furnished. Having laundry inside the room is also a big plus. We used gardengrocer.com to arrange a delivery prior to our arrival. The front desk was able to hold our groceries until we checked in. The pool is nice, but does get crowded. The only thing that was negative about this property is the lack of amenities. We ended up making many trips to the Contemporary for restaurant, shopping, boarding the tram,... In a way, Bay Lake Tower is a remote expansion to Contemporary connected by a bridge. Personally I have never seen the rooms at Contemporary. For convenience, I may just stay at the Contemporary the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the convenience”
Reviews.Author: mr621
Reviews.Content: Lets start by saying we stayed at the Bay Lake Tower, as DVC members, having purchased DVC points. We stayed in a studio for a week with our two girls, 4 and 6. The room was a little tight, though the square footage might be comparable to a moderate room. You loose some space because of the porch, large bathroom and kitchenette. It was a little tight, but fine for us. The queen bed was comfortable. The pullout sofa was big enough, the kids slept, but it was not all that comfortable. We had a "lake view" room, though that was pushing it. rm 7832. We were in line to see parts of the lagoon, the Contemporary pool and building and we could see thunder mountain railroad from the porch. We expected to be able to see the water parade, but only saw the tail end. A little disappointing for "lake view." As DVC members, housekeeping visit once during a week to take out the trash and change towels. We would have liked more, but you can pay for that. The room was clean and as a new building is certainly modern. There are tons of activities for the kids for DVC members in their room downstairs. The fireworks from the roof were cool, but I would argue the angle from the walkway was better and easier to get back to your room (crowds from the 16th floor). We had to watch fireworks every night if we were there, as the kids would be woken up by the noise. It was loud, as were the movies they played on the lawn outside of our room until 10. The convenience to the Magic Kingdom is unbeatable. We walked most of the time, unless it rained. We are quick walkers, and brought strollers, but we were in the gates within 8 minutes. The monorail access is priceless as when it rained or when the kids fell asleep at Epcot, that really worked out.
