We only used the buses to go to Hollywood Studios once, Animal Kingdom once and Downtown Disney once. We never waited longer than a couple minutes and the kids did not fall asleep, thank goodness. We ended up locked out of the room once, when the scanner at the door needed to be reset, as well as the safe in the room. Due to a "miscommunication" they took a half hour to come up and get us in. We were in wet clothes that day, so we were not happy with the slow response. It is obviously a short walk to the contemporary for stores, meals, and front desk help, but that was fine. The gym at the contemporary was adequate. The quick service dining at the contemporary was on the weaker side, not comparing to the moderate or value resorts, as far as choices go. We used the pool at the BLT and it was nice and the kids liked the water slide. Overall, we were happy and would return, renting the dvc points again, mainly for the monorail and MK convenience. We would not pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: familyguy13
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney World a few times a year and have stayed in a number of the Disney properties. This was our first time staying at Bay Lake Tower and we were not happy with the overall experience at the property. The room was not clean at check in (salt and crumbs on a table in the bedroom, crumbs on the kitchen counter, greasy dinette table, etc.) and our room was not made up until after 5:00 PM the following day. The lock on our door stopped working and required a service call at 10:30 PM in order for us to get into the room (it wasn't an issue with the keys, but with the lock itself). There were no extra pillows for the pullouts and we had to wait for those to be delivered to the room before the kids could go to sleep on our first night. A housekeeping manager was supposed to give us a call to talk about the condition of the room, but we were never contacted. We didn't press the issue and just figured this is a large property that was understaffed. The location of Bay Lake Tower is great and we didn't spend too much time in the room so it didn't detract much from the trip. However, with so many choices both on Disney property and just outside the property there is no reason to spend a lot of money on a room and receive average service. We won't return to Bay Lake Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty place and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: augustfamily12
Reviews.Content: My family (four adults and two small children) just returned. We arrived at 11 am to check in. Check in isn't until 4 pm, so we waited. At 4:15 we asked about our room and they said it was "almost ready". I would think that between 11 and 4, they could have been a little accomodating and had a room ready early, but having to wait until after check in is unacceptable. At 4:30, we were told that our room was finally ready. We went up and the place was still dirty. One of the beds had the dirty sheets from the previous guest balled up on top of the bed, there were finger prints everywhere and the place just didn't feel clean. We called the front desk and they offered us a new room. The staff member that they sent up was very rude while we were trying to decide if it was better to stay put and have them clean, or to move. We ultimately decided to move. The next room was a little better, it at least smelled clean, but it was still pretty gross. There was hair stuck to the bathroom wall and it was very dusty to list a few complaints. The pool area is also gross. The sidewalk is filthy and slippery because it needs to be scrubbed. My son (who was not running) slipped and fell by the slide and skinned his leg. I saw at least five bandaids on the stairs to the slide and on the sidewalk one morning which had to of been from the day before. Some of the "clean" towels were stained and gross. The stairs to the slide are grimy...stained with dirt and green mold. The lifeguards were kind of rude. Not one of the budged when my son slipped and fell. Housekeeping never came at all the second day we were there, the third day they showed up at the room at 7:30 pm to "clean", but we had just returned from a full day at Epcot and were exhausted. On checkout day, housekeeping knocked on the door at 8:30 am and asked if we were ready to checkout when checkout isn't even until 11. Thanks for the early wake up call...not! When I asked the front desk about whether the room should have been tidied up daily, they said "no" because it is a timeshare resort. Another downside is that you are not allowed on the 16th floor observation deck to watch the fireworks if you are not a timeshare owner. I don't understand why they would prevent their guests from using the resort amentities. They shouldn't rent out the rooms, if it is a "timeshare resort". The only upside to this place is it is close to MK. But, it's not that close if you think about it. To get to the park via monorail, you first have to stop at the parking lot, the Polynesian and the Grand Floridian. Not that convenient... Just very disappointed at this place for the money it cost. We started our vacation stay at Marriott's Harbour Lake which was absolutely beautiful and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Tower Dirty-- and Staff Unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: macd428
Reviews.Content: Our suite was filthy. There was chewed popcorn between the sofa and end tables, someones stickers behind the drapes, old receipts behind the night stand. The area behind the beds was covered with dust. I reported the conditions immediately and was told the room would be completely cleaned. The pop corn was vacuumed, nothing else was done. I pulled back the bedding and the sheet was stained and had hair on it. I reported these conditions daily and daily I was told the rooms would be cleaned. I reported to the manager and was assured the problem would be taken care of. When we arrived home I called Disney and eventually heard back from the head of the housekeeping department. She said that no one recorded my complaints, no one recalled the issues, and there is no record of the problems. Because we booked through Walt Disney World Travel, nothing could be done. Do not purchase a trip through WDW Travel Company-- I was told they are not part of WDW. Had we booked our travel directly through the hotel there could have been remediation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here using points as part of our Disney Vacation Club membership. We have been to the Disney resort many times in the past and stayed in both moderate and deluxe accommodations on Disney property, but we have never stayed in a vacation club property before. (This was our first use of our vacation club membership.) We spent 5 nights in a lake view studio in May, 2011. Overall, we could not have been more happy! Check-in was very quick, the room was large enough for two adults, and the limited kitchen in our unit was super convenient for having breakfast each morning. We brought cereal from home and bought milk and orange juice in the market in the Contemporary hotel. What we liked most about our stay at the Bay Lake Tower: 1. It's very close (walking distance) to the Magic Kingdom. 2. Convenience of a kitchen in each unit, even if the studio kitchens are limited. 3. Proximity to all of the other resorts on the monorail line. This gives you a wife variety of restaurants available that are all just a short monorail ride away. Concerns about staying at the Bay Lake Tower: During our stay, the weather was cool, and not many people used the pool. Even though not many people were at the pool, finding two chairs together was difficult. When the weather is hotter, I think the pool will be too small for the size of the hotel. Overall, we loved our stay! We just wish we had joined the DVC earlier. We've already scheduled our second stay at the Bay Lake Tower, and we can't wait to go!

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Tower Review”
Reviews.Author: joeytdog125
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bay Lake Tower (BLT) in early June for nine nights in a one bedroom Lake View Room. We did not book directly through Disney, and rather rented DVC points from a member, an excellent way to save money....(if questions, just google renting dvc points) Anyways, on to the review.....BLT has three booking categories: Standard, Lake View, and Magic Kingdom View. In my opinion, the Lake View is the best as it is cheaper than MK view, and you still have a chance at a MK view as well, worth the risk JIMO. We had a lake view and ended up in room 7712. Had a view of the lake and of Magic Kingdom (MK). They pipe the music in for the fireworks on the TV every night which makes watching the fireworks from the balcony all the more enjoyable. And without the crowds NO less! The rooms are spacious, almost 1000 square feet with a seperate living room area and bedroom area. For those of you who have stayed at DVC b4, you will find the studios smaller, but the other options larger. You will find the rooms nicer in terms of furniture, stainless steel, granite, and 2 bathrooms instead of one. The hotel offers a wonderful pool, albeit small and not as deep, really for the mid range children. perfect for mine at 6 and 7. An awesome 150 foot pool slode doesnt hurt. A beach area, where you cannot swim but hang out in the sand and a hot tub to boot On rainy days, there is a community hall, open everyday to cool off as well, where kids can play video games, do activities, or just plain hang out! There are also movies under the stars most nights as well. Is BLT worth the price? Well if you utilize the monorail it is: How do you do that? Attend MK more (7 minute walk or monorail), eat at monorail restaurants (Grand Floridian, Poly, and COntemporary) I hope this review helps, please feel free to email me with any questions! Please check out my pictures for views, pool, hot tub, and artwork!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: kapev
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! It's the closest you can get to Disney's Magical Kingdom Resort. You can actually walk to the front gates (10 min.) Monorail goes through the Contemporary Resort which is a quick walk across a breezeway from Bay Lake Tower. You get a great view of the fireworks from the top floor with music piped into the bar/restaurant also. There is an electrical parade that floats past the resort in the evenings which is kinda nice also. The staff are friendly for the most part. We weren't particularly fond of the older guy who worked at the member's desk down stairs. He wasn't so friendly and seemed to have a bit of a chip on his shoulder, but other than that everyone else was very pleasant. The pool was fantastic - kids loved it! We stayed in a studio this time and it was very nice and comfortable for all 4 of us. It had a small 1/2 kitchen with a microwave, fridge, sink and some utensils. In the Contemporary (next door): Chef Mickey's was a very fun. It's a character breakfast. Book your reservations early as it's hard to get in. They also have a quick service area and a grocery store. When you stay at this resort you really don't need a car as everything is accessible with the monorail, buses or a quick walk. What we liked most about this resort is the fact that you had quick access to the Magical Kingdom which was one of my kids favorite resorts. They also have extended hours which sometime goes until 3:00 AM!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from Disney... and then some!”
Reviews.Author: ianrob84
Reviews.Content: This is the latest offering from the WDW Resort DVC Portfolio... Me and my partner bought into the vacation club in 2009, and had our first stay at BLT in September 2010. We were already sold by the mock-up of the hotel at the DVC Centre, but we were overwhelmed when the Magical Express pulled up outside the Contemporary and we were whisked to the first of two rooms we stayed in for those two weeks. Using our 160 vacation points to their full potential, (and seeing as there were only the two of us to make the whole thing more feasible), we had a ground floor, standard view studio for the first week and switched to a 1 bedroom lake view for the second week. Well, what a treat! The studio was fantastic, a high class hotel room with lovely furnishings and great decor. Admittedly, the furniture was slightly battered in places. But I am fully aware that Disney are addressing this, (somewhat of an oversight of dark furnishings vs. heavy suitcases!), certainly not something worthy of spoiling the stay! The 1 bedroom was out of this world. We were lucky enough to be on the 14th floor, with exceptional views across the lake, the pools and beyond! The suite was just beautiful! Extremely contemporary and classic in design, yet modern, fresh and homely. We had the bedroom and some family joined us for a couple of days and comfortably slept on the pull out sofa-bed in the living area. It certainly felt there was enough space for us all and the 2 bathrooms certainly helped with the morning, pre-park trauma of showering early to get to the parks before opening!! In terms of location, the Bay Lake Tower could not be better. Not only is it within walking distance of Magic Kingdom, (10 mins leisurely walk), but the hotel is linked to Contemporary Resort, so the monorail and bus services are so frequent! I absolutely beseech you, that if you have chance to stay at this wonderful hotel, then don't think twice about it! Book those tickets, pack your bags and get ready to make the magic brighter! We're returning to BLT later this year and can safely say, we are proud to be owners in this wonderful resort. It really has made the investment feel even more valuable and worthwhile - thank you Disney! PS, don't forget to go and see Mike at the Top of the World! (good guy!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: drrob2
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our family. We were in the one bedroom suite and was perfect sized. Could easily walk to the magic kingdom or take the monorail. Could see all the fireworks from magic kingdom easily. we took advantage of the grocery service and had our food deleveried when we got there with no issues. Pool is great but a bit small and gets crowded though easy walk over to the contemporary's bigger pool. Room decor was great and very modern.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Alicnwondrln
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a one bedroom to meet up with a few friends. The room was clean and spacious. I loved being able to walk to the Magic Kingdom and not having to ride the monorail all the way around to the park. The pool was nice but I was only in there for an hour. Every time I walked by the pool in the afternoon it was packed with families. I was able to secure a great rate saving around 30%, thank you to Travel with the Magic for that. I would love to stay here again with my family I think they would love it. I am not a DVC member so I didnt go to the top of the building to watch the fireworks so I cant help with that. The food court over at the Contemporary was pretty good, I liked several of the sandwiches. I did have dinner one night at the California Grille and it was very good. Only negative is that Disney really needs to have wifi in the rooms and it should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Disney has it ALL figured out.....An excellent experience from A to Z!!!”
Reviews.Author: vinscamaro
Reviews.Content: This was my third lifetime trip to Disney, but the 1st time I stayed at a Disney Resort. I booked the whole package through Disney (except our air) hotel, transportation from the airport, the Disney food plan etc. I am VERY glad we let Disney handle it all. It was the perfect package! In particular, I loved the meal plan. You can eat at almost any restaurant, 3 meals a day, from appetizer to desert. There are fancy sit down dinners, buffets, and quick meals. You choose as you go! What a wonderful option! This particular hotel is next to the Magic Kingdom (truly the best for our two three year old travelers). The monorail can take you to the park or you can simplify take a ten minute walk. The resort has a nice pool, a fountain area for small kids to run through, and a couple of water slides (towels are at poolside and food too). It's hard traveling with small kids, but Disney manages to simply the process...which removes some of the stress involved. Bay Lake Tower is basically a new hotel...it's part of Disney Vacation Clubs and is an annex to the very popular Contemporary resort. The only issue is that the tower is only rooms....no stores, restaurants etc. If you like quiet, this is your home away from home! If you like crowded, touristy stuff...stay at the main building...I like to personally recommend booking through Disney itself...it's worth every dime...THANKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ChesterfieldJayne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a multi stay trip, we are DVC members, and this was our first trip with them, and on Disney property. All I can say is amazing. We had a room of the 7th floor with a magic kingdom view. It was fantastic to view the fireworks at night from our balcony whilst listening to the commentary through the Disney Channel on the tv. Wonderful. We also had a meal at the Californian Grill which is in the Contemporary side, a short walk across the walkway to get there. Food fantastic. Our reservation was quite late I think 9.45pm so as we were going to get seated the waiter kindly informed us that the fireworks were going to start shortly so he would save our table until we had watched from the viewing gantry outside the restaurant at the top of the hotel. Thanks for this as this was something we probably would have missed and it was excellent. We went back in for our food which was simply beautiful. The hotels, both Contemporary and Bay Lake are amazing mainly for the location, quick trip on the monoraill or a five minute walk across. Everything was clean and service very good. There is everything you need, from top class dining right through to good quick serve food. We also ate at the Wave which was again good food with exellent stafff in both the bar and restaurant. Thanks Disney for making the 2nd part of our trip a memorable one and a location we wil definitely return to next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: gavlar007
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you are planning to spend most of you time in the Disney theme parks, however the hotel is shared with the contemporary hotel so it mention a trip in the elevator and a walk across a bridge to get to the local amenities. Lovely and clean and very modern, I would defiantly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: funk5658
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our trip. Our Harbor View room had a great view of the park and the fireworks. We walked to the park in the morning and rode the monorail back. The hotel is part of the Vacation Club (we are not members) and has a few quirks. For Club members, the linens and trash are only changed every 4 days. We had to remind them once that we were not members and would like new towels. The towels were there before we got back to the room. My daughter loved the character meals at Chef Mickey's in the main hotel. Recommend booking reservations ahead!!!!! We had room service twice. The food was OK, but the services was fast and worked well since we were tried from the park. The Refrigerator and microwave were also handy. This was our first trip to the park, but would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1br mk. This means we stayed in a room(s) with 2 full bathrooms, one huge mb with balcony, a huge living room with pull out couch and a large full service kitchen...did I mention washer and dryer? This hotel is great and quite. I slept like a baby and so did my 5 year old and husband. It's very close to MK (you can walk). The pool and slide are very nice as is the bar. This place is not a zoo like some of the other larger resorts. Two great restaurants are also in the Contemporary. The Wave and California Grille. Very, very good. Tip 1- The bay side vs the MK side is prettier and less noisy. The MK side looks over a parking lot so you can see MK and fireworks but you can also see the fireworks from the 5th floor outdoor walkway to the contemporary. Trust me. Bay view..better. Tip 2- Rent or bring a stroller even if your kids are 5 or 6. The walking is brutal. Tip3- Go one line to Gardengrocer.com for your food if you have a kitchen. They will deliver to your hotel and the staff will then deliver to you. Great service from them. We did mostly breakfast stuff, drinks and snacks and it worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient with small children”
Reviews.Author: DisneyCrazed
Reviews.Content: You can't beat walking to the monorail and the quick walkway to the Contemporary for Chef Mickey's and the like, especially with small kids. Being as close as you can get to Magic Kingdom is the best and you can see the fireworks from one side of the hotel and the lake light parade from the other. The suites are nice but I have to admit I still prefer the look and atmosphere of Boardwalk and Beach Club, for a new resort, Bay Lake doesn't have as much to offer aesthetically and pool wise as the others, but again, comnvenience/location is key. They did do a great job on the kitchenettes, they look great and are well done. The carpets were not as clean as I expected and had stains, but we had a balcony from whcih we could watch the monorail and see Cinderella's Castle. Our room was also on the same floor and the second room from the walkway access that brings you to the Contemporary. You can also walk to the Magic Kingdom however, it is a slightly lengthy and not attractive walk (walk past all the bus terminals and across the highway through the parking lot). I did find it odd that the Bay Lake hotel itself does not have much staff nor any cafeteria, shopping, etc - you need to go to the Contemporary for everything. The staff at the Contemporary (which is where you check in) is as always - outstanding! Very nice and super fun, a couple staff members were chatting with and entertaining my wee ones while I checked in and they were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Just walk to the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Texan254
Reviews.Content: OK for parents with small kids, if you can afford it you cannot beat staying within a 7 minute walk to the MK. Hotel is brand new. Pool has a splash pad . I wish they would let adults go down the slide with their kids instead of one at a time. if you debate doing Chef Mickeys, just do it, the kids really had fun. Try to get the 1 bedroom Villa, it has a kitchen and will make life easier.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel located conveniently to the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: njrangerfan
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake Towers is a great hotel in which to stay when visiting Disney World. It is located within walking distance to Magic Kingdom and is connected to Contemporary Resort with monorail service. We stayed in a studio and there was plenty of room for my family of three. The queen size bed was comfortable and there was a pull out couch. The bed on the pull out couch was equally as comfortable. The room had a balcony overlooking the pool. The kitchenette is narrow and also includes the sink area for the bathroom. This set up was odd. The bathroom was spacious, but the door did not lock. It was fine for me with my own family, but it may not be appropriate for others. The pool is beautiful but it was too cold for us to use. Also, the hotel allows guests access to the roof to watch the fireworks at Magic Kingdom. They do limit the number of guests who can go up there so get there early. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When I can afford a membership to the vacation club, this will be my home resort!”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaRose22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for our spring break as a way to get away from all the crazy drunk college-kid filled resorts and for him to experience Disney for the first time. (Disclaimer: We are both college students but were looking for something a little less ... drunk ... for our first vacation together.) My parents are Disney Vacation Club members and graciously allowed us to use their points to stay here. Having been to Disney many times in my life, I was still surprised at the customer service aspect of the trip. Transportation was provided from the airport to the hotel (and back at the end of the trip). Our luggage was taken care of, as well. Check-in time was at 4, but we were able to go to our room at 2 when we arrived. Everything was clean and the view from the balcony was great. The best part about this hotel was the private pool and 14th floor bar for vacation club members. As guest of my parents, all the vacation club perks applied to my boyfriend and me. Every night we sat in the hot tub and on our last two nights we enjoyed drinks at the Top of the World Lounge. Watching the firework show from the Magic Kingdom was amazing, the lounge had the same music playing that is played in the park. The only thing that bothered me was I could hear the family in the room next to mine and the music playing out by the pool early in the morning. However, I am an extremely light sleeper. So this might not bother people with normal sleeping abilities. It did not effect my boyfriend. Overall, I love this hotel and can't wait to come back. I've encouraged my parents to stay there next time they are in DIsney as well.

Reviews.Title: “Better of the Disney DVC property's”
Reviews.Author: DeansDesk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at each of the Orlando DVC resorts and this one is the best, by far. Location is ideal for MK, pools are good+, rooms are nicely modernized and the roof-top observatory bar is fantastic. Just has a different, more cosmopolitan feel to the place. Plenty of plugs in the room, flat-screens, modern island in kitchen, better bathrooms etc...It's also right on the water and easily accessible to monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel09
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We are DVC members and splurged on points here for Spring Break. Glad we did since it was super crowded. We were able to use extra magic hours every morning at WDW, we got up early and walked 2 minutes to the front gates and were able to take great pictures, ride all the rides and get fast passes before the humongous crowds decended upon WDW. The hotel is stylish and comfortable, we had a one bedroom and were able to have a bed for everyone, the couch pulled out to the most comfortable bed, and the chair was also a comfortable sleeper chair/bed for 1. The bedroom was very nice. We were on the 12th floor with a great lake view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rct3maniac
Reviews.Content: Although I have nothing to compare it to... The Bay Lake Tower was a wonderful hotel so close to Magic Kingdom that you can walk there... My family and I stayed in the Grand Villa suite and we loved it! We had booked the lake views room for price reasons but the view turned out better than the theme park view. We had a view of both! We were on the 15th and 16th floor and we saw both the lake and Magic Kingdom. Awesome!!! Next, we loved the pool. The BLT pool is great for the entire family. It has a hot tub for the adults, a regular pool for, well everyone! And a waterside and kids play area for the kids!! Not to mention a private beach!! Just for BLT guests! All this plus the Contemporary pool is just... More than enough!!! Those are just some of the best parts about this hotel and you should stay there to learn more!! This is sure a great place to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: njretiree
Reviews.Content: Thought the location would be SO convenient for a short visit to Epcot & the Magic Kingdom. First we went around in circles trying to find the place (give us directions already!) Then I forgot how much of a pain it was to switch trains for the Epcot trip. At least they ran frequently and were not full. the monorail to MK runs in only one direction, so it can be a long trip TO MK, but just one stop back. Should have tried to walk, but it was 90 degrees already! Surprised at how many problems we had with the rooms. With Disney marketing to parents with young children I thought they would be focused on safety, but wow! were we surprised! First of all, all 3 doors to the balconies were unlocked when we checked into our room on the 11th floor! So glad I was a paranoid grandma and checked them. And yes, the football shaped table in the bedroom was as unstable as previously noted - I pressed on the top and it started to fall over! We kept it shoved up against the wall and never let the children near it! there is also a tall floor lamp in the living room that they could have easily pulled over on top of themselves! Who designed this??????? The clock radio in one bedroom couldn't be reset, there was an annoying beeping in the kitchen that I couldn't track down - it was the dishwasher (that's a new one on me!). And of course, everything except the rooms is across in the original Contemporary building. It's also noisy from the fireworks and the electrical pagent - not nice if you are a toddler (or a tired grandparent) and 10 PM is WAY past your bedtime! But what really got me was that I asked about a late checkout (so we could give the baby a nap) when I moved our reservation to the tower and was told it was noted on the reservation, but to ask again at check-in, where I was told it was noted and sent to houskeeping, but the next morning were were told that "there is never late check out at the villas!" We really felt snookered. So we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely -- plan to stay again”
Reviews.Author: lancerodman
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in mid-March and was very, very satisfied. Havenâ€™t stayed anywhere else, so canâ€™t compare Bay Lake Tower to other places. It does have a bit of a sterile feel; it certainly lacks the majesty found in the lobby of the Grand Floridian, for example. One of the real selling points is the convenience â€“ being able to walk to the Magic Kingdom is a big, big benefit â€“ particularly if you with little ones. Also you can be at the hotel pool within about two minutes of exiting your room, which is to say, everything is in relatively close proximity. Donâ€™t be put off by a â€œstandardâ€� view. Yes, you have a parking lot below, but off in the distance is Cinderellaâ€™s Castle, and you can actually watch each nightâ€™s fireworks from your balcony. And the parking lot doesnâ€™t seem to involve much activity. The pool is great â€“ particularly the waterslide â€“ and you also have access to the pool at the Contemporary. Bay Lake tower rooms have kitchenette. So thereâ€™s a microwave and refrigerator, but not a mini-bar (a great relief). Thereâ€™s a little convenience store in the adjoining Contemporary, where the prices are a bit high but not outrageous. Bay Lake Tower doesnâ€™t have restaurants of its own, but Contemporary next door does. If you have kids, Chef Mickeyâ€™s is great. Minimal contact with staff, but universally friendly and helpful. Quiet room Room itself is a bit cramped for three (or more) people. But the couch pulls out to a bed, which is nice. And I got my best night of sleep on it in months, though this may have had something to do with being completely exhausted after a full-day at the Magic Kingdom. The room was also extremely quiet â€“ I donâ€™t recall much of any noise from the outside, except for the gardeners and their very loud blowers in the late morning. No big complaints. I spent some time in the lobby of the Bay Lake, working on my computer, and it has the worst kind of pop-Muzak playing (also in the pool area). It escapes me how anyone could think this is pleasant to listen to. Silence would be much better. Note that if youâ€™re going to places that rely on bus transportation, the buses are on no set schedule, and sometimes they may only run every 15-25 minutes (and then make other stops before getting to their destination). It seemed to take us forever to get to Downtown Disney, and even longer to get back. And it wasnâ€™t worth the trip. Itâ€™s a glorified strip mall that you can find anywhere else in the United States. And the bus ride back from Hollywood Studios was a big of a nightmare â€“ standing the whole way, and temperature at least 90 degrees inside. All in all, very happy with Bay Lake Tower and will almost certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “All right, but stay at Contemporary if you want the Disney feel”
Reviews.Author: davedmaine
Reviews.Content: We stay at Bay Lake last week and it was the least favorite of Disney's deluxe resorts -- we much preferred Beach Club or Animal Kingdom Lodge. You'll end up spending most of your time (eating, shopping, concierge, catching buses/boats, etc) at next door's Contemporary, so I'd say that you may as well stay there. Also, as I mentioned above, Bay Lake just doesn't have the Disney feel, like other resorts. The big, big, big plus, of course, is that it's an easy walk to the Magic Kingdom, but it's the same walk from the Contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “We love BLT....but you need to read this.”
Reviews.Author: Indychristine62
Reviews.Content: I am going to keep this short. ( by my standards!!! LOL ) I will start by saying that we love Disney! Period! We love it so much we became DVC owners in 2009 because we knew we would want to come back yearly, if possible, for life. We vacation in other places..we take cruises and love to explore new destinations...but still Disney is our favorite place. Last December we stayed for our 3rd time at BLT, and our first time with family. We stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa with my daughter and her family ( 5 grandchildren) and then we got my parents a studio across the hall. The rooms were great. Studios are a little small. But the views we have had each time are beautiful. Here are the issues we had: 1. My mother got locked in her bathroom when we arrived. This was just an engineering problem and it was taken care of. But be careful!!! There are no locks on the bathroom but she still got locked in..and I mean she could not get out! 2. Our room was dirty! And not just a little......food under and behind the sofa bed! Dirt so big you could see it when you looked behind the sofa. Ok....we called housekeeping to please clean it and the next day we were told if housekeeping came they would not charge us THIS TIME....like they were doing us a favor. Really? And I was told that was what the manager said to tell me. DVC does not get daily housekeeping which is why they mentioned charging me. 3. and this is the BIG one...pay attention to this please.... The tables in the rooms are football shaped with a wood top....IF YOUR ROOM HAS THIS TABLE EITHER HAVE IT REMOVED OR BE VERY CAREFUL! My 4 year old grandson was getting up from the floor and put his hand on the table to pull up and it fell over on top of him. It is HEAVY! My granddaughter tried to get it off of him but it was too heavy. After my daughter got the table off of him and checked him out the paramedics had to be called just to be safe. It was scary and terrible.....an engineer came up to look at the table and took one look at my grandsons head and said to get a manager up there ASAP. I had already called the manager at that time and she was on the way up. The engineer said they had had problems with these tables and stability before. The manager was very nice and called the paramedics for us. My grandson was OK. Even scarier was the fact that my 7 month old granddaughter had been crawling under that table minutes earlier....I don't even want to think about that. Of note is the fact that my 70 year old mother had been getting up from her table and she and the table began to topple over but my dad was there in a flash to stop it from happening. We did not hear about that until this happened with the grandson. These table are dangerous....just be careful! Please! I know you want to know if they did anything about this...like tell us they would remove the tables from the rooms....no..they did not and I do not think they plan to. I have talked to them a few times and they will not say anything about it. They just say I have to talk to someone about a claim regarding my grandsons head/injury .....we do not have/want a claim about his head. They are so concerned about a law suit ( which we never said or suggested or anything) that they will not address anything else. **Hotel amenities at Contemporary...connected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small space”
Reviews.Author: bmc-hartselle
Reviews.Content: Our family of four made the mistake of renting a studio. I thought it would be about the same size as a standard hotel room. But it was probably a little smaller. It was too cramped. It had a wonderful shower. The views of Magic Kingdom were good (but not great because we were on the right side bowing away from MK. There is NO WIRELESS internet in the room. Wired internet is available. We are DVC members. We will not stay here again. We prefer the more open spaces at Old Key West and Saratoga Springs.

Reviews.Title: “loved loved disney bay lake”
Reviews.Author: ruiz93
Reviews.Content: we always travel with our two boys and they loved the pool the water slide and the arcade. Our boys said out of all the disney property this was there favorite arcade becaus for every point, they earned a prize. the more you play the bigger your prize can become. We stayed in a studio with a lake/pool view the view was gorgeous. if you are looking to be near the magic kingdom you may want to consider this resort We will be visiting bay lake in late may and can not wait. Our boys are in there tween years and they enjoy disney as much as when they first viisted when they were only toddlers. Our best family memories are always made at disney. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families with small children.”
Reviews.Author: Ju-Ju
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to WDW with our grandchildren ages 3 1/2 and 2. I did my research and picked BLT because it's so close to the MK and especially after the nighttime fireworks it's much quicker to walk back to the hotel (5-7 min). If the grandchildren (or adults) need a nap or take a break during the day we would be very close to the hotel. The pools are very kid friendly and there are life jackets provided for the little ones. We were on the 11th floor with a lake view and enjoyed the sunrises in the morning. We also had an excellent view of the water pagent at 10:10 PM. We had a 1-bedroom villa and our party consisted of 4 adults and the 2 little ones. The couch pulls out into a bed and the chair pulls out to a single bed and a pack and play is in the laundry room. We loved having a washer and dryer especially with the grandchildren dripping ice cream on their clothes. The kitchen area was nice and had everything we needed. A service of 8 is provided. I didn't understand the use of the small orange triangular plates though. To me they were useless. You could maybe put a piece of toast on it. Everything else would fall off of it. I knew ahead of time about the lack of locks on the bathrooms. We had to keep the grandkids under special watch when someone would go in there. There was also a special type of lock on the patio door which I couldn't figure out but my son-in-law took care of that. It is a good idea though. We would definately come back again. I also liked the check-in process. I did an online check-in a couple days ahead of time. I got in a special line to get all my paperwork and key cards. We arrived in the morning so we knew our room would not be ready so we went to the pool and when our room was ready you can get a text message or voicemail from the hotel on your cell phoneand then the message tells you what your room number is and then you just go up to your room and don't have to go back to the registration desk and get your key cards programed.

Reviews.Title: “Besides the lost finger nail...”
Reviews.Author: Leo26
Reviews.Content: So the Contemporary Hotel has sliding doors in the room. I guess in an effort to seem more modern. The problem is that the doors hang from a track and are really heavy. My four year old son smashed his finger in the door. Now being 4 years old these things can happen, but now 10 days later he is loosing his finger nail. I admit that he hurt himself, but the design of the room did us no favors. Also for a "modern" hotel the fact that there is no WIFI in the rooms is endlessly frustrating. There is an ethernet connection in the Master Bedroom (at $10 a day!), but no connection anywhere else in the suite. We had a two bedroom plus living room suite and the Grandparents stayed in the Master Bedroom. My wife and I in the other room had to go to the lobby to check work emails each night. The deck would have been a much more relaxing place for this had there been WIFI available. When I mentioned the internet to the desk clerk the look on his face said it all. He must here this complaint numerous times a day. The hotel and whole Disney World experience was good. The monorail was convenient. The "Magic" Shuttle to/from the airport was nice, but with having to wait over 1/2 hour to board a bus it was hardly hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Created great memories at Bay Lake”
Reviews.Author: JYDAWGS
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 girls (ages 5 1/2 and 2 1/2) just returned from a 5 night stay at Bay Lake. We were on the 10th Floor with a Magic Kingdom View. Pretty neat having my girls fall asleep and being able to see Cinderella's Castle. Don't know if I would get Magic Kingdom again though because there are several areas in and around the hotel to see the fireworks etc... A Lake view would suffice. Either way it was an incredible experience. We were in a studio and yes it was small, but very manageable. Check-in is at the Contemporary and not a big deal, and yes, very easy to walk to Magic Kingdom - About 7 minutes. Every night they had a movie on the lawn and the pool was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location for young children going to the Magic Kingdom.”
Reviews.Author: nonfiction_diction
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in a 2 BR MK view. It is over 1000 square feet with 3 bathrooms and a spacious full kitchen. Gardengrocer.com delivered everything before we checked in and - was reasonably priced. There are 3 widescreen tvs and one dvd player. The pool is fine as an all shallow with one slide but it cools down a lot when the sun gets blocked out by the building. That happened in the early afternoon. You can use the Contemporary Pool which is a bit dated but has more afternoon sun. The location is the reason to stay here. A 7 minute walk to the monorail or the Magic Kingdom gates makes it easy to go out early, come back for a swim and go back out after dinner. Making breakfast and bringing drinks and/or lunch to the parks saves money and time. With the Magic Kingdom view you can see fireworks nightly from your room. As well if you are leaving late, rather than waiting in the bus or monorail lines you can walk back with no delay. Overall we loved the flexibility of staying at Bay Lake and would stay here anytime at Walt Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many dvc hotels and this one is our favorite so far. The special "top of the world" for members only is a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Disney-themed complex which needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: TomKuhne
Reviews.Content: This "modern" contemporary style appartment complex, barely Disney-themed, is situated next to a calm lake in the extreme North of the Disney property. It is a 10 minute walk to Magic Kingdom, but one of the farthest situated from the other parks and areas. The friendly and helpfull front desk is at the adjacent Contemporary Hotel, which is a 5 minute walk. Also the nearest restaurants, shops, monorail and bus stops are here. Our room was upgraded to a disabled accessible studio. This had it's pros and cons! My preference for a higher floor was not assigned. Instead we received a half lake, half park view. A park view has sight on a parking lot and in the distance the park. The disabled accessible studio is spacious and has in contrast with the studio the kitchenette separated from the bathroom sink. The brown grained kitchenette has a microwave, toaster and a small fridge. The spacious beige and green tinted bathroom with handrails has a shower, a seperate bath and a sink with space to stow away toiletry. The shower heads pressure is to strong for usage. The bathroom's stone floor is extremely slippery. The colourfull combined living and bed room has a very comfortable queen size bed, a medium sleeper sofa with foot bench and a table for two. On the tastefull design cabinet a flat screen, DVD-player and an Ipod dockstation, only for a Nano, are placed. The combined stowing place and closet is to low to hang up cloths. And there is no full size mirror in the studio. The cleaning is average but done on-time. Usualy the bathroom amenities where not replaced or presented nicely with label front. Ones the bathroom's floor was not mopped and some towels where not folded. This appartment complex is good, but less compared to hotels in the same price category. There is no "magic feeling" as there is hardly no obvious Disney theming. The cleaning could be more accurately, and some important room features have to be improved. This complex is not recommendable for people looking for the "magic feeling" nor for people expecting a top notch accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be SOOOOO much better but you can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler89675
Reviews.Content: #1 if you are going to the Magic Kingdom this is the BEST location you can find. It was GREAT. #2 It SHOULD be a great resort. We have stayed at 4 other disney vacation club resorts and there were great. Everyone in our party was VERY impressed. #3 The rooms are set up to comfortably fit a group by putting a full 3rd bathroom in a 2 bedroom condo and I believe a 2nd bathroom in the 1 bedroom units. Now the bad. The service is HORRIBLE. We felt like the ugly step children of the contemporary. Unlike the other DVC resorts you don't have your own front desk, etc We got off the magic express and walked over to the bay lake towers with our luggage only to find out we had to walk back to the contemporary. How did we find this our because a security guard finally told us in a very rude "you idiot tone" when we finally got him to speak to us. They were rude at the contemporary when we checked in. I got a fed ex package from work when I was there and they wouldn't bring it to my room but told me I would have to walk over to the contemporary......it just went on and on. The only internet was in the masterbedroom. Of course NOT the room I was staying in. AND it didn't work! The repairman had to come 3 times to get it to work and every day it wouldn't work unless I called the service and got them to reset it. WHAT a PAIN! Anyway, I would recommend this place but Disney needs to make some improvements in staff.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a condo at Disney - you found it.”
Reviews.Author: troisquatrecinq
Reviews.Content: If you travel with young children, Bay Lake Tower is wonderful. The place is at a short walking distance from Magic Kingdom - kids would hop in the stroller in the bedroom, and did not have to get off until their first ride of the day. The one-bedroom condo we booked had a nice clean kitchen (including everything you need - even a dishwasher). There was also a washer and dryer in the room, with detergent. With toddlers, you spend a lot of time in your room, so you might as well rent something comfortable and roomy, where you can rest and where they can play. You will love to be able to have dinner in your condo, instead of going to a restaurant with crying kids who do not want to stay still. You just need to walk to the Contemporary (very close), and get yourself some food to go! Or the Market at the Comtemporary can sell you some groceries (bread, bagels, jam, milk, peanut butter, frozen pizzas, beer, wine, etc etc etc), that you can conveniently eat and drink at the condo. Would we go back there? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family fun!”
Reviews.Author: CherylfromBrampton
Reviews.Content: Went with my sister, brother in law, their 2 year old, my husband and our 3 children. Beautiful hotel. Recently built and what a wonderful view from the hotel. Loved that fact the train would go right through the hotel, just what you need after a day of running around the park and the kids are ready for bed. Recommend to get the food package otherwise it is VERY expensive. At the end of our trip we were trying to use up all of our food credits. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Towers, Fantastic Location, Nice accomidations”
Reviews.Author: DnAnCl
Reviews.Content: As DVC members we have a home resort of Animal Kingdom and Bay towers, and have stayed at both a few times. AK is a better hotel as far as ammenities, HOWEVER the location requires a bus ride to go anywhere, there is no problem in getting a bus BUT it adds as much as an hour to get to some locations. For example getting from AK to another resort hotel for a dinner reservation (Hoop-De-Doo at Fort Wilderness Resort). BLT through the contemporary has connection to the Mono Rail and buses. Not that the buses are any quicker but one can visit all the locations on the Mono Rail which takes only few minutes. Room for room (1 BR) we no no issues with either, although we do like the more contemporary settings of BT. When traveling with grandchildren we prefer BLT However when without we prefer the AK as commute time not as critical.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations - Perfect for Families with Small Children!”
Reviews.Author: crickette24
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long stay in a two-bedroom villa at Bay Lake Tower at the Contemporary Resort. Our party included four adults (husband, wife, and two grandmothers) and two children (ages 2 years old and 3 months old). Generally, the hotel room was amazing, and exceeded our expectations! The layout was perfect because a living area separated the two separate bedrooms, which afforded everyone a little privacy. Was also great to have three full bathrooms, which we used. Washer/dryer was awesome for those baby blowouts (hotel provided Tide detergent). The room had two balconies and wall-to-wall/floor to ceiling windows in the living room, for breathtaking views and lots of natural light. We also loved the large jacuzzi bath in the master bedroom, which was great for Mom and Dad to enjoy after a long day of walking. We were in room 8002. Our room had a gorgeous view of the Lake with a family of hawks which provided a lot of entertainment for our little ones to watch. The week we visited WDW there were record cold/freezing temps, so it was nice to have such a lovely room to come back to, since we spent more time there than we had hoped. Unfortunately we couldn't use the hotel pool because it was so cold. However, we could see the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom right from the room, which saved us from venturing out in cold temps. Room was clean, convenient, and super close to everything, e.g., a 7-min walk to the Magic Kingdom. Now for the pros and cons: Pros: - Luxurious suite. - Large sized rooms, - Plenty of room for large parties. - Comfortable beds. - Even the pull outs in the living room were VERY comfortable (which was surprising). - Great view. - Nice kitchen facilities - all new and modern. - Layout of suite was nice and afforded privacy for everyone, e.g., separate bathrooms, etc. - Hotel was new and clean and fresh looking. - Lots of places to watch fireworks and water parades from in the hotel, e.g., elevator lobbies, walkways, etc. - Pool area looked nice, even though we didn't use it. - 7-min walk to Magic Kingdom! - Easy access to busses and monorail. - Kitchen facilities to save money on meals (we ordered from Garden Grocer, and our food delivery was waiting for us at the hotel when we checked in. Super convenient!). Cons: - Walls were very thin. E.g., You could hear toilets flushing in other suites above and below, and the flushes were even louder in your own room. We found ourselves leaving #1s in the toilet at night because the flush was so loud it would wake the kids up! - Doors on bathrooms are sliders and do not close all the way or lock (a little weird). - The hotel does not have any restaurants or food on-side, so you have to walk over to the Contemporary to find anything. This is a bit inconvenient, especially when it's freezing out and you have to walk through the uncovered walkway just to get fresh coffee or a snack. It can be a long trek to the Contemporary depending on where your room is located, like ours...far from elevators and walkway. We found ourselves using room service often, to avoid having to make the trek to the contemporary. - Another small con for us was the shower in the Master Bath - it was a nice shower with a double shower option of either a rain shower or normal shower. However, the door didn't close all the way so water kept leaking out all over the floor, which made things dangerously slippery. - Monorail lines were long and trains kept having mechanical problems. We were told it was because of the low temperatures, so things were malfunctioning. So, we found it easier to just walk to the Magic Kingdom. We hadn't been to WDW in 20-some years, so a lot of things had changed and were new to us. For example, we are used to being able to get restaurant preferences at the hotel you stay at. Not the case here. We were guests at the Contemporary, but had a difficult time getting reservations at the hotels there, even the more basic restaurants like Chef Mickey's. We did eat at the California Grill, and the food was quite good (and fantastic wine list). But the prices are incredibly high and perhaps not quite worth it. E.g., $20 for a basic sushi roll. Not somewhere for kids. All in all, we were very pleased with Bay Lake Tower and would most definitely stay there again. It was worth the premium price for us because we had two little ones and preferred a nicer room since we spent more time there for naps, etc. Also because the weather was so cold, it was nice to have more luxurious accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “The Location Cannot Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: MFLetou
Reviews.Content: The location is literally the best in all of Walt Disney World. You simply cannot stay in a Disney resort with better views and with this kind of access to the Magic Kingdom (by foot.) Bay Lake Tower could be better. For such a new property, the furniture was rather scuffed and worn looking. The sound insulation is so-so. I wouldn't call it especially luxurious--I think cheap materials were used whereever possibly. The price is out of whack with the level of luxury and service. But, if you are traveling with a family, it is still THE best to stay. We were a bit crammed with four adults and 2 children in a one-bedroom. We knew that going on, and I don't fault BLT for it. It is worth paying for a Magic Kingdom View--we had two separate rooms during our rather lengthly stay and the MK view room was nicer, slightly bigger, and the view was magical. Our kids were so excited to be watching the monorail right in front of them that they could have never moved and be happy. The bed was comfortable--on the softer side which I like with high end threads and fabrics. The pool area is well designed and kept up, and less crowded than many other WDW resorts. BLT as you likely know is connected by walkway to the Contemporary, where there is dining, shopping and the monorail connection. The Contempo Cafe--essentially a fast casual restaurant--was more than respectable for food quality and offerings. And you can watch the monorails come and go--which, like I said, kids love. Chef Mickey's is the big character place, we've done it twice for breakfast and its a chaotic mess. The food, however, is better than you might expect for such a large buffet. The Wave is sort of an afterthought--overpriced, and dark. For breakfast, it can't hold a candle to Kona at Polynesian or the Grand Flordian Cafe (which actually is even better than Kona.) Fortunately, you are a quick monoral or drive away from those two. I rented a minivan which is essential for getting around the World easily--except for MK. The parking situation is excellent--you can park right out front and be at your car in seconds. I received a heavily discounted rate on my one bedroom which was tough to get but worth searcihng for. I would return to BLT--I wish Disney had done a better job at some things, but overally my experience was positive. Disney is a magical place, and so is BLT. One can certainly nitpick, but...at the end of the day, your kids will be happy, and as a result, so will you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Nan5049
Reviews.Content: Very nice New Year's stay at Bay Lake Tower. Our garden-view room was a large corner unit on the ground floor facing both the lake and the beach - surprisingly quiet despite crowds in the parks. It was an easy walk to Magic Kingdom. The Quick-service meal plan with 2 full meals and 2 snacks per day was more than enough food, and we only wanted a regular dinner one night. The Epcot meal choices were much more imaginative than those at the Contemporary and Magic Kingdom, but no one went hungry. We have been to Disney many times in and out of the park, and this was particularly enjoyable. The fireworks were fun to watch.

Reviews.Title: “magical”
Reviews.Author: karajayne9999
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in a studio, which was perfect for my husband and I and our five yr old daughter. You absolutely cannot beat the location..... Fantastic.... The resort is fabulous, clean, new and could not fault it. Eating is very limited , the pool has a bar close by and limited food is available. But the Contemporay Reosrt is so close, you can purchase most things there. We had a lake view studio and at night would watch the fireworks from the elevator area. The studios do not have laundry facilities but on the ground floor there is a complimentary laundry with TV and all !! The pool is great, the kids love it.... So good we have already booked for November again !! WE LOVED IT !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thompson2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in November and this was the hotel with best location. I would suggest to stay on Disney property due to the transportation between all the resorts and park. Overall this was a truly magical trip for my husband and I.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Stylish and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: beachgirls77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Lake Tower in a 1-bedroom accomodation. We are DVC members and recently bought points for this resort. We were eager to stay here since it was new, we own here now, and it was within walking distance to the Magic Kingdom. We were very impressed, but to be honest, when haven't we been impressed with a DVC resort?? The check-in process is streamlined with the online check-in now, and you check in at the Contemporary and then walk over to Bay Lake. We had a lagoon view. Our room was gorgeous. Not exactly my style in decor, but very stylish and hip. The floor to ceiling windows are beautiful. At night, at 10:10 p.m., there is a lighted pageant across Bay Lake, complete with music. The walk to Magic Kingdom is short, maybe a 5 minute walk. There is easy access to the Contemporary for the monorail, if you wish, through a skywalk. We watched the fireworks one night from the skywalk. The pool area is beautiful and and overlooks Bay Lake! Everything was perfect. The only thing I didn't like, but it wasn't terrible, and this is common with a few resorts, is that you need to walk over to the Contemporary for any food, drinks and mug refills. This isn't terrible, like I said, but can be annoying if you forgot to buy extra milk for baby bottles and realize at night you need milk. It would be nice if there was a little convenience area in Bay Lake Tower, with some snacks, drinks and toiletries. Overall, we were very pleased and will definitley stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location -disappointing studio”
Reviews.Author: droraback
Reviews.Content: With so many positive reviews, we thought we would love Bay Lake Towers. Â Instead, we were really disappointed. Â The DVC studio is incredibly small and poorly laid out. Â Unbelievably, the bathroom door does not completely close. Â It is a slider door and when the door is slid shut there is still a 1/2 gap between the door and the wall. Â Besides the obvious lack of privacy, steam from showering seeps into room adding to the already high humidity in the cramped quarters. Â Equally objectionable is the fact that the bathroom sink is located in the same alcove as the kitchen sink. Â Basically, you brush your hair and/or shave then turn around to toast a bagel or make coffee. Â It is not appetizing or very sanitary. Â  On a positive note, the location is extremely convenient with monorail access close by. Â Bay Lake Towers is, in essence, an extension of the Contemporary. Â The pool area is very nice and many rooms have spectacular views. Â  On our 5 night stay, we found the Resort Monorail a bit crowded with delays. Â The express monorail was fine. Â With so many rooms at Bay Lake Towers, additional capacity on the monorail may be required. Â  In conclusion, don't expect much space in the studio. Â If you are looking for space and privacy Old Key West is a far better option. Â But if you plan on hitting the parks all the time and you are a big Magic Kingdom fan then go ahead and check out Bay Lake Towers. Â However, you might want to use extra points and get a one bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families, lots of space....”
Reviews.Author: Inverloch
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 5 night stay at Bay Lake Tower. I was a bit worried about the size of the one bedroom suite as we were 3 adults and 2 small children, but we all fit in very comfortably. The best feature were the 2 full size bathrooms - one of them quite large. We also liked the fully equipped kitchen and spacious living/dining area. The children loved watching the magic kingdom fireworks from the balcony and enjoyed swimming in the pool. Location was handy and having the monorail was a plus. The only thing that we didn't like was the quality and variety of food in the restaurants and room service. Like the rest of Disney Resort and its theme parks, the food was very ordinary , tasteless and unimaginative. We tried different options - room service, fast food , buffets, "fine dining". After a couple of days I decided to cook our own meals as we all quickly tired of pizza, nuggets, burgers, etc... We were so happy then that we had that great kitchen in our suite at Bay Lake!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie53
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay during this Thanksgiving break. There were six adult family members and one teenage family member. We had a 2 Bedroom suite so we used the foldout couch for myself and spouse. We slept very comfortably on the foldout sofa--never waking till the morning. There were 3 full bathrooms. A completely furnished kitchen and groceries for breakfast which I had pre-ordered and were delivered ontime by Garden Grocer made everything perfect. The stackable washer and dryer finished all the conveniences any large group could possibly need. Never underestimate monorail proximity--it was great to not have to wait at all hardly for the arrival of the next monorail We had a lake view and it was beautiful to see in the morning when we woke up. Expensive without the free dining now being offered but we were celebrating and it was worth every penny to make it the trip of a lifetime because it was all of that and more....

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love Bay Lake Tower”
Reviews.Author: cyhenry
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club members and we spent 8 nights at Bay Lake Tower in a studio. The studio is perfect for us as my wife and I can share the queen size bed and my 10 year old daughter can sleep on the pull out sofa. The room is snug, but how much time do you really spend there. We had a lake view facing the Contemporary Hotel pool and marina. It was wonderful in the morning when the sun was coming up and every night the water parade was in view at 10:00pm. We decided not to get a Magic Kingdom view room because it's just not worth the extra points to us since the view during the day is basically the parking lot. The room was very clean and house keeping came in 3 times, which was more than we had expected. We were on the 6th floor which was very convenient to the bridge which goes over to the Contemporary. And it's also a very quick walk to the Magic Kingdom, so we really only used the monorail for trips to EPCOT and the Polynesian resort. The Top of the World lounge is great, but is restricted to Disney Vacation Club members staying at Bay Lake Tower. There is a "pack and play" available in the room as well if you have an infant, but I can't imagine setting it up and having the couch pulled out too. If you have more than 3 people, go for a larger room. The swimming pool is really great with a fun water slide. There is also a snack bar and a soda station for refillable mugs. If you've been to Disney, then you know all about those. There is also a community center on the first floor with lots of activities for kids including ceramics, video games and coloring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Hotel! Can't beat the location!!”
Reviews.Author: graycat274
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 nights in a studio on the 12th floor with a bay lake view. It was spectacular! Unbelievably quiet - we thought we were the only ones on that floor it was so quiet. The maid did a good job cleaning; the desk chairs needed some attention. The biggest flaw to us was the queen sized concrete bed - no Sealy pillow topped mattress. The bathroom and kitchenette were clean and useful; the towels were soft and fluffy, not scratchy. Setting room temp was easy and the balcony door kept out almost all the noise from the passing boats 'tooting' in the morning. Never waited more than 2-3 minutes for an elevator and the laundry facilities were free. The pool was great, just bring your card so you can get in. The people in the lobby of the BLT were only there to book timeshare tours. The location was excellent; the walk to the MK wasn't bad but you had to cross a major road so hold on to the kids' hands. Food in the Contempo Cafe was very good for quick service and if you can, eat at the California Grill around 9:30pm. Best food we've had and they send out to the balcony to watch the fireworks before they cook your food. Cost of the hotel was high so get the free dining plan if you have pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, going back!”
Reviews.Author: mtdk316
Reviews.Content: This was our second time stay at Bay Lake Towers and we love it there. The location can't be beat and with two children under four, having the laundry in the room was a plus! Also, having access to a microwave, dishwasher and full size frige/freezer was great for the kids and us. We are not DVC members, but love this DVC resort. We celebrated our anniversary while we were there and ate at Victoria & Albert's Chef's Table, our third time there. Loved that also, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lots of space”
Reviews.Author: Brew_8
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location to see Disney from for a family. Stayed in a two bedroom unit which provided wonderful space for the entire family. Ten or fifteen minute walk to the Magic Kingdom can't be beat. Monorail to Epcot and bus service to the other parks. Pool facilities are nice and are open to midnight so it's nice to come back after a day at the parks and use the pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view!”
Reviews.Author: WDW_girl85
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week stay at Bay Lake Tower and could not have asked for more. I booked through Traveonadream.com who made all my arrangements and went above and beyond my expectations. The hotel is kept spotless and the rooms are stunning. There's amazing artwork on all the walls that reference the Magic Kingdom and different Disney characters. We loved the waterslide at the pool, the food wasn't very good at the walk up bar there but if you go over to the Contemporary they have a much better selection. The roof-top bar is the BEST. We loved chatting with Mike, he was very friendly and knowledgeable about the happenings around the parks (have to mention he makes some killer cosmos!) Loved the hotel and would highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, if you have small children”
Reviews.Author: Nickol_98
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio for me, my husband and our 18 mo old. We couldn't be happier with our choice of the Bay Lake Tower. We booked a lake view room and asked for a room on the left side of the building (if you are looking at the building with MK at your back). We had a great surprise of seeing MK and a fantastic view of the MK fireworks from our balcony. The best thing about the hotel is the location. Just a quick (5-10 min) walk to MK, which was a blessing upon closing time to not have to wait in an insane line for the bus, monorail or boat. We also used the bus station at MK to transfer between different resorts, very easily. The monorail is very convenient at the contemporary as well as the boat service between the contemp, WL. The only cons I have is the rooms are a bit small, it was fine for a family of three but I wouldn't put anymore in these room. Also although the pool is wonderful, I don't know why they would make it so small. It does seem like there is wasted space and they could have made the pool area much bigger but what is there is very nice, love the zero gravity entrance. Also it would be really nice to have a restaurant at this hotel, besides the pool bar. With all that being said we loved it so much here we decided to be owners, so we became members of the DVC. According to them they are fixing the crack in the door to the bathroom and putting a lock on it and ripping out all of the sinks and flipping them around to be in the bathroom.That showed us that they really listen to complaints and even though this resort is barely a year old they are putting a lot of money in it to make their customers happy-where else do you see this these days beyond Disney! If you are thinking of staying here and can afford it, then do it; I think that you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: dotters
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 BR with a view of the Castle. The place is so modern and sleek. Stainless steel appliances, a breakfast nook for the kids (fairly low to the ground) and bar chairs on the kitchen island. they even had cool orange triangular plates! We had 3 bathrooms (one light wasn't working on one side in our bathroom). Nice tall shower. We had a view of the Castle and Space Mt. (over the parking lot). Saw the fireworks, which were really nice. There is a walkway to the main building on the 5th floor. We were in room 7822. Definitely would have booked for more days there if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to do Disneyworld with a child”
Reviews.Author: Jackiemersey
Reviews.Content: We recently had our first trip to Disneyworld and decided to stay at the Bay Lake Tower. I am so happy we made that decision! It really is a 10 minute walk to the Magic Kingdom. We had a studio with a Magic Kingdom view and we were delighted with the view, the cleanliness and decoration of the room. The pool & water slide are perfect and there is a great little pool bar. The convenience of being able to walk along a little bridge to the Contemporary Hotel with all the amenities that has (aswell as the Monorail)was invaluable. We spent very little time travelling or waiting for transportation. I would highly reccommend Bay Lake Tower. The only thing we were a little disappointed with was the choice of stations on the TV (no HBO) but other than that it's really fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A Hop and a Skip to All the Action”
Reviews.Author: poosner67
Reviews.Content: I didn't write "jump" because we were literally that close to the Magic Kingdom. We were literally a FIVE minute walk away!!! It was great when we wanted to head back to our room for a midday nap. It was also super convenient because of the monorail access right in the Contemporary Hotel. When we decided to beat the crowds out of the Magic Kingdom during the fireworks display, we didn't miss a thing... as we saw them from the monorail, and then the outdoor balcony from the hotel. They even had the music piped in! Their gift shops are great, and had a few things we didn't see in the parks. And the quick service restaurant was great when we just wanted a lite bite. The room itself was lovely and suited our needs perfectly. This is definitely top tier Disney accommodation, and you will pay for that, but it's worth it. (Going in low season helps with that.) All in all, it enhanced our magical experience greatly... making our trip perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Worst shower ever!”
Reviews.Author: Allisonfaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BLT in Oct 2010. We booked a suite, which was a nice layout for families with children. I agree with the previous poster that the pullout beds were simply made and not pushed back in each day, which was somewhat annoying. Our housekeeper was awful. The first day, I had purchased a magazine and left it on the bathroom floor and it was gone after the room was cleaned. When I complained, I was credited the cost of the magazine which was great, but the housekeeper didn't even touch the newspapers that my husband had left in there or straighten them up. Also, I noticed hair on the shower walls was never cleaned. I also saw leftover cereal on the counter one day. Towels were only replaced once daily and my husband left a wet towel on the back of a chair one day and it was still there after the room was cleaned. The room was quiet, which is rare for hotels. So that was a huge plus. Didn't hear kids running or doors banging or loud, drunk people late at night. The worst part about this room was the shower. It was one of those rainfall overhead types. This water flow was so low that taking a shower was a painful experience. (And not to mention, who ever invented the overhead rainflow shower clearly didn't know anything about the anatomy of women). My hair is thick and washing the shampoo out of it took forever and a day. I never even wanted to get in the shower because it took so long. Oh and there is no WiFi here and internet reception is slim to none.

Reviews.Title: “Looved this hotel! Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Megpres
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so beautiful, and the absolute best location in Disney, especially with little kids! Monorail runs right through the contemporary, and we could walk to the Magic Kingdom entrance in about 10 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved the Bay Lake Tower”
Reviews.Author: xlisax207
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at a Disney property and one of our best!!!! Certainly it's location stands out as #1. We arrived at the hotel AT 2:30 finding our room available, 10th floor bay view with easy access to the Contemporary via elevator to the 5th floor walkway. Our one bedroom slept 5 people with ease. There were two full baths with a jacuzzi in the masterbedroom, balcony, flat screen in both living room and bedroom, everything you would expect in a vacation club property. Since we are not vacation club members we were unable to access the 16th floor viewing area for the firework display.....not to worry, the view from the 5th floor walkway provided an unobstructed view of Cinderella's castle. This viewing area also afforded you the opportunity to watch to "Electric Light" parade on the Bay, however, this parade was BORING. Recommendation - do not waste your money on a Castle view, depending on your room, you will will view the track to the monorail and/or parking lot until the Castle lights up! I have two complaints regarding this property, 1- I do not believe housekeeping is efficient keeping track of "vacation club rooms" as opposed to "guests". Vacation club members have different guidelines as to the upkeep of the room and restocking of supplies. I was never able to get a firm answer from Concigiere whether the pullout couch and chairbed were supposed to be closed after the room was cleaned each day(as would be on a cruise). Instead the beds were made and left open, which I found to be somewhat inconvienant and made the room like unkempt. Secondly, this may seem like an silly complaint, except this is a Disney property. As you leave the Contemporary heading towards the walkway of the Bay Lake Tower there is a large gated unused landing that runs under the monorail. This part of the hotel had garbage, chairs, wet towels on the floor and dirty cigarette containers about. At no point during our 8 day stay was this area cleaned. Also, being a smoke free enviroment, guests would sit in the stairwell between both buildings smoking - a little unexpected for a Disney property. The delux dinning plan is a must!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: nickmel
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Bay Lake Towers from Aug 22nd until September 1st 2010. We recently became DVC in 2009 and after our first trip it was money well spent. The hotel was everything you could ask for. I traveled with my wife, my son (6), and daughter (2). I have been traveling to disney every year for the last 25 years. This place was perfect for young children. Whether they were in the pool, riding speed boats, eating at character restaurants, or walking to the monorail things could not have worked out better. The room was exactly as advertised. It was clean, roomy, and beautiful. We stayed on the 14th floor and had a very nice view of the pool and bay lake. My parents and sister are also DVC at other resorts and i can say they are also outstanding places to stay but my famiy will be staying at Bay Lake Towers for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Magic 24 7”
Reviews.Author: Mac24boston
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake Tower was pure magic. We stayed in a magic kingdom view and it kept us entertained every time we entered the room. It is hard to imagine staying at another resort. If you've ever waited for a bus at the mk you'd really appreciate the value of being able to walk back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: NjLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 9, with 6 adults, two 9 yr olds and one 5 yr old. We had a 2 bdrm suite and did not feel cramped at all. With 3 bathrooms, each individual family had their own bathroom. The rooms were very clean as was the entire hotel. the views magnificent and the ability to walk into the Magic Kingdom couldn't be beat.
