Actually, walking int MK was faster than taking the monorail because you had to make numerous stops before getting to the MK. Coming home we took the monorail because the Contemporary was the first stop. We had a bay lake view but were able to watch the fireworks from the elevator bank on our floor. The walkway was being refurbished during our stay , I'm sure that would be another great spot to watch the fireworks. We all love Disney and would stay at BLT again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Bay Lake Tower Community Center and more”
Reviews.Author: JYARCH
Reviews.Content: Our Family was at Bay Lake for 4 days Between August 22-26 and were extremely happy with the accommodation and activities the resort provided. The weather was not cooperative and 2 days out of four were very raining-- We are very happy to have the community center with very very talented and helpful staffs Jacqie and Luis, we made bunches bead necklace and ceramic set of 6 dimi-tas. We truly appreciated the warmness & professionalism of the staffs here that truly cared about customer service. We also wanted to thank the downtown customer relation staff for their assistance at almost midnight Aug 22 ; we could not have a such great vacation without all these dedicated individual making our Disney trip most enjoyable. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Bay Lake Tower”
Reviews.Author: momofmanykdis
Reviews.Content: We had a dedicated two bedroom on the inner portion of the crest. We looked down to the pool and bay lake. The windows were completely sound proof, so we only heard the happy sounds from the pool area if we wanted to. We stocked up on juice and soft drinks in our room from the Publix a few miles away. We ate at the California grill which was yummy. It was our first stay on points and we were very satisfied. We felt at home. The rooftop observation of the fireworks was really fun.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: momoftwinsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney every year for our children's birthday in August and this was one of the worst hotels we ever stayed in. When we got there to check in our room was on the 2nd floor we figured great nice and low until we got off the elevatore and there was mold all over the windows. We went downstairs and asked to have our room changed. They did and put us on the 15th floor. The room was very small it was so dirty I refused to let my children touch anything. There is a few issues with the room itself. First of all we have never stayed in a hotel that did not have locks on the bathroom door or where the bathroom door had a sliding door. If someone had to come into the room to fix something and was carrying a bag and hit the door by accident it would open up. The second problem was the kitchenet/bathroom vanity. It is all in one area so to the left is your little kitchen area and to the right is the bathroom vanity so if I am blow drying my hair and someone is making a bowl of cereal my hair could fly into the cereal. That is so unsanitary!!! Then there was the issue of bug. I killed 4 bug in my room. My husband went downstairs to tell the manager and the hotel did nothing about it. Every year our children get something sent to the b/c it is their birthday. My husband told the hotel when booking it the date of their birthday, added it into the computer and at check in told them. Our children had nothing sent to them on the day of their birthday. So when my husband went downstairs to talk to the manager about the bug situation and all the other things going on he asked why our children didn't even receive a card and they told him it wasn't put into the computer so the next day they sent up a balloon and card . It was like they put it together to shut us up. There was no ice machines or vending machines in the hotel so if you wanted a drink in the middle of the night you would have to walk over to the contemporary. Being a DVC member we are supposed to feel at home but I surely did not feel at home at this hotel. They also wanted to charge us for extra toilet paper. I have never heard of such a thing. The only good experience we had was that the Magic Kingdom was within walking distance and the convience of the monorail. Other than that there was nothing good we got out of this hotel. We would not reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cooliodude101
Reviews.Content: Disney Vacation is great!! Me, my husband and our 4 kids get to travel all over the world for a good price all thanks to Disney Vacation Club. We have been a member for 5 years now and we are all loving every minute! It has also gotten our family closer!! The hotel was great to! The staff were SUPER nice!! I highly want people to join disney Vacation Club!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: ryclements
Reviews.Content: We were there for a weekend from Friday to Sunday. We had 6 adults and a one-year old. It was the best location ever. I will not stay anywhere else. My only complaint is our room was not ready when we got there at 1. So we went to the pool and road the monorail and ate and finally at 5:00, I complained because our baby needed a nap so they gave us a room. It was actually a one-bedroom connected to a studio instead of a 2 bedroom, but it worked for us. The room was nice...Absolutely no complaints there. It was great! We always walked to the MK because it only took us 10-15 minute which was a lot faster than riding the monorail. And we road the monorail back which took 10 min. It couldn't have been a better weekend. We ate at Chef Mickeys this morning. It was well worth the money. So much fun!! Getting to see all of the characters my daughter knew at once! Awesome! Keep trying on reservations there, I finally got them the morning of for a group of 6. The pool was a lot of fun for our one-year old too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Island_Tom046
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bay Lake Tower for the last two days of our trip. We are DVC Members and have read reviews on it here and elsewhere. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was after reading about scratched furniture and smears on the stainless steel. We did notice that a bit but we are not uptight so a quick wipedown with a paper towel made everything pristine. We did notice the scratches on the luggage bench, but that was quickly covered by luggage! Our room was on the third floor at the far end of the hotel, and overlooked the trees and lake. There are probably no rooms that can't view the lake and being close to the stairs made it convenient to get to the pool. I personally did not like the card activated gates for the pool since this was just a standard pool with a slide. A little too much security, it was not like people would wander in if they were not staying here. We loved being able to jump on the monorail or just walk up to the Magic Kingdom. There was a Barbeque/Picnic area that we would have utilized if we were there for a long stay. All in all it was a pleasant stay and the hotel exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: AGAMDFW
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Bay Lake Tower to any family with small children. Our room included a dining table, washer/dryer and full kitchen. We also were able to look out our living room window every night and watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks show. The service was excellent at this hotel and travel to all of the parks convenient. Bus service was a bit slow for travel to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios but that would not prevent me from staying there again and again. The kids loved the pool area too, with a big slide great for my 5 year old and a baby slide great for my 2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accommodations and location”
Reviews.Author: sunandfunseakers
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (3 kids ages 11, 6 and 3) stayed in a two bedroom villa in late July 2010. We had a 2nd floor, odd numbered unit at the end of the hall near the stairs by the pool. We loved the fact we could walk out our villa door and down one flight of stairs to get outside to the pool. We could also use our key card to enter the stairwell to get back up to our villa. Our reserved view was "bay lake". From our two balconies, we could see the lake in the distance beyond the pool. The pool was in our direct view. Also we were right by the shuffleboard courts. The palm trees provided some privacy for the 2nd floor so we didn't feel like we were "open" to the courtyard below. There was always good music playing outside our balconies to be heard in the courtyard and pool area that played until about 11pm. We could also access the community room quickly via the stairway to the outside and across the courtyard to the outside door access to the community room. My two oldest kids enjoyed the activities in the community room like foosball, tie die t-shirt making, internet access for games and wii. The villa and building at BLT is new and very elegant with a contemporary feel. The colors are cool and inviting. There are three full bathrooms in the two bedroom villa - a wonderful thing when everyone wants to bathe/shower at the same time. The master bathroom has a large whirlpool tub separate from the shower/toilet area so it was very handy. One interesting thing is the wall between the master bathroom and master bedroom consists of three sliding doors so you can open up the tub area to the master bedroom and view out the balcony. Check in was a breeze at the Contemporary Hotel - we arrived around 5pm and received our keys and were in our room after a short walk to the BLT building across an open walkway. The walkway was awesome - covered to keep the sun off but open to get a great breeze. At night you can watch the fireworks at MK and hear the soundtrack that goes along with it. There are also movies that played nightly on the lawn below the walkway. My kids loved looking over the rail to see what movie was on. We used Disney transportation exclusively upon arrival at the Orlando airport. The Magical Express was efficient and our luggage did arrive within 2 hours of our arrival at the hotel. We used the bus system to get from BLT to DHS & AK. The bus stop is between BLT and the Contemporary so it was a short walk to the bus stop. We never waited over 15 minutes for a bus - even when leaving the parks to return to BLT. We used the monorail for access to Epcot and MK. It was easy to access too - using the walkway from BLT to the Contemporary 4th floor - to the escalator/elevator up the monorail platform. The monorail only goes one way from the Contemporary so you have 3 stops before you get to MK. When going to Epcot you go one stop and exit the monorail to transfer to the Epcot monorail. It's a short walk around the station but very well signed and the wait was really short each time. We purchased the Disney Dining Plan with our package (BLT and park tickets) but we will never do it again with young children. Even for ourselves - it was too much food at one sitting - for adults you get a dessert with every meal! And most meals were very filling before you even got to dessert. The 20% savings basically meant a free dessert that we didn't want anyway. Sometimes we got dessert just because we were entitled (already paid for it) but ended up throwing it away without even tasting it. We had a nice meal at the California Grill and didn't use the dining plan because it takes 2 of your table service meal "coupons" and we didn't think that was a good value. The best character meal we had was at MK Crystal Palace. The characters were Pooh and friends and the food was very tasty and variety for everyone. Chef Mickey's character breakfast was good too. It was a good way to use the Dining Plan for breakfast and priceless for the characters and how delighted the kids were to meet them at our table as they made their way around the dining room. We noticed the wait times at all the parks for most rides were about half what they predicted on the signage for each ride. I think this is due the the use of fast passes and them not knowing how many of them will return at a certain time. We happily stood in lines marked 40 minutes only to find out our actual wait was about 20 minutes. We did use fast passes at MK, DHS, and Epcot and found them to be very helpful but at AK we thought they were not helpful - I think it's due to the small park size and smaller attendance than at the other parks. The walk from BLT to the MK took me 10 minutes by myself - and it was a brisk walk. It would probably take an average family with young children about 20 minutes (pushing stroller) at a "stroll" pace. It took about 30 minutes to get from our villa to MK via monorail so it does save some time but it's a hot, sunny walk and our kids enjoyed riding the air conditioned monorail. The Luau at the Polynesian wasn't very good - pretty cheesy. Our kids did enjoy Mickey's Backyard Barbecue at Fort Wilderness campgrounds though. The characters interacted with all the kids on the dance floor for about an hour (at least). My son danced with Mickey, Minnie and Goofy. He loved it! We did not like the fact the Magical Express picks you up 3 hours before your flight time. We also used the resort airline check in for our return flight home. It was great! Although after the BLT/Contemporary ME bus stop you also stop at the Polynesian, Grand Floridian and Wilderness Lodge on your way to the airport you have plenty of time. We fudged our flight time with the ME booking center and left only 2 hours before our flight and made it to the airport (about a 20 minute ride once you pick up everyone at all the other resorts) in plenty of time. The lines were long for security at the airport but it moved faster than we thought it would. Overall it was a great, six night trip basically because the BLT two bedroom villa was SO nice and we had such a great location in the towers. One other thing was to use the elevators on the north side of the building and not the elevators that you come to first when you cross over the walkway from the Contemporary. Everyone uses those south elevators and they seemed crowded but since we were on the north side (facing south) we passed right by all the people waiting for those "first" elevators. Also, because we faced south, the morning sun did not blaze into our villa - it was a perfect location. We didn't care that we couldn't see the MK from our villa - we went to the 15th floor elevator lobby on the north elevator side and watched the fireworks from MK. We couldn't hear the soundtrack but the sights were great and the booms could even be felt if you were touching the glass. We have stayed at Grand Floridian, Polynesian, Wilderness Lodge and the Nick hotel and we will definately stay at BLT from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Lake View”
Reviews.Author: dweedledee
Reviews.Content: We visited in June 2010, in a 2 BR "Lake View" room. I checked in at 10am on a Sunday and our room was ready. We were spending 11 nights at Bay Lake in a "Lake View" and spent just over $15,000 for the whole package, including the deluxe dining plan for 6 guests. For that cost, I expected a "Lake View" to actually have a view of the lake. However, we were assigned to room 7605. Our room overlooked the building opposite ours and the pool. Less than 25% of our window view was of the lake. I was very disappointed and called the front desk. After being told by the person answering that indeed room 7605 was a "Lake View", I asked to receive a discount on the cost as this was not a fair "lake view". A manager got on the line and agreed to transfer us to another room after 4pm. We were transfered to 7602 and it was better, but still not a wonderful lake view. There were swampy looking trees that blocked a significant part of our lake view. On the positive, we could view the fireworks from our balcony. Disney REALLY NEEDS to reclassify the views. There's no way the rooms on the inside of the "C" shape of the building should be considered "Lake Views". For the amount of money we paid for a "lake view", I cannot believe Disney would think it acceptable to have our balcony facing the balconies opposite ours. It was very disappointing but they did make it semi-right. The room was clean, had nice amenities and was convenient to everything. I would recommend it but I would worry about the risk of paying for a so-called "Lake View" again. I think I'd go for a "standard view".

Reviews.Title: “location makes up for short comings”
Reviews.Author: scchasey
Reviews.Content: I have been Vacation club member for 4 years now and have stayed at Vero Beach, Old Key West, Beach Club and Animal Kingdom resort. Bay Lakes as a resort has some short comings that hopefully Disney will correct. The location for this trip was excellent, you can't get any closer to MK without staying in the Castle. It was awesome walking to and from the MK. That defineitly made up for the rest of the resort. I love staying at Disney resorts for the service, the clean rooms and atmosphere, but didn't leave here feeling that we recieved any of that great service. The room is lacking in cleanliness for a brand new hotel. Sofa had rips and stains and black furniture was covered in layer of dust. The room also seemed over crowded with the furniture. The closet is useless for storing luggage due to large safe and stand. Had to stack bags by door and with bed folded out it was hard to move around room. There was also a lack of towel bars we had wet towels hanging from door knobs. The shower head was painful or just barely a trickle. The kitchen/sink area was cramped but bath area was huge. Why they didnt hang more bars is beyond me. The lobby was usually deserted and automatic doors were always open, not very secure and let in bugs. Elevator was extremely slow and smells from contemporay trash area overpower the walkway to contemporary. Big complaints about observation deck on top of resort. Dont take your kids as they will not be able to see fireworks over wall. I had to hold them up and they would not let stand close to wall while holding them. So we were having to look over someones shoulder to try and get a view. It could have been a good view but distraction of having to hold up a 9 year old was not worth it we only went up there the one night. Seems to me they could put some type of stand for the kids to see over the wall or placed open railing like that on the contemporary observation deck. Resort and room not up to typical Disney Standards but location made up for the short comings, Hopefully Disney will work out the kinks in the coming year and we look forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carolvk
Reviews.Content: Staying on property at Disney is a must if you have older kids. They can come and go and rest as they please. Having to drive on and off the property is a pain. There is no better place to stay than Bay Lake Tower. Having a kitchen and a seperate bedroom made for more comfort and convenience. We traveled with our two teenage sons and our 75 year old mother. We reserved a 1 bedroom bay lake view. The view was wonderful. We could see the lighted parade each evening from our deck, as well as all the activities in the contemporary pool and bay lake. The MK fireworks were easily viewed from the bridgeway to the contemporary, or anywhere on the grounds. Getting around to all the disney parks was easy. We took the monorail to epcot and MK and we never waited longer than 5 minutes for a bus at the comtemporary. Yes, there were no locks on the bathroom door which bothered my mother in law. Also, there is a very slippery covering between the bedroom and bathroom. This will cause a problem for disney. Be careful. The room was not a bargain, but well worth the savings we made each day by having breakfast and lunch in our room. You do have to check in at the comtemporary, but it was no different than checking in at any hotel that has more than one tower. Any service you needed was readily available. We were missing a remote when we first arrived. I made one call and someone was there within 5 minutes to replace it. We had a great experience at Bay Lake Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A Conciergless Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: gardenya
Reviews.Content: We were all excited to stay in this new resort , however when we arrived exausted after a long journey from Bahrain to the Bay Lake Tower main door , we found it locked !! with basicaly NO STAFF ! there was no proper reception or concierge at the Bay Lake Tower Lobby ! and NO BELL CAPTAIN by the door ! we were lucky that the taxi who drove us from the airport was still waiting , so we had to carry our luggage and upload it again to the taxi , and we had to go for the Contemporary Lobby for checking in , We learned only then that the Bay Lake Tower is run by the Contemporary staff !! the checking in process at the Contemporary was quick and the staff were nice and welcoming , We stayed in a 2 bed room appartment with a nice lake view in the 7th floor , I did not regret at all not reserving a magic kingdom view room coz it is not worth it , my sister was in one , and she was facing the car park ! you could always go to the sky walk to watch the fire work ! the decoration of the rooms and the furniture was average , there was nothing in the rooms to make you feel that you are in a disney resort except a single picture on the wall in the sitting area , the kitchen was well equiped and the dish washer , washing machine and the dryer were very good and very helpful , however the supply of soap and detergents was defficient if we do not ask for it ! the main room bed was too soft for my back and no feather pillows were availiable ! the shower water pressure was weak , and the automatic toilet ventilation fan that works by a sensor every time I had to use the toilet at night was irritating and noisy . I enjoyed using the jacozzi 2 times during my stay , the sofa bed in the sitting area was good as a bed for the people that have back problems but not comfortable at all to sit in if u fold it up to a sofa . The linens were changed only every 4 days !!!! You can not get any concierge help by usuing the phone , every time I call them they tell me that I have to come all the way to the Contemporary front desk by person to get my requists answered , and to my surprize there was no one at the Contemporary front desk that could help u in managing your airline reservation , you have to do it yourself ! I rented a car and got my groceries which were too heavy for me to carry to my room including fresh cold milk and frozen items that needs immediate freezing , there was no bill man by the door to help me and no trollys were also availiable for self service , I had to go to the Contemporary main door to ask the bell man there to send a trolly for me , but he said everybody was busy and asked me to drop the groceries there and he will send it later on to my room ! what about the frozen items !! After I checked out , on my way out of the Bay lake tower lobby , I passed by the only staff availiable there that morning and told her that I will leave with her an envelope that I wanted her to send it to my sister's room , she said : ask your sister to come down and pick it up if she needs it today !!! other wise it will reach her by tomorrow !!!!!!!!!!! What a magical experience !!! ...... oh I forgot to mention the hundreds of Black Huge Mosquitos that welcomes you every evening when you return to your room all around the door next to the Contemporary and chases you into the elevators !!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Kingdom view for best fireworks around”
Reviews.Author: atlantadad
Reviews.Content: enjoyed a night here after 10 nights at Disney's Beach Club. Great way to wrap up our vacation with Magic Kingdom fireworks view. Pool not as awesome as Beach Club's Stormalong Bay, but maybe 2nd or 3rd (Animal Kingdom 2nd) best on site. Top floor lounge very nice overlooking Magic Kingdom. Great place to stay at the center of the action to MK. 2 (which we stayed in) or 3 room Magic Kingdom view has to be best rooms available anywhere on Disney property. Plush!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: DSECAJ
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Disney World for 30 years and have been members of DVC since 1993 and I cannot express properly how disappointed we all were in Bay Lake Tower! It completely lacks any charm, I felt as if I were walking down hospital corridors rather than than the halls of a Disney resort! And the service was HORRIBLE-the right hand has no clue what the left hand is doing. I felt that the staff was lazy and couldn't be bothered helping our large party, and housekeeping was nowhere to be found when we needed something. The only redeeming quality is its location, you really can't beat it, especially if you have young children. If you need a larger space to accommodate a large family, I would highly recommend Wilderness Lodge or Animal Kingdom. I will NEVER stay at this resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing-Not up to Disney standards.”
Reviews.Author: pongorama
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my review by saying that we are loyal DVC members who visit at least twice per year, and own points in two resorts. That being said, I regret that one of those resorts is BLT. Having stayed at many deluxe and vacation villas over the years, we could hardly wait to stay at the newest property. First, the positives. the room was beautiful, spacious, and had a magnificent view. We were on the eleventh floor with a lake view. Loved the picture window in the main living area, and the additional bathroom was a plus with three children. The building itself is impressive, and you can't beat being walking distance to MK. The room was also very private, and the building very quiet. Now, for the negatives. First, the other reviewers are correct in that it is extremely inconvenient to have NO desk staff at BLT. Every question, issue, or even a snack or magazine requires a schlepp over to the Contemporary. The security doors were either propped open, or inoperative for most of our stay. The door to the left of the North Tower elevators was stuck open, and the lobby was filled with thousands of black bugs. The distance from the Contemporary doesn't seem like a big deal until you are traveling it several times a day. I was also disappointed that the security that they touted as being prevalent was completely eliminated with the broken doors. Next, the room. I know I am a neat freak, so I try to give a little slack when staying in a hotel, but this room was DIRTY. Note to Disney:Do not have black furniture if you never dust it. The carpet was badly worn, sofa had a huge tear in the cushion, and we were missing many kitchen tools, a dustpan, vacuum had a broken belt, and kitchen floor was dirty and sticky. Housekeeping was not answering their phones, so took us two days to get a replacement vacuum, and we resorted to helping ourselves to the housekeeping cart for towels, toilet paper and tissues. The lack of locks was also an issue-just weird. There was also an obvious lack of staff, as room service trays would be sitting on the floors outside of rooms for days before being picked up. Everything was just too dirty and worn for a new hotel, where the rooms are $500.00 plus a night. The view was also a little strange. No one has a dedicated MK or Lake view,based on the shape of the hotel. We had more of a view of the A-Frame, and had to crane our necks to see the lake, from our tiny balcony. All in all, not up to Disney standards. We then spent 5 days at Jambo House, with a Savannah view, and couldn't have had a better experience. Spotless room, friendly staff, and available dining/shopping options, all in a much older resort. We offered our children a choice of resorts for next year, and they all chose AK, and a return to Beach Club Villas. Sad that we now own points in a resort no one wants to stay in again. Finally, the pool is tiny, dirty, and worn. Also, the pool hopping rule is a joke, as the locked door was propped open the entire time we were there. Never had to use our key to get in, and as a result, was unbelievably crowded. Pool seems too small for the resort. We spent our time at the main pool and quiet pool at the Contemporary. Hope this review is helpful, and Disney listens to it's loyal customers. Seems they are trying to run two resorts with one staff, which will not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations close to Monorail and Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: Laval_Family
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to travellers with young children. The accommodations are terrific, with very nice room sizes and the room is very clean. The furniture is starting to show a little bit of wear, nothing drastic, but surprising given the hotel is still fairly new. Dining options are very reasonable at the Contemporary which is a short walk across a skywalk. A quick tip is to avoid the central elevator as it's very busy. The elevators at the north and south end are far better bets. A lot of people say that the Magic Kingdom view is not worth it. Sure, you see the parking lot, but the view of the fireworks is terrific! For a family with children that don't stay up late, it's a very good option for parents stuck in their room! I enjoyed having that view. Be sure to ask for a high floor. View from 7th floor and up is very good! A special shout out to the staff at the Community Hall, the activities were a very nice touch, and kept my girls cool during mid-day where it was too hot to stay outside. Thanks! Everyone enjoyed the pool, which was crowded but still usable. The waterslide is a nice size and very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior1020
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at Bay Lakes Towers. It's a nice hotel and it's so convenient to get to the parks. The pool area is also very nice for those times when you just want to chill. You also get a fantastic view of the Magic Kingdoms fireworks display from the contemporary/some of the rooms at Bay Lakes. They did have a lot of organized events too although our daughter was a little to young to partcipate. When booking be persistent, the quoted rates fluctuate wildley from minute to minute so, my recommendation is to keep a price in mind, keep checking back often and pounce on it when you see a rate you're happy with....you just might get lucky, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: missmacary
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week trip to disney with my family of 8 people. The first 3 days we stayed at the Animal Kingdom Kidani Village(which was amazing!) and the last 4 days we were at Bay Lake Tower. Bay Lake was very disappointing and did not come close to how awesome Kidani was. At both resorts we stayed in a Grand Villa. 1. The staff at Bay Lake was not as friendly as other resort staff. Everyone was uptight and we did not feel as welcomed here. 2. The maid services were not good at all. Our room was missing many of the kitchen utensils such as bowls, a cookie sheet, and kitchen towels. When we called down to get these items, the man who brought it up was unfriendly and acted as though we had inconvenienced him. Our room was not as clean as the other resorts we have stayed in. There were MANY stains on our couch and the TV stands were dusty (it looked like they had not been whipped down in a week or so) 3. Poorly designed rooms. THERE WERE NO LOCKS on any of the doors including bed rooms or bathrooms. In fact, the bathroom door was a sliding door. Not so good for a big family. The rooms were a lot smaller then the rooms at Kidani. 4. Not as secure as they advertise. When we first got there they told us we would have to use our room key to get in and out of the building and the pool area but throughout the 4 days I was there, I only had to use my room key once to get into the building. All the other times the doors were propped open or unlocked. The door on the 5th floor leading to the contemporary was open 24/7. 5. If you want to do anything you have to walk to the Contemporary. There are no shops or real restaurants to eat at in Bay Lake Tower. For example: If you want to get a gift from a park sent to your hotel you have to get it sent to the Contemporary. Another example: The Airport check in is at the Contemporary. Another Example: No fitness center at Bay Lake.. you have to go to the contemporary. Another example: to get to any park you have to walk to the bus stop or the monorail AT the contemporary. If you want to get to the magic kingdom the best thing to do is to walk there (it was about 5 minutes). If you take the monorail you have to go all the way to the Ticket and Transportation office, then to the polynesian and the Grand Floridian and then finally Magic kingdom. The only thing that makes this place worth staying in is the view! Yes it is very close to the magic kingdom which is nice but it is extremely far away from Animal Kingdom, Hollywood Studios, and Downtown Disney (Expect at least a 25 minute bus ride). To get to Epcot you have to hop monorails which takes a few minutes. The last night we were there, we watched the Magic Kingdom fireworks show from the Top of the World Lounge (Which only allows 75 people in and everyone who goes there must be staying at Bay Lake) The view of the show was awesome! They played the music through speakers. It was Magical (and nightastic)!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money staying at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel60097
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever reviewed a hotel on any website. I do look at reviews often to plan our vacations, and values other's experiences, so I hope I can help someone not make the same mistake we did. This hotel is just too new, and they do not have their act together. Basically, they added a whole other hotel to the Contemporary, but they still only have one front desk, which is at the Contemporary, and their departments have no communication between them. It is like a big apartment building, with no Customer Service. The rooms were nice, and unusually quiet, especially for Disney, but that just wasn't enough to overcome the absolutely horrible customer service, or lack there of. We actually left the hotel is was so awful.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at the Bay Lake Towers! Would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: mushumulan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom villa with a Magic Kingdom view. The castmember was very helpful with our requests at check-in. Our room was ready ahead of the time they gave us. Our view was spectacular. We were on the 9th floor. (7916) In general, I am not a big fan of contemporary decor, but I loved the decor in these rooms. In the second bedroom in our unit there were two spectacular pictures above the beds. The beds were very very comfortable - even the pullouts in the living room area. We watched the Magic Kingdom Fireworks from our room and turned the TVs all to the channel that carries the music for the fireworks in sync as it is heard in the park. This was spectacular. We walked to the Magic Kingdom only once but it was a very nice walk and was very doable. The unit was spectacularly clean and we loved all of the space. (There were 6 in our party.) The convenience, the view of the fireworks, and the beauty of this resort were well worth the money we paid. We enjoyed the remoteness of this resort along with the convenience it offered to the restaurants at the Contemporary and the convenience to the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay There Again!”
Reviews.Author: BLR-YVR
Reviews.Content: Since I was a kid, I wanted to stay at the Contemporary Resort, and after many....many years, I can say it was worth the wait. The Contemporary has allot of appeal with its architecture, decor, the monorail in the lobby, the view and so on, but an unexpected highlight for me was the location. With monorail right there in the lobby, access to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot is easy and convenient and with the bus stop just outside the main lobby entrance, catching the bus to other Disney Parks and attractions was a breeze. Also with the bus, you're at the beginning of the run to the other parks so we always got a seat, and coming back we were the first ones dropped off. Crowds on the bus and monorail weren't bad at all, far less than I was led to believe they would be. Transportation by boat is also available at this resort. This ease of transportation made staying at the Contemporary well worth the money! Regarding the room, I have no complaints. The room was tastefully furnished in a kind of a "retro-contemporary" look (make sense?!) and not the Disney theme that we experienced at the Disneyland Hotel in California. The room was comfortable and clean (I found the bed very comfy) and the cast members always made sure we had clean towels and linen and things were in order. The room was quite with the only thing breaking the silence was the occasional over excited child in the hallway trying to get their parents to move a little faster to get to the park (what else would you expect at a Disney hotel) or the nightly fireworks at the Magic Kingdom. These are sounds you would associate with a stay at Disney and so they only add to the "Magic"! The only complaint we did have is that there is no counterpace in the bathroom to put things on. Also it is a long walk from some of the rooms to the main lobby, so if walking is an issue with you, keep this in mind. As for the restaurants, we ate at the The Contempo CafÃ© and The Waves Restaurant. The Contempo CafÃ© is a self serve restaurant and was handy when you wanted to grab a quick breakfast before you head off to the parks. The food is ok, actually some of the baked goods were tasty, but it is a bit pricey as with most things at Disney but it is kinda cool to watch the monorail pass by when you're eating at the Contempo! The other restaurant, The Waves, the food and service was very good with the only complaint I had was the food is more adult oriented so sometimes our 12 year old ordered off the child's menu. Unfortunately with the child's menu, the portions were a bit to small for him. Other things at the Resort include a couple nice gift shops, an arcade, a pool with a slide and lots of activities to keep the kiddies entertained. You can also watch the fireworks from the resort and they pipe in the music for it, so it's a great way to watch the show, and avoid the crowds. Check-in and check-out was easy and there were no issues. Staying at the Contemporary also allowed us to use the airline check-in service so we checked our bags and got our boarding pass right there at the resort. Not all airlines use this service so check with the resort to see if yours does. That's it. I hope you have a MAGIC time at Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: singlemom53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Contemporary Resort in 1998 and 2004 so our expectations were high for the new Bay Lake Tower. Our party of 2 stayed in the not so deluxe Lake View Studio accomodation and felt like we were living in a box for a week. I can't imagine a party of 3 or 4 in this type of room. Who wants their bathroom sink, counter and mirror in the same small space as their kitchen sink and refrigerator? Most families at this resort had small children and the parents didn't seem to care that they were screaming in the hallways and elevators, and running through the concourses. Don't be fooled by the Lake view, we could not see the lake at all from our balcony, all we could see was another wing of the building. Accomodation wise, the old A-frame building had much better accomodations. The resort itself is true Disney with breathtaking views from the observations deck and great views of the fireworks and water parade. Great pool, shopping, laundry, and dining (both quick service and table setting) . Don't count on the monorail as main transportation, it was down two days we wanted to use it and the bus service (including Magical Express) is deplorable sharing the bus route with the Polynesian and Grand Floridian. We used the boat service to Fort Wildersess for the great buffet at Trail's End. I do believe the Contemporary boat dock is the only Disney dock with out permanent fixture shade umbrella's which makes the 20 minute wait in the hot sun almost dangerous. Reasonable walking distance to the Magic Kingdom. Have spent 275 days at Disney Resorts and Bay Lake is not one I would likey choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: fletchdawgg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our preschoolers' first visit to Disney World. We booked this particular property based on advice from friends who recommended we stay as close to the Magic Kingdom as possible with young children. In researching I found that there was nothing closer to the Magic Kingdom than the new Bay Lake Tower. The 2-bedroom suite that we stayed in was larger than I anticipated. The kitchen+living area was quite roomy (I was expecting something more akin to an extended stay hotel). The view was also much better than I expected. We booked a Magic Kingdom View room, and while I had a lowered expectation of being able to see the castle out of the corner of the window, our room was located on the 10th floor in the center of the building with a direct unobstructed view of cinderella's castle and the Magic Kingdom! It was even more magical at night as we had a front row seat to the nightly fireworks which we could watch from the comfort of our living room. The proximity to the Magic Kingdom is excellent. During busy times (i.e., after the parade or fireworks at night) it is a short stroll back to the hotel. It also doesn't take long to walk over to the Contemporary to catch the monorail or the bus access to the other parks. We did find it quicker just to drive to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. The added benefit to the 1 Bedroom or 2 Bedroom suites is the full kitchen and washer/dryer. It made for a much easier Disney vacation. We were able to play longer and have a much better experience had we stayed in other accommodations. We visited the pool once, but did not have much time as a storm blew in. In the back corner is a splash pad with sprinklers where our 1 yr old and 3 yr old both had fun. Be sure to bring your DVD's! The room came equipped with a DVD player as well as inputs if you want to hookup your laptop. The only technological downer was the internet. There was no wi-fi available, though hi-speed is available via ethernet. It is an additional $10/day for access. Also, AT&T wireless service was only worth using near the bay window or on the balcony. Also, check-in was great. We arrived early for check-in (check-in is at 3pm, we arrived at 12pm). The staff took our bags and stored them for us while we went on up to the Contempo Cafe for lunch. By the time we finished lunch the front desk sent a text that our room was ready. Since they had already given us our keys we just strolled up to our room and our bags met us up there. In conclusion, this was a better choice that I could have imagined. I made the reservation without knowing anyone who had stayed there and was glad that I did. We are already planning our return trip and plan on returning to this same property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, all-around awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AshSpartanburg_SC
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 11th floor of Bay Lake Towers in a 2-bedroom suite. Three adults and 1 child were in our party. The view was spectacular! We could see both Magic Kingdom and a good portion of Bay Lake. No need to stand in a crowd at the park to watch the fireworks. We simply watched from one of our two balconies. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the numerous pillows provided. The kitchen was nice, with stainless steel appliances. The bathrooms are spacious, although they do not have locks on the doors. The only complaint at all, is that the water pressure is too powerful through the shower heads and was actually painful- like pin pricks! The room was very clean when we arrived and was always cleaned nicely by the time we arrived back from the parks each day. The pool area was really great too. My 6-year old had a blast playing in the interactive water area and swimming in the large pool. I like how it is zero entry- where you just walk in to shallow water and it gets deeper as you go. No stairs needed! The water slide was fun too! They even have a baby water slide for very small children. The elevators were convenient and very fast. I do wish they had luggage carts available on the Bay Lake side, as we did not care to use bellhop service as we were checking out. The walk to Contemporary to catch the monorail is easily accessed from the 5th floor. The Contempo Cafe at the Contempory was convenient and really good too, as was our character breakfast at Chef Mickey's. I have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside in the past, and can't imagine ever staying anywhere else now. Bay Lake Towers will definitely be my first choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more out of this premium hotel - there are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrmillergd
Reviews.Content: I came away unimpressed with Bay Lake Tower. On the plus side: Obviously the proximity to Magic Kingdom is unbeatable. The rooms were also spacious and loaded with the latest in terms of hotel decor (e.g. large flat-panel LCD TVs). The pool area was well done and features a very nice water slide. I also found the beds to be pretty comfortable. However: What I felt was lacking was the service at this very expensive "premium" hotel. After an early morning visit to one of the parks we left early and were hoping to check in, get changed, and hop in the pool. We went to check in at about 1:30 and were told that in fact check-in was not in fact until 4pm so the room was not ready. I am reasonable and was not bothered by this fact. The clerk kindly offered to notify us via text when the room was ready. My expectation at this point was that although we might need to wait an hour, maybe even two, that we would be able to check in soon. Somewhat complicating issues for me was of course the fact that we were travelling with a coterie of 5 small (5 and under) children. So off to the pool from there - we hung out in the heat for over two and a half hours, with me checking my phone every 15 minutes to no avail. 4pm comes and goes and I go to inquire about the status of the room. As mentioned in other reviews the BLT is not staffed for check in, so I use one of the concierge's phones to call the main desk. The receptionist then tries to give me a song and dance about how (1) they are at 100% capacity, (2) that our room was the last in the group to be cleaned, and (3) rooms aren't actually guaranteed until 5pm. Frankly for the price paid and for a premium hotel (which I use often as I travel frequently for business) these excuses don't matter. We had been waiting for over 2.5 hours to check in with no indication from the hotel that it could possibly take that long. I was disappointed and spoke to a manager (who offered a room upgrade - which would seem hard to do if they were at 100% capacity). The upgrade was from the pool side to the Magic Kingdom side and not substantial nor worth our inconvenience in my opinion. Further adding to my annoyance at check in was the fact that there were elevators out of service in each of the two banks of elevators (I think 3 of 8 total were out of service). I had to spend a total of 15 minutes waiting to get on elevators since we had to share them with all the service people and others going in and out at time of day. This should not happen in a premium hotel and I found it unacceptable. Our room was spacious as mentioned, and tidy, but I don't think it was clean. Lots of stains on the couches and gave the impression of being given a quick wipe-down rather than a deep clean. My final complaint was the WiFi. I had a hard time getting it to function with my work computer and when it did work it was incredibly slow. Seriously like dial-up speeds. So all in all I can score this hotel as Average at best. I expected more as the experience was poor relative to other premium hotels I have stayed in. If I had to stay at a Disney hotel again it would not be this one.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Tower Best Out There”
Reviews.Author: JasminedogLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club owners at the Disney Boardwalk Villas and our family of 4 decided to try the Bay Lake Tower at the Disney Contemporary Resort. We used our points for a 6 night June 2010 stay in a dedicated two-bedroom villa. At the time of booking we were fortunate to be able to reserve a Standard View villa since these required fewer DVC points and are relatively few in number. Check-in was inconveniently located in the 1st floor lobby of the adjacent Contemporary Resort. The 4th floor contained a small convenience market, gift shops, 3 restaurants and the Disney World monorail station. A small corner exit of the 4th floor led to the walkway that connected to the 5th floor of the Tower. We arrived in the evening and were assigned a Standard View villa located on the first floor (Unit 7144). I was initially disappointed and was concerned about the view and location, but there were no other Standard View 2-bedrooms available upon check-in. The desk clerk was of little help in securing a higher floor Villa since we had reserved a Standard View unit (no luck for us). However, upon entering we were pleasantly surprised at the contemporary interior design of the spacious villa. The furnishings were still generally new (given that Bay Lake Tower is less than 1 year old) and the floor layout was well designed. My teen son commented that it was designed like an urban loft condo. We were also pleased that our ground floor Villa was an end unit in the south wing of the Tower and faced the Contemporary Resort boat marina and Bay Lake beyond. Villas from the 2nd to 16th floor of the Tower had enclosed balcony railings. Our villa on the ground floor was open to the grassy lawn surrounding the tower and felt quite spacious and open since no balcony railing was needed. The only downside to the ground floor unit was that the large picture windows and sliding glass doors afforded little privacy at night, requiring that our drapes be drawn (during the day, the reflective glass of the Tower eliminated any interior views from passersby on the outside). Initially hesitant and concerned, we concluded that our Villa location at the end of the 1st floor hallway allowed for a quiet and private location. The end of hall location also made it very easy to exit the building to conveniently access the Bay Cove Pool area and the buildingâ€™s inner courtyard with the bocce ball and shuffleboard courts. An added bonus was that a few yards from our patio one could access the small and deserted white sand beach fronting the marina with plenty of sand chairs available for quiet sunning. The ground floor location also made it very convenient to access the Disney World shuttle bus stop that was shared with the Contemporary Resort guests. The dedicated Villa had a Master Bedroom with a King Bed, a small writing desk, side chair, flat screen TV and a great master bath with spa tub, glass enclosed shower, and plenty of drawer space. In the dedicated 2-bedroom Villas, the second bedroom contained two queen beds, flat screen TV and a much more spacious bathroom with separate sink area (since a separate exit door and kitchenette are not needed in the dedicated 2-bedroom). The living room featured a queen pull out sofa bed and a twin side chair sofa bed, DVD player, flat screen TV, built-in dinette and a small third bathroom (making morning wash-ups very convenient). In total, the 2-bedroom Villa could sleep 9 persons. The contemporary kitchen had a stainless steel refrigerator, stove, microwave and dishwasher; excellent lighting; a great kitchen island and breakfast bar that had cabinets and drawers; and two clever slide out pocket door pantries that easily stored our breakfast items. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes and cookware, although I did have to call housekeeping to request a few missing items from the kitchen inventory. The staff responded quickly and delivered the missing items. There was plenty of closet space and the Villa was furnished with a wood high chair, pack-n-play, vacuum cleaner and stacked washer and dryer. On three of our nights we viewed the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the Top of the World Lounge (access only for Disney Vacation Club owners). It was a cozy and very beautiful lounge with floor to ceiling windows providing awesome views of the surrounding Disney World property. The rooftop deck was spacious and provided views of the fireworks with a piped-in soundtrack from the Magic Kingdom. The Magic Kingdom is an easy 10-15 minute stroll from the Tower if one did not want to wait for a monorail. The Contemporary Resort fitness center was adequate with plenty of cardio and stacked weight machines. The fitness center was available for 24-hours which was a major plus. We also rented two Sea Raycers at the hotelâ€™s Marina, which allowed us to zip around for about 45 minutes on the Bay Lake and Seven Seas Lagoon of Disney World. Other watercraft were available for rent from either the Contemporary Marina or Sammy Duvallâ€™s Water Sports (both shared the same marina building). The marina also provided fun and convenient transport boats to get to Wilderness Lodge and the Fort Wilderness area of Disney World. The Bay Cove Pool was a family pool that, frankly, could have been designed larger. Forget about doing exercise laps in the very busy and kid-filled pool here. It had a fun twisting water slide, zero entry area and an adjoining water fountain play area. On busy hot days, I would imagine lounge chairs would be at a premium. Towels are provided and the adjacent Cove Bar offered a limited lunch and drink menu. The Bay Cove Pool was restricted to guests staying in the Tower. Our only concern for the future would be the on-going housekeeping maintenance of the Villas, since full housekeeping service is generally only done after a family checks out for stays of 7 nights or less. I noticed that some of the shower tiles were in the beginning stages of mildew accumulation, some of the carpet areas were showing tread wear and tear, the kitchen stove top was getting scratched, some of the wood surfaces of the furniture were chipped or scratched, and some of the curtain blinds were damaged from careless guests. Nevertheless, we would highly recommend the Bay Lake Tower and will definitely return and even request the same unit. The pleasant Villa made our Disney World vacation a joy to return to each night.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: raleighgal
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised!! You can't beat the convenient 5 min. walk to the Magic Kingdom and monorail service steps out your door. But what most impressed us was the clean and lovely modern ambience of our room. The room (a suite with separate bed/bath was beautiful w/ boutique quality linens, and decor. The kitchen had stainless steel appliances and any accoutrement you could ask for so you could cook all your meals in if you wanted. The bath/shower was all marble w/ shoji screens for privacy---perfect! Our six year old loved the 3 story slide at the pool ( a small pool, but adequate). Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Oh, and we faced the parking lot/MKingdom which wasn't too pretty during the day, but made for excellent fireworks viewing at night on the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - Just be careful on wet floors!”
Reviews.Author: NanaB2010
Reviews.Content: Bay Lake Tower was a wonderful place to stay - close to Magic Kingdom. However, I was very disappointed in the flooring in the bathrooms and kitchen area. Very, very slippery. After coming in from the pool, my seven year old grandson slipped on the bathroom floor and almost hit his head. These floors are very smooth and polished....bad choice for a resort focused around young children!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay at Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: 4hughs
Reviews.Content: It was our 20th anniversary and we got a great deal and were able to stay at BLT for our disney world trip. It was AWESOME. We were on the 4th floor near the elevators in a three room suite. It was huge. The pictures online do not do it justice. I have four kids ages 4-17 and my husband and i were a party of six. This was perfect with so much room to spread out. The three bathrooms were great to have. The master had a nice walk in shower and whirlpool tub. I used the washer/dryer every day. The full kitchen was very sleek and functional. I had grocer.com deliver in groceries for some of our meals and snacks. My kids loved to be able to see the monorail go by our window and see the MK and fireworks every night. It doesn't have the "theme" atmosphere of other disney locations unless the theme is "sleek, modern, future" style, but it has mickey mouse pictures and designs and for me location and convenience with four kids trumped the theme aspect. They also showed movies on a big screen on the lawn downstairs every night and of course you could see the lighted boat parade too. My 9 year old enjoyed the arcade. You have access to 3 pools, the one at bay lake and the other two at the contemporary. My kids liked the fountain at the contemporary pool and the slide at BLT. This hotel was VERY quiet and peaceful a great break from the parks. The location is everything. If you can stay on the monorail do it. It saves you so much time and is convenient especially with tired little ones. I was also able to easily access events/places at the polynesian and Grand floridian using the monorail. To get to the monorail and counterservice/chef mickey's etc. you have to walk across a skybridge to the contemporary. We had lovely weather so it really was no big deal, but it could be windy and it would probably be unpleasant in bad weather. Bell service seemed very busy and behind a lot, so expect to wait 30 minutes or so for your stuff instead of the 15 minutes they tell you. My room was cleaned daily and very well done, although we didn't experience any towels made into animals or anything like that. That's OK, i couldn't make a towel into an animal if they wanted me to either!! The maid was very nice and friendly. Balconey doors have locks thank goodness. If you have little ones be advised that the balconey railing is the type with a concrete footer (that can be climbed) and a shorter railing on top. My only complaint is echoed by others: there are no locks on the bathroom doors or interior doors. The bathroom doors slide and with no latch or lock they would sometimes bounce back open repeatedly. Even if everyone is family, you should have a way to keep others from accidentally walking in on you. And Mom and Dad, if you are seeking privacy in your master bedroom after the kids go to sleep i recommend propping the desk chair against the door! (it worked :) ) But this was a small thing. Our stay was wonderful we all enjoyed this "home" away from home. 5 years ago we stayed at Port Orleans, what a difference! If you can splurge or get a deal go for it it is worth it!! If we can come again someday i will try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort @ Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5-2010
Reviews.Content: 5/18/2010 - just got back from 1 week at Disney. This was our 4th annual trip and this was hands down the best hotel we've stayed at (previously stayed at Wilderness and Beach Club). The room was amazing - everything was brand new and clean. LOVED the space. I have 3 girls and the 1BR was perfect for us. My 7 yr old twins slept in the pull out sofa and my 9 yr old slept in the pull out chair (nice sized - size of a twin bed). From reading other reviews, we asked for a even # room on an upper floor. We ended up on the 3rd floor (even #)...we didn't want to wait for a higher floor to come available. The view of bay lake was great and being on the 3rd floor turned out to be very convenient ...could use the stairs to get to the pool and outside easily. This hotel was the most quiet hotel I've ever stayed in. We could hear the evening light parade, but it was only for about 10 min. The only drawback was the lighting in the bathroom. Both bathrooms had horrible lighting. I challenge any female staff member at this hotel to go in there and apply their makeup. Bring your own lighted makeup mirror -- you'll be glad you did. Pool was ok -- geared toward younger kids. Bring a few pool toys to help pass the time. The pool doesn't go deeper than 5 feet and there's no room to swim laps. We used the garden grocer and it worked out great. Groceries were there B4 arrival and we had them delivered to our room 10 min after check in. Take a trip up to the 15th floor to check out the views from the windows - we got some great pics. Don't bring dishwasher soap -- they have that and paper towels. Wish they had a baking sheet, just had a small glass pan for our nuggets & fries. They didn't replace our clothes washer soap, so you may want to bring a few 'singles' packets. BTW - there is no bus service to Epcot. You have to take the monorail and change at the WTC. If you have an early breakfast booked, don't book it B4 8:30. We left on the first tram at 7 am and barely made it there by our reservation at 8:30 (they do safety checks early in the am). You should plan on at least 45 min to get to any park except MK...but that's true of any resort.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best at DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: syvergy
Reviews.Content: It's pretty hard to fault this hotel. Like many modern additions to hotels in the US, the Bay Lake is connected to the Contemporary Hotel via a short walkway, allowing a secure and quick connection to the Monorail, shops and other amenities. Unfortunately, it doesn't have a staffed checkin, so that all must be done via the Phone or in person at the Main desk. Check In was very quick, luggage was brought from the lobby to our room without much fuss. The Key to the World system is FANTASTIC - the same card is your theme park ticket, your global payment system for anything, and your room key. I have to congratulate on the park for this system, simply fantastic, don't need to carry anything else. The room was a little far away from the elevator, but no big deal. It was very spacious, great balcony, big TV, comfortable big bed, great kitchenette, everything clean. Bathroom was so-so, but functional. The Electric Water event every night was incredibly irritating, it goes for far too long and is extremely loud. Would prefer to be in a room away from it next time, or for it just not to happen at all ;p Room service was surprisingly cheap. Bare food supplies can be bought at a shop for reasonably prices as well, and the restaurants have fantastic value. Very impressed. Was even able to get food delivered from a local rib joint! Would recommend to all and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & views, nice amenities.”
Reviews.Author: mom_of_2NJ
Reviews.Content: Spent the first week in May in a one bedroom villa at Bay Lake Tower. Had an even numbered room on the 12th floor overlooking Bay Lake and the grounds of the Contemporary. The room was large and comfortable with a very nice kitchen and 2 baths. There was a comfortable pull-out couch in the living area and also a pull-out chair. The bed in the bedroom was comfortable, if a little soft. Bathrooms were very clean. Stacked washer/dryer was great but a little loud. The sliding doors to the bathroom in the main room and the shower/toilet part of the master bath were not a problem for us, as others here have suggested. The location of this hotel makes it well worth the money. You can walk to the Magic Kingdom in about 5-10 minutes. The Contemporary is the first stop on the monorail leaving the MK, which is also very convenient. Our room overlooked the lake, not the theme park. I thought ours was a much nicer view. If seeing the fireworks from your room every night is a priority, then pay for the park view. But during the day, you really see very little of the theme park and mostly a parking lot on that side of the hotel. We were able to view the fireworks from the bridge connecting BLT to the Contemporary, which was nicer than having to fight the crowds leaving the MK after the fireworks. The pool area is terrific, except that there is very little shade. The only umbrellas are attached to tables. If shade is important to you, you might have more luck at the Contemporary pool where the trees are more mature. There are great water slides at both pools, and a fun walk-through fountain for the kids at the BLT pool. We ordered groceries from gardengrocer.com and found the service to be very convenient. It was a little inconvenient to have to walk to the Contemporary if you needed front desk/concierge services. It would be nicer if the lobby of BLT was staffed. Also, at certain times (morning, dinner time) the elevators were busy. When we first checked in, our kitchen counter was full of crumbs. That was our only housekeeping complaint. But there was ample dishwasher and laundry detergent. Finally, the resort charges $10 a night for wired (no wireless in the rooms) internet service. I thought that was pretty outrageous, given the high cost of the room. Free wireless is an amenity I would expect at a hotel of this caliber. Overall, this was an excellent hotel and our stay there was very comfortable. I would recommend it to anyone, but especially to families that will spend a lot of time at the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel! Perfect Location, Perfect Pool!!”
Reviews.Author: dancingdaisies
Reviews.Content: I was just at Disney with 4 adults, a 4-year- and two 2-year-olds. This hotel was perfect. We got a 2 bedroom condo, perfect for two small families. It had three full baths which were nice when the kiddos were napping and one of us had to take a shower or whatever so we didn't wake the kids up. The living and kitchen area were in the middle of the bedrooms, which kept each family very private (and we couldn't hear each other - crying or whatever). The pool at the Bay Lake Towers had a zero-entry and small slide PERFECT for little ones who just wanted to splash around. It also had a little "splash" area, with padded floor. There was also a pool bar (great cocktails!!) and it had light food as well, sandwiches and etc. You could always walk to the Contemporary for food - short walk in my opinion and not a hassle at all. We ate breakfast at the condo each morning, then ate lunch and dinner at the Disney parks or hotels. This hotel is perfect for just walking to the Magic Kingdom for a quick bite to eat! I really enjoyed my trip to Disney, and this hotel really made it magical for us....okay, Magic Kingdom was the most magical! You could watch the fireworks from the hotel. Chef Mickey is at the Contemporary as well, I recommend it. Most of the Character dinners were buffets, but let me tell you, they were the best buffets I've ever had. And like good/gourmet food. The food was fabulous! They had kid friendly, as well as adult friendly (fish/salads) food. I was impressed. Everything about Disney is great. The service was excellent as well. I just can't complain about anything - well one thing - DON'T TAKE YOUNG KIDS ON THE HAUNTED MANSION RIDE!!! That is my only regret. I also recommend if you go to Disney to go to www.tourguidemike.com and check out his services for getting you through the Disney parks on the least crowded days, and he also tells you which rides to ride first and etc. It is worth the $17 fee! I've used his service twice, and it got us through Magic Kingdom without waiting in crazy lines! I could write more, but it would go on and on. Please email me if you need any further info. Have fun at Disney if you are going and I would stay and pay the extra money to be as close to Magic Kingdom as possible. It makes the world of difference when you are so close and don't have to take up time on a shuttle or monorail. Happy Travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect First Trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: pbycz
Reviews.Content: We loved the Bay Lake Tower and felt lucky to have been able to stay there. I understand that Disney is trying to make this location exclusive for members, so we snuck in! Opened in August 2009 this hotel feels new and clean. It is connected to the Contemporary via bridge and it has easy access to the monorail. I liked the fact that it did not have restaurants and shops in the building as it was a needed break from the constant sensory stimulation that is Disney. It was mellow and uncrowded. The pool was totally kid friendly and the parent friendly bar was just what the doctor ordered. We did follow the suggestions from fellow travelers and ordered groceries ahead of time . How nice to see it was there upon our arrival. However this is totally not a must since there is a small market in the Contemporary. The only thing we did not like is that the Disney Express Bus did not bring our luggage and it takes anywhere from 3-5 hours to deliver it to your room. Next time I would get the bus, but collect our bags ourselves from baggage claim instead of using the Disney Claim Service. The tub was amazing and it was super helpful having 2 bathrooms. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to the MAGIC”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel79
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable. We walked every morning to Magic Kingdom with our 3 small children & took the monorail home. The room (1 bdrm suite) was beautiful, clean, and well equipped with a full kitchen, a master suite with King size bed & ensuite, a pull out couch and pull out chair, both very comfortable. We had the view of the castle and could watch the fireworks from our room, or balcony! Outdoor movies on the property everynight. The only down side I can think of off hand is that the lobby of the tower is useless, you have to call or go to the Contemporary for everything. Which isn't a big deal at all, but for the $ I think they should staff the lobby with some knowledgeable staff. We had a great stay and plan to do it all over again in a year or 2.

Reviews.Title: “It was great and I would come back.”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney for one night and stayed here because it is very close to Magic Kingdom. I really liked it. It was nice and clean and the theme was really cool, and the monorail comes to the hotel which is cool. I never got to go swimming but the pool looked nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - few suggestions”
Reviews.Author: mrazone
Reviews.Content: As far as disney properties go this one is very nice. The hotel is obviously brand new, clean, and you can't beat the location. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit for 5 nights. We had a total of 4 adults and two children. The grocery delivery service was great, they arrived about 30 minutes after we got into our room. We also shipped a box down via UPS that had all of our diapers, formula, baby food, etc - so we didn't have to pack everything. That box was brought up to our room about 10 mins after we checked in. Check in was easy and of course 99.999% of the people in Disney are always nice. The roof top lounge for DVC members was great and hopefully that remains a perk for DVC members only. The room itself was neat and clean, by disney standards it was big - but not as big as what you get at a typical timeshare resort. The layout was kind of strange - not sure you really need the third bathroom. Now for what I didn't like - NONE of the interior doors have locks???? OK, that is just a little too modern for my taste. Not sure what Disney was thinking here but there should be locks on these doors - if not on the bathroom doors than at least on the bedroom doors - the main bathroom in the common area really should have a lock as well. If you go with guests that aren't family this is a little strange. The main building should have check in, and they need some type of store and place to grab a quick snack - very poor oversight. Finally, the beds stink! I don't know what it is with places that spend a ton of money on showerheads but skimp on the pillows. I love having a nice shower, but I NEED a nice pillow and mattress/bedding. Everyone in our party were complaining about the beds and even people we met in the roof top lounge were saying the same things. Hopefully disney listens - of course that just means our annual fees will go up to make these changes, but hey - it would be worth it! The only minor thing I would point out is that if you get a lake view room, that electric parade on the water is annoying and loud - our 4 year old woke up a couple of night because of it, after a few days there they were so tired that they slep through it, but that show is very loud so next time I would try a MK view. The lake view was nice - you could go to the roof or the elevator banks to see the fireworks, and then relax in your room and watch the epcot fireworks across the lake. All in all a nice place - but a few minor changes and Disney would have really created and ultimate resort.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake is an exciting new option for previous Contempory fans.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMomOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's new Bay Lake Towers on Feb 15-19, 2010. Our room was 8432, on the 14th floor. I read many reviews before booking my reservation and chose Bay Lake to try something new. We usually stay at the Contemporary and love its convenience on the Monorail, the Chef Mickey Character meals in the hotel and the decor and excitement of the Monorail going through the hotel. Bay Lake is attached to the Contemporary through a connector "skywalk" on the 5th floor. It's a short walk from one to the other, but during the month of February it was quite chilly and VERY windy walking across. (Temperatures in Orlando that week were 37 degrees at night). Our room was first to the right off the south elevators, just past the storage closet. It was very quiet with hardly any noise coming from other rooms or the hallway. The view was the Contemporary pool area and the harbor. Floors 1-9 begin with 7*** and floors 10-16 begin with 8***. If you are on the 4th floor the numbers are 7402-7444. If you are on the 15th floor the numbers are 8502-8544 so the second number is the floor and the last two are the location on that floor. If you want a view outward towards Magic Kingdom, you need to reserve an even numbered room between 8414 and 8430. Odd rooms look at the Bay Lake harbor and pool area. Those are nice views too however. The lower the floor the less the view so I recommend floors 5 and up. We had a studio room, the smallest available. Two adults and two preschoolers fit nicely in this room, although crowded. Since we don't spend a lot of time in the room, that was fine for us. There were a few design flaws in my opinion. There was no stool for the kids to reach the higher level counters. That was difficult to hold them up to wash hands and brush teeth. The mirror in the sink area was 24" wide, leaving a squishy area for two adults to groom themselves (my husband is a mirror hog). There is no full length mirror (sorry ladies). The kitchenette is nice, but crowded because it houses the bathroom sink as well. Loved the bathtub and toilet area. Beautiful glass tile. Overall, loved the decor. The balcony was nice but I wish they had childproof locks so the kids couldn't unlock the door on their own and get to the balcony. Close supervision is necessary. Cabinet space is nice but counter space for "stuff" is narrow in the room area. Loved the pull out couch because the kids were protected from falling with cushions. I wish there were food options in Bay Lake but a short walk to Contemporary solves that problem. I would stay there again but might upgrade to a one bedroom for more space.

Reviews.Title: “So Close to the Magic”
Reviews.Author: picc_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bay Lake Tower the new addition to the Disney Vacation Club (DVC) on the same property of one of the first Disney World hotels The Contemporary. This is a very contemporary, bright, modern hotel that I will stay at many times in the future. One of the best kept secret at this hotel is the Top of the World Lounge on top of the tower. Now this is only open at the moment at 5pm and you can only get admittance with a DVC member. The fireworks from this area is beautiful and the music is piped in and so clear. It gets crowded only during the fireworks time and the appetizers are awesome. You can also watch the fireworks from your room if it faces the Magic Kingdom and tune your flat screen TV in the room to channel 20 for the music. Now there is no restaurant at this hotel which makes it a very quiet and romantic hotel. Since this is a DVC hotel all the rooms have amenities like in room washer & dryer, full kitchen and split bath = one with a shower the other with a jacuzzi tub. The studios have kitchenettes. The only downfall was the windows didn't have sheers for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: DinaS4
Reviews.Content: The occomadations were excellent..If the children are over 10 I would advise the Universal Studios park...The magic Kigdom is geared toward younger visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location hands down of any Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: TeamLR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day first trip to Disney. Very pleased that we decided on Bay Lake Tower, 1-bdrm villa. If you are traveling with kids, and want the amenities of home, this is the place. Having the separate bdrm meant we could put the kids down to sleep in the living area (each on separate beds, one queen pullout & one single pullout) and relax with a glass of wine in our own room. The washer/dryer was great to have, we came home with 3 suitcases of clean clothes!! The housekeeping was great to replenish my TIDE supply each day. We had groceries delivered prior to arrival from GARDENGROCER.com, which we would highly recommend. We enjoyed coffee/breakfast in our room each morning and then headed out for the parks. You can WALK to Magic Kingdom, which at the end of the day, after the Fireworks get out, is a super plus. Everyone else was scrambling to get to their bus/monorail/boat, and we strolled out, about a 10 minute walk max. Our room was 8036 on the 10th floor. From our room, we viewed Bay Lake & the Contemporary pool. We also could see the EPCOT fireworks each night. I would recommend requesting an even-numbered room on as high a floor as they will give you. Getting an even number allows you to be on the outside of the crescent shaped building, which is much better for your view. We originally were assigned an odd numbered room, and luckily were able to switch. Although this resort is a bit pricier than some others, I believe the convenience of the location (it is the only resort you can walk to the MK from), being on the monorail line, and the amenities in the rooms are completely worth it. Lastly, we found the Disney buses which stop right out front of the Contemporary to be very efficient. We never waited more then 10 mins for a bus to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Happyhoneykvw
