Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Contemporary Hotel in 2006 and thought it was fantastic! As DVC (Disney Vacation Club) members this new property gives us the opportunity to stay a few minutes walk or ride on the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. The view we had from our 1 bed room was of Bay Lake and the pool area and I loved it. Other rooms have Magic Kingdom views (for extra points) The room was HUGE! A comfortable sitting area with a convertible sofa which made a double bed, and an extra large chair which made a fab single bed. Also there was a fully fitted kitchen area, cooker, dishwasher, fridge and lots of cupboard space with a generous dining area. A laundry room with a washer and dryer made our stay even more easier. We had two bathrooms, one smaller one near the entrance, but still providing WC, basin, bath with shower over it. The second bathroom was en-suite to the master bedroom and had a large, deep, corner whirlpool bath, WC, double basins and seperate shower cubicle. The Master Bedroom had a king size bed large flat screen TV (same size as the one in the living area) and a balcony. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new 1-br villa”
Reviews.Author: JoMama_25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Lake Tower 12/29 - 1/4. It was a choice between Old Key West and Contemporary. Contemporary was more expensive but we wanted something along the monorail since it was going to be our first time at a WDW resort. The monorail actually makes a big difference. It runs a lot more frequently than the buses. I can't say we got a good deal on the 1-br villa, but we booked last minute and chose the location over price. The room we got was wonderful. On the 7th floor with a lake view. At night we could see fireworks as well as the electrical show on the lake that happens nightly. The bedroom had a huge full bathroom with separate shower. There's another smaller full bathroom outside. The kitchen is fully stocked with utensils, pots and pans, dishes, glasses. There's a small island with 2 high bar stools. And the eating area is cushioned wrap around bench. (Hope I'm describing it well.) The living room has a twin sleeper sofa and a full sleeper sofa. In the morning, my 2-year old would just run around and play in the living room. It seemed a bit large for my family of 4, but we appreciated the extra space. The service was fine. Check in was at the Contemporary and it was relatively quick. There's a tv in the lobby playing Disney videos for the kids to watch. The Wave restaurant is in the lobby level and it was pretty good. The Contempo Cafe is slow when there are a lot of people there. But the food was okay for a quick breakfast or lunch. The beach area is clean and not very large. There are 2 sections. One on the Contemporary side and one by the Bay Lake Towers. We didn't use the pools but we did see a lot of lifeguards patrolling. In all, we really enjoyed our WDW experience and the hotel was a wonderful place to return to after a day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Location - DVC Member”
Reviews.Author: ktkmeeko
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and decided to stay here for 6 nights from Nov. 9th to 15th. We were on the 12th floor overlooking the pool and Bay Lake and stayed in a one bedroom unit, since there were only the two of us. We could walk to the Magic Kingdom, and the monorail was just a short walk away in the Contemporary. Every night we watched the Electric Water Pageant from our balcony. We also went up to the Roof Top Lounge several nights to watch the fireworks over the Magic Kingdom and had drinks there. This lounge is only for DVC members staying at Bay Lake Towers. What a great perk! One afternoon we relaxed by the pool and had a snack at the bar. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.l

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: UkRaider
Reviews.Content: We were there in early Dec for 2 weeks and we were on the southside on the 10 floor with a lake view . I would rather have this sort of view than an Magic Kingdom view as all you see is the car park and castle . At least with the lake view its relaxing to look out of and you can always see the fireworks from the 16th Floor . I recommend the southside view rather than the northside as with the southside you get to see epcot in th distance and the boats I cannot stress enough that if you book this place ...ASK for a high floor

Reviews.Title: “Great place with some inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: ArtifactDetective
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at Bay Lake Tower at WDW during the holiday season. Our views consisted of the lake, pool, Epcot and Downtown Disney. Don't waste your money on a Magic Kingdom view as you can see the MK from the elevator area, breezeway to the Contemporary, and observation deck. The Contemporary resort has the best transportation around. You're walking distance to the MK, there is a bus every 5 minutes to Animal Kingdom, or Downtown Disney. Also there is the monorail which can take you to Epcot, the Polynesian and Grand Floridian resorts, and the MK. There is a community hall which has games and you can rent movies if you ever run into a rainy day and are stuck indoors. The bad features are there is no restaurant, or quick food place in the Bay Lake Tower, so you have to walk over to the Contemporary every time you want a drink or snack. Beware that the bathroom doors do not lock. The bathroom sinks are also very high, and if you're child is small you have to hold them to the sink so they can wash their hands and brush their teeth. Also there never seems to be anyone working at the front desk in the main lobby of Bay Lake. Check in and bell service is in the Contemporary, there is no one in Bay Lake to help with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: dcrmom
Reviews.Content: We were very much looking forward to staying at the Bay Lake Tower as DVC members. For the most part, we were delighted with our stay. The location simply can't be beat for easy access to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot via the Monorail. The Wave -- the new restaurant in the lobby of the Contemporary is great for grabbing a healthy breakfast before starting your day. Dinner was good too. Food is organic, locally grown, sustainable, and amazingly affordable for all that. The retro decor is not my cuppa tea, but for the convenience to restaurants and parks, I can overlook it. When we arrived, it wasn't very clean. Crumbs on the living room carpet, some sludge on a kitchen counter, spittle on the bathroom mirror -- we weren't impressed and requested another cleaning. We found our room acceptable upon our return, but it always makes you wonder after you walk in and find it in that condition. I would give this resort a 4 out of 5 stars. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm spoiled now!”
Reviews.Author: lilcraft
Reviews.Content: Staying here was something I looked forward to ever since I booked the stay in April. I was not disappointed at all with the location, condition or styling. I loved everything about this place and the view from floor 14 was fantastic. My studio overlooked bay lake and the pool and on the other side of the building was MK view. The studio had a great bed, small fridge and micro with coffee station. You did have to walk over to the contempo if you wanted a sit down place to eat, not a big deal in my opinion. If you get the chance, book a stay here, you can WALK to the MAGIC KINGDOM people!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful view!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaRN97
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio (two young children) for three nights prior to a cruise - you can't be the location to the magic kingdom!! A quick walk and you are there! We are members of DVC so we were able to use the Top of the World Lounge - spectacular view of the fireworks and the staff in the lounge were wonderful! The studio was the size of your average hotel room, with a kitchenette. We had a lake view but also had a view of Magic Kingdom - a nice little suprise!

Reviews.Title: “After a long wait, a great addition to WDW!”
Reviews.Author: deej696
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BLT this week for our annual trip to WDW for the Epcot Food and Wine festival. The resort is beautiful, with fantastic grounds and rooms. The decor in the rooms is great, and the beds were quite comfy. We stayed in a Bay Lake view room, which was great and also overlooked the main Contemporary building. While a higher floor would have been nice, our room was located on the 5th floor, which is the same as the sky bridge connecting BLT to the Contemporary. We are DVC members, so we spent a couple evenings at the Top of the World lounge on the 16th floor. It is fantastic and a great place to watch the fireworks from Magic Kingdom. While its supposedly for DVC members staying at the resort only, I think it largely depends on who is working the lounge check in desk. The first visit we were asked for our DVC card, our 2nd visit we just asked to be let up and he did so without asking for anything. A few things of note: The showers are incredibly powerful, almost painfully so. A trick Iearned was to only turn the shower lever slightly over and that reduced the pressure. In addition, we are used to staying at Boardwalk and walking right back to the resort from Epcot at the end of the day. While being connected to the monorail is a great attraction, be prepared it will likely take an hour to return to BLT from Epcot if you stay till their fireworks. If Magic Kingdom is your primary park, it cant be beat, as its a very short walk over. Also some may have noted already, but the bathrooms are not exactly private. There is only a pocket door, with no lock, and its was not the best for privacy. Its more or less like using the restroom behind a chinese room divider. All that said, BLT is a beautiful resort, and we cant wait to return again in just a few months!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay over Halloween”
Reviews.Author: KermitNC
Reviews.Content: General My 10-year old son and I did a father and son 5-night trip to Disney and stayed at the newest Disney Vacation Clubâ€™s Bay Lake Tower (BLT), which just opened in September. BLT is very conveniently located next to the well-known Contemporary Resort (CR). Parking is free. There is a connecting walkway to CR for easy access to the monorail to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. In fact, Magic Kingdom is close enough to walk, especially when monorail is quite busy (e.g. after fireworks). Plus by walking over to MK, you can catch a bus to anywhere without having to change buses. Of note, check in is at the CR. Most of the amenities are at the Contemporary (e.g. restaurants, shops, concierge, health club/spa, business center, marina). DVC members have access to all the amenities at CR (but not vice versa). But it is somewhat inconvenient to have to walk over to CR if you just need a little something, like milk. Bay Lake Tower does have a tennis courts, a nice pool with a slide and hot tub, and a poolside bar. The Community Hall has lots of activities for kids all day long, mostly free. There is also a very nice Top of the World Lounge on the top floor with full-service bar and limited menu that is only accessible to DVC members staying at BLT using DVC points. It is a wonderful place to watch the fireworks at Magic Kingdom. Accommodation We stayed in a very large, elegant 1-bedroom suite overlooking Bay Lake. There is a 20-foot widow in the living room. In fact, we can see the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our living room, so we had free entertainment every night. There are two full baths. In the contemporary theme, dÃ©cor is very modern. Flat panel HDTV in the living room and bedroom. Full kitchen amenities (stone countertop, oven, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, dishwasher, full-size refrigerator) and wash/dryer combination. Wired internet access is $10 a day but FREE to DVC members. A laptop-size safe is in the room. The only minor complaint I had was that the toilets flushes are a bit noisy and we can hear neighbors flushing all night. I did not notice a lot of noise otherwise. Summary Very nice place to stay. Location is great. Slightly isolated because everything is over at Contemporary Resort. But also much less chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, but beware of paying extra for the view”
Reviews.Author: MTechSolutions
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat what others have said - the villa accomodations are spacious. We had both a one and a two BR villa for a party of 2 and 3 respectively. The decor of both the Contemporary and the Bay Tower may be off-putting to some (it's very 70's in a sort of Brady Bunch meets Jeff Lewis meets Airport Lounge way), but the rooms are big, and having a second full (albeit smaller) bathroom in the one-bedroom villa makes life a lot easier for those with families. The two bedroom villa had 3 baths. Everything was spotless, sparkling, and new as can be - with the exception of the tens-of-thousands of flying ants that seemed to be everywhere around the outside the hotel entrances at night. Thankfully, by the next morning they were lying dead in sprawling piles all around the same locations either because they spray every night or because they only live for a few hours after sprouting wings. We opted for the "Magic Kingdom" view and paid a considerable premium for what turned out to be predominantly a view of the front parking lot, with the MK off to the right - I uploaded a photo from our 4th floor window. What we got was an ugly view and a lot of traffic noise. The interior view rooms that overlook the pool are a far better deal and the view is also much better, so I'd recommend those unless you absolutely must see the top of Cinderella's castle peeking out over the tree-tops. We had a few complaints regarding noise - banging/slamming/stomping - sure, this is WDW and there are lots of kids and families around, but this seemed to go on all night long, so I'm really not sure what the source of the noise was. The walls are thin - I could hear conversational level voices from the adjacent room. It's an awkward location - connected to the main Contemporary Tower by a bridge on the concourse/4th floor - the whole tower just sorta sprouted up on a sparse plot of land. If you want any type of refreshment or snack - a drink, something to eat, etc, there is nothing at all in the Bay Tower to be found and you've gotta schlepp it over to the main hotel (there are vending machines on each floor but they only dispense candy). Lastly (and this is a huge pet-peeve of mine) they do not offer free high-speed internet. 10 bucks a day for a wired hookup. No wireless in the room. Come on, nowadays internet service is commodity and pervasive, and lots of people carry laptops/netbooks when travelling so it's not just a "business" amenity. As an aside, I have a few comments regarding the overall experience that aren't specific to the hotel per se. 1) At-hotel Flight Checkin: There seems to be an overall lack of coordination with the hotel check-out process and flight checkin/boarding pass issuance. We were only provided with one pass, despite their being 2 in our party, and then had to stand in the checkin line at the hotel not once, but twice, to try to resolve the issue. But again, that's all part-and-parcel of the WDW experience - expect to spend the majority of your time while you're there *waiting* in some sort of line. 2) Magical Express Bus Confusion: Upon departure, a non-Disney (labelled Mears Transport) bus appeared at the Port Cochere, and we barely noticed because it wasn't clearly announced that that was the bus we should board - I suspected it was "our" bus and I am glad that I asked the bus driver, or else we would have left without us. 2) We were there for Halloween. We've been going every year for "Mickey's not-so-scary Halloween Party" at the MK, and every year it has gotten progressively more crowded. It was so crowded in Fantasyland this year that we literally could not move. There is supposed to be Trick or Treating throughout the park, but this year, I estimate there were about 1/3 the stations than in previous years - we only were able to get close enough to one of those stations inside the park. 3) Shuttle Bus service around the resort seems misallocated and not sufficient. We waited for a bus more than a half hour to go from the Contemporary to Downtown Disney, and the return required a similar wait.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back in a heart beat! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kelsum02
Reviews.Content: We recently returned home after a 4 night, 5 day stay at Bay Lake Tower. Wow, this resort does not disappoint! We originally had a "standard" view room, but were upgraded to a lake view, one bedroom. The room was spacious, clean, and very modern. The beds, including the pull out couch, were very comfortable. The bathrooms were also modern and clean, and the master bathroom was amazing. My only complaint about the bathrooms is that the sliding doors do not lock and there is no counter space in the smaller bathroom. You have to use the shelf under the sink or the tower shelf to store your personal items. Not good planning. The other thing I thought was odd was that they have a beautiful, huge window overlooking the lake, but they placed a floor lamp right smack dab in the middle of it! Very odd. In order to get to the Contemporary, you have to take a covered walkway that connect the buildings. Not a big deal and actually quite nice especially at night because it has an amazing view of the Magic Kingdom. The staff at Bay Lake and Contemporary is top notch!! The pool and pool bar at Bay Lake is wonderful; shallow for young kids and plenty big. The Bay Lake Tower doesn't have the "character" that some of the other Disney resorts have, but if you're looking for convenience this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back to Bay Lake Tower”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: As new Disney Vacation Club members, this was our first stay at our home resort, Bay Lake Tower. Weâ€™re a family of 3 (2 adults and an 8 year old girl), so we decided to save points and book a studio. Overall, we loved our stay. Weâ€™d been assigned the fourth floor, but at check-in were moved to a studio on the 15th floor overlooking the pool and Bay Lake. The view was nice. Off to the side was the lake, the pool was right down below and we could see the other wing of the building across the way. Because we were so high, having the view of the building wasn't much of an issue. The studio itself was much smaller than Iâ€™d imagined, even after looking at many pictures and layouts on the web. It was like a small to medium size hotel room with a bed, sofa sleeper, cramped desk area, small toilet and bath area and small kitchen area with two sinks â€“ one that was supposed to go with the bath (thereâ€™s not sink in the room with the toilet and tub) and one that was for the kitchen. For such a small space, it was very efficient, but I wouldnâ€™t have want to stay in a studio that small with anyone other than my husband and daughter. There just wasnâ€™t much privacy and even the bathroom door didnâ€™t lock. Aside from the size of the unit, the design was slick and modern, yet still kind of homey and friendly. If I were staying at Disney alone or as a party of two, the studio would have been fine. Pool was perfect for my 8 year old and lifeguards were top notch. At one point, a lifeguard jumped in the pool when a little boy whose mother stood by got scared at the end of the slide. After he was â€œrescuedâ€�, he slid down the slide again and his mother got in the pool. The size of the pool is not overwhelmingly big, but I wouldnâ€™t call it small, either. As for the grounds, they were very clean. Employees were friendly and service was perfect as usual at Disney. The only thing I didnâ€™t like about our stay was every morning and every evening and even during the late afternoon, the halls would have trays of old, partially eaten room service food. At first, we just ignored it â€“ one or two trays in a hallway is not unusual for a hotel. But we noticed throughout the duration of the stay that the trays outside doors seem to multiply as more people checked in. Other than the icky trays in the hallways for extended periods of time, we really loved Bay Lake Tower and are looking forward to our next stay. The one bedroom units are a world of difference from the studios â€“ much larger and what youâ€™d expect from a vacation club type property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: gardeniaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at BLT for one night in a studio. We paid for a Bay Lake view, but we had a 6th floor room with a view of the Magic Kingdom to the left, Bay Lake to the right. It was a perfect place for viewing the "Wishes" fireworks. The balconies are constructed in such a way that they are incredibly private; you can't see your neighbors, they can't see you, which is nice. The room itself is quite small, but laid out well enough that it doesn't feel cramped. Our room was handicapped-accessible - not something we asked for or needed, and we would have preferred a regular room. The accessible layout has a larger bathroom with two showers, but a MUCH smaller kitchenette. The kitchen counter was so small that the coffee maker hung partway over the edge of the sink. Not enough thought went into that! The pool is not very big, but really attractive and fun. It's one of those "safe" pools - no water deeper than 4 feet. The slide is really cool. There's a pool bar and beach adjacent to the pool, and you can also stroll right over to the Contemporary to use their marina and pool. There's no restaurants or shopping at BLT, but again, the Contemporary is a short stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect compliment to the resort choices at WDW!”
Reviews.Author: relaxalot2
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay at Bay Lake Towers during late August. We realized this being a newly opened resort, their could be glitches. The only notable disturbance was a middle of the night fire evacuation on our first night, but upon inquiry the following day we were told everyone was safe and the alarm sounded because a door to the room where they keep the helium tanks was left ajar by the service staff. Oh well, we were safe, right? The room was amazing. Very modern and sleek design. We stayed in a one bedroom with lagoon view. The living area had a sleeper sofa and a sleeper chair, so our children were able to have their own beds every night. The jacuzzi tub and powerful shower head was amazing to our sore and achy bodies following long days at the parks! Although we would have preferred a MK view, the lagoon view gave us first look at the electric water pagaent nightly, we thought that was a nice perk. Location is SO important in WDW, and this resort is perfectly located next to MK, easy walking distance and the monorail at the Contemporary. Navigating the park system from BLT was very easy and we never felt pressed for time. I would recommend Bay Lake Tower to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Lake Tower - our home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: lindabobhat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bay Lake Tower last month for a long weekend. We are DVC Owners and this was our first trip "home." We booked a 2 bedroom villa/condo with a Bay Lake View. I had read that even numbered rooms were on the outer part of the crescent and offered partial Magic Kingdom views, so I requested just that, on a high floor. Our room request was honored - we got room #8102. It was the last room on the outer side heading left from either elevator bank. A long walk, but well worth it to only have neighbors on one side. And considering that our only neighbor liked to smoke on their balcony, this was a big plus (it's a big plus no matter what - we stay in hotels a lot and love to be at the end of the hall away from the elevators = much less hallway noise.) We had a dedicated 2 bedroom unit, which means rather than a 1 bedroom lock off combined with a studio, it was an open unit with a distinct 2nd bedroom with 2 queen beds, and no additional mini-kitchen. We specifically booked this kind of unit and were very happy with it. I took the master, my mother-in-law and son took the 2nd bedroom, and my daughter opted for the sleeper chair in the living room (she could have had the queen sofa bed but liked the cozy chair better.) It was plenty of nice private space for the 4 of us and would have easily accomodated more comfortably. We could have dealt with a 1 bedroom unit, but I didn't mind splurging on the extra points since we only stayed for 3 nights. Highlights/Pros: Easy check-in; we did the online check in and arrived at 2PM on a Thursday afternoon. There was no line at the 'express" desk at the Contemporary Resort. Our room was not ready, but they texted us just an hour later to say it was ready, and included the room number in the text message. it was a smooth, easy process. I didn't think checking in next door at the CR was particularly complicated or difficult. Big spacious condo - I highly recommend asking for an even numbered room, as they are in the outer part of the crescent shape of the building - this makes for a wider living area because it's on the outer part of the curve. If you look at some of the other pictures in the reviews, the inner units facing the pool have straight lines - there are no barstools on the kitchen island and the living rooms are noticeably narrower. Nice modern decor - this is not everyone's cup of tea, but it suits us perfectly. We love modern, sleek hotels with clean lines. 3 wall mounted LCD TV's. 3 bathrooms in a 2 bedroom unit (and 2 bathrooms in a 1 bedroom unit.) Only one other Disney property offers this perk - Animal Kingdom Villas. The master bath is particularly nice. A separate shower with 2 shower heads (one rainfall head mounted on the ceiling.) The jacuzzi tub is adjacent to a slider wall so it can open up to the master bedroom. I didn't find this a particularly great feature, but if you had a true Magic Kingdom view you could feasibly watch the fireworks from the bathtub. I will say that the tub was a generous length - I am 5'10" and I enjoyed using it very much - I could get my whole body underwater. Fabulous views - Bay Lake straight ahead and to the right; Magic Kingdom to the left. We did not watch the fireworks from our room, but we could have if we wanted to. Fully equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances. Mind you, we only prepared simple breakfasts and snacks; it was perfectly functional and we could have gone a bit more elaborate with meal prep if we wanted. Great comfortable, luxurious beds - my daughter even loved the chair sleeper. Perfect location on the monorail via the CR next door. Yes, there was some walking involved but we enjoyed taking in all the scenery. Same can be said for restaurants and shopping. Honestly, it kept the resort itself more quiet and relaxing - but we could get anything we wanted next door if we needed it. Best of both worlds if you ask me. Really nice pool, hot tub, water slide and splash pad. Plenty of lounge chairs, at least when we went there. Reasonable prices at the pool bar. Access to other pools at the CR if you wanted to check them out. Lowlights/Cons: First and foremost, the neighbor who smoked on his balcony. I had the sliding door open in my master, returned to my room and as I turned the corner, thought, "what is that smell?" It was just wafting into to my bedroom. I shut the door and called the front desk. They said they would send security up to handle. We left the room for the evening. Returned later to relax and enjoy the balcony and he was smoking again. I called the front desk once more. I didn't have to deal with him smoking anymore, but he liked to throw his cigarette package wrapping and foil insert on my balcony - I found this twice. I think it was his subtle way of letting me know he was mad that I complained. Despite the resort only having been open for less than 2 months, the rooms were already showing some wear and tear. I also hated the way the dark laminate cabinets and furniture showed dust and fingerprints. DVC members don't get housekeeping so this was especially noticeable after the first day. One of the faucet handles in the master bathroom was broken. The A/C was not very efficient. It was hot when we checked in so I set the thermostat down to about 68. It was still hot. I couldn't even put on makeup without breaking a sweat. I turned it down to 65 (as low as it would go) waited overnight to see if it kicked in but no such luck. Called maintenance, who came up before we left to go swimming. She said it was fixed, but it really wasn't much better. Maybe a little cooler, but I left it on 65 - if I did that at home I would be freezing and it wasn't even close. If we had stayed more than 3 nights, I'd have likely complained again. Overall, I was very pleased with our stay and plan to stay here again. Since I'm a DVC member and it's our home resort, that's pretty much a given. But we really liked the decor, the layout, etc. The resort really does suit us. We also enjoyed watching the fireworks up in the lounge, which was a really nice perk of being a DVC owner here. Speaking of DVC perks, our internet access was free. As others have mentioned, there is only one HSIA port in the master bedroom - you could bring a wireless router with if this doesn't work for you. And to those who are not DVC members and complained about paying $9.95 a day for access, this is true of ALL Disney properties. There are, however, several free Wi-fi sites at the various properties if you just need occasional access. I don't think this is outrageous. Most mid to upscale hotels (Hyatt, Marriott & Sheraton to name a few, charge the same exact daily fee for internet access.) By the way, we ordered room service once - typical, adequate, slightly overpriced fare, much like any hotel. I was truly glad they offered it, but it was nothing out of the ordinary.

HotelInfo.Name: Bay Lake Tower at Disney's Contemporary Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 4600 North World Drive, Lake Buena Vista, Orlando, FL 32830
